name: Python and front-end Developer
description:
SURROUND Australia is seeking a Python Web Applications Developer to work on full stack web applications with a particular focus on Python web frameworks. The developer will work with our team of Semantic Web and Machine Learning specialists to provide data-centric products and cutting-edge proof-of-concept systems. This role will also require some Python-based data processing.

About us:
SURROUND is a data tech company focused on Knowledge Graph and various forms of AI, especially explainable AI. We are also very involved with Internet data standards and spatial data. We work for government and companies on complex systems and research contracts and are building up a portfolio of fairly unique products.

Position location and qualifications:
All SURROUND staff work from home and live in various cities in Australia so we are used to working almost entirely remotely. Due to this, you may live in quite a range of places for this work within Australia or New Zealand. Australian citizenship is highly desirable and, even more so, Baseline government security clearance.

Scope of Work:

  • Implementing web apps using Python web frameworks, particularly Flask
  • Implementing web UIs for applications - this will involve HTML and JavaScript development
  • Building front-end components for a large, enterprise, data management system
  • Some CI/CD work to maintain apps
  • Some cloud systems management for web app delivery
  • Some Python data processing

Experience:

  • Demonstrable experience with Python web frameworks
  • Demonstrable experience with front-end web development, both “look and feel” HTML and styling and JavaScript frameworks
  • Demonstrable work with CI/CD and cloud platforms
  • While the successful applicant will have previous work experience, we are open to interviewing applicants at different points in their careers and then tailoring the work and pay to suit

Target Skills:

  • Python language and libraries – general software engineering and web app frameworks. You must be familiar with the use of Python libraries
  • Front-end development – both layout/display and frameworks
  • Some sense of style – we want pleasant looking applications! Full-on graphics design isn’t required but you must be able to make front-ends that don’t hurt the eyes
  • Learning – our projects are all different and applicants will need to be able to learn continuously while on the job
  • Finishing – we need someone who can complete work by themselves, a finisher. We are looking for team members who can take full responsibility for project components and bring them to completion

Contract length: 12 months

Application Deadline: 12/10/2020

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $80,000.00 – $100,000.00 per year

Experience:

  • web development: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Eligibility:

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Required)

Work Remotely:

  • Yes

name: Front End Web Developer
description:
Company description

This is a good opportunity to get in the ground floor of a vibrant new venture. BuildYou is a new startup looking to challenge the current practises of the building and property management industries. We offer services that allow builders to better manage their completed projects with an emphasis on customer care over their lengthy warranty period. From defects, document management and quality data, we provide it and so much more!

Job description

Summary:

We are looking for a hard-working, likeable and competent individual to build out our platform’s frontend.

We will be looking for people who are smart and are even smarter with their soft-skills. You will need to be dependable and collaborative and we will be encouraging you to take initiative and learn when you can.

Skills:

It’s ok if you’re new to the industry. People who can learn quickly, and love what they do can be just as capable as someone with five years experience and a degree. Whether you’re someone who has tinkered as a hobby, is a student looking for a side job or a bright spark with some frontend skills, we’re open to having you join us.

That said, we want to see some demonstration of the following:

  • The ability to write clean, optimised and performant code. We want you to have pride in what you create.
  • A good understanding of frontend web technologies and the use of HTML, CSS, and Javascript
  • Comfort with Git and version control
  • Understanding of web request cycles and API usage

For Extra Brownie Points:

  • Knowledge of javascript frameworks is a plus but not mandatory, if you like a particular library or process, go for it
  • An eye for design and an appreciation for the beauty of a well developed application

Interested? Contact us today !!

Contract length: 5 months

Part-time hours: 25 per week

Application Deadline: 28/10/2020

Expected Start Date: 28/10/2020

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Salary: $25.00 – $45.00 per hour

Work Remotely:

  • Yes

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity, we would love to hear from you! Please send your resume to jobs@freedomkitchens.com.au

By applying for roles with us you will be consenting to complete relevant background checks and you have the appropriate working rights in Australia.

name: 2021 Apple Internship - Information Systems and Technology
description:
Summary

Posted: Sep 21, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200193651
Imagine what you could do here? At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Every role at Apple is crafted around our intention to leave the world a better place than we found it. The Information Systems & Technology (IS&T) organization produces key business and technical infrastructure at Apple — handling orders from the online store, creating applications that enhance the retail store experience, providing network bandwidth for our services around the world, processing every transaction in iTunes and closing the financial books. IS&T does it all. If you’re a born problem solver who enjoys collaborating on the next big thing, we may just have your dream internship.
Key Qualifications
  • Pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree
  • Graduating in calendar year 2021-2022
  • 3.0 minimum GPA / Distinction average
  • Leadership experience
  • Driven and dynamic with strong problem solving skills
  • Excellent quantitative and interpersonal skills
  • Good communication and presentation skills (English)
  • Programming experience in one or more of the followings: iOS, MacOS, Swift, C, C++, Python, R, TensorFlow, Ruby, Go, Java, JavaScript, React, VueJS, Angular, HTML, CSS, Kubernetes, MySQL, PostgreSQL
  • Database knowledge in SQL, Non-SQL, Oracle or Teradata
  • Knowledge in iOS development, web development, UI/UX, rest webservices, API, NLP, AI/ML, Tableau, or ThoughtSpot
Description
The Apple IS&T Internship is a 6-month immersion into Apple that is designed for you to develop hands on technical experience. It offers a variety of assignments, ranging from special projects for new business initiatives to operations in a rapidly growing and dynamic setting. Interns benefit from a combination of training and project-oriented, on-the-job work experience. We offer a variety of internship positions within the organization: - Software Engineer - Data Science Engineer - Data Visualisation Engineer - Mobile App Developer A sample of IS&T teams that you could work with are: - Retail & eCommerce - Applied Machine Learning - Partner Solutions & Technology - Infrastructure Software Development - Intelligence Enterprise - Collaboration & Productivity You will build an innovative solution that creates an impact to the Apple Business or Customer Experience. You should have a solid technical background, learn new things fast and enjoy refining your work over and over again.
Education & Experience
Undergraduate/Graduate degree, major in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science and Analytics, Math, Statistics, Economics or related fields of study
Additional Requirements

Visa sponsorship is not offered at this time. While many other teams at Apple will consider visa sponsorship for internships, IS&T does not.

Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.

name: VB Developer
description:
MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting the lives of Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers, and we never lose sight of it.

Our Purpose

MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group, one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide over 1.5 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night.

Our purpose is supported by Our Values of Do What’s Right, Deliver Together, Make it Simple, Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers and each other that defines who we are.

Our Strategy

Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment, energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance, working together, that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all at MLC Life Insurance to be at their best every day, we offer a flexible work environment centred on development, wellbeing, recognition and contribution.

With more than 1,600 people nationally, we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.

The Role

We are currently looking to recruit a VB Developer to join us on our Sanagi program of work. This is a 4 month contract opportunity.

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Operate within the lightweight control and governance mechanisms that are used by the team and comply with the regulatory and legal landscape requirements
  • Monitoring and Support Overnight & Daily Processes & Jobs
  • Continuous Improvement Processes & Jobs
  • Minor Enhancements to SSIS and SSAS
  • Tuning Code to Improve Performance
  • Manage efficiently Incidents & Problems, managing to the priorities
  • Analyse Issues and or Requirements coming up with efficient solutions to Business and IT Problems
  • Identify and raise opportunities for continuous improvement in the Platform health and performance, from both a delivery and operations perspective. This may include automated testing, automated scripts for deployment and developing code which is easily tested


About You

We are looking for a Developer with the following attributes and skills:

  • Strong experience with Microsoft SQL server
  • Strong experience across Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Exposure and experience with Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Service (SSAS)
  • Exposure and experience with Microsoft Server Business Intelligence
  • Strong SQL & SQL tuning Experience
  • Experience supporting complex ETL & Integration Projects
  • Strong Analytics experience
  • Experience working in environments that follow DevOps principles and good working knowledge and experience in tools such as Bamboo, Chef, Puppet, CI/CD tooling and modern source code management systems
  • Knowledge of the life insurance or finance industry

Why Choose Us?

At MLC Life Insurance, you will have the opportunity to:

  • work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality
  • enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution
  • embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading, most trusted Life Insurer
  • access CircleIn Parental Support - an online support resource for our working parents
  • access a range of benefits including competitive salary, lifestyle leave, two days volunteer leave every year, recognition of service milestones; and
  • wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program, as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.

Should an applicant be the preferred candidate, background checks (including Federal Police Checks, Employment checks, ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates, however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position.


Primary Location: AU-VIC-Docklands
Work Locations: Level 16, 727 Collins St Level 16 727 Collins St Docklands 3008
Job: Business Enablement
Organization: MLC Limited
Schedule: Contractor
Employee Status: Group Level 3
Full-time

name: Graduate Developer
description:
• Supportive and flexible working environment
  • Training & development opportunities in areas that matter to you
  • Health & wellbeing program

Canstar is Australia’s biggest financial comparison website. For over 25 years, Canstar has been researching and rating financial and consumer products.
We employ over 150 staff with a diverse range of educational and professional backgrounds. We take pride in the cultural and gender diversity of our staff and our ability to offer our people the opportunity to grow and develop their skills as the company grows too.

Canstar’s technology team are digitally-focused, data-driven IT professionals focused on implementing and undertaking IT projects for our websites as well as developing and maintaining a suite of internal applications. As a Graduate Developer in the Technology Product team, you will be responsible for assisting with end-to-end development projects in an agile environment while learning on the job through the support of your colleagues and manager.

What Canstar Offers:
  • Supportive and flexible working environment
  • Birthday leave
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Health & Wellbeing program including monthly massages
  • Fun social club and company culture
  • Training and development opportunities in areas that matter to you
What You Will Be Doing:
  • Update code and convert to new platform
  • Perform code reviews and peer reviews
  • Set up development environment
  • Undertake test scripts and record any results/ issues
  • Find faults, diagnose and fix bugs
  • Contribute to the configuration and deployment of releases
  • Contribute to projects such as visitor to customer initiatives, site migration and website redesign
  • Learn about other developments and technologies
  • Write technical documentation and operating manuals
  • Work as an effective member of our growing development team
What You Need To Bring To The Role:
  • Relevant university qualification
  • 1-2 years experience (through work, study or personal projects) in:
    • Angular
    • Javascript
    • Python
    • Node.js
    • Git and bitbucket
    • SQL queries
    • HTML, CSS
  • Flexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologies
  • Strong communication skills and a collaborative nature
  • Highly self-motivated and directed
  • A passion for problem-solving
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
What Will Give You The Extra Edge:
  • Experience with AWS or Serverless is highly desirable
How Can You Join The Team:
If this sounds like you, and you are up for a fresh challenge with a great company, please click apply now and ensure that your CV and cover letter has been uploaded to your profile.
Please contact Canstar’s Talent Attraction Specialist, Emily Conaghan, via careers@canstar.com.au for general enquiries.

Applications close 5pm Friday 30 October 2020.

name: APS 6 Software Developer
description:
• Service One
  • $85,417 - $94,456

ONGOING VACANCY –
APS 6 Software Developer
Technology and Digital Services, CSB, Canberra (C00406)

Duties
AFMA is seeking a suitably qualified individual to fill the role of Software Developer within the Corporate Services Branch, located in our Canberra office.

The Software Developer, under the direction of the Applications Development Manager, will work as part of a small agile development team to assist in the enhancement, maintenance and future development of AFMA systems. The successful applicant will analyse requirements, develop code, and implement unit tests. Also be responsible for maintaining and updating documentation on systems you work on.

With the agency modernising its systems and evaluating the implementation of emerging technologies, this exciting position will draw on your current skills and/or ability to learn skills related to the Azure DevOps and Azure environments, including contributing to the transition of on premise applications to a cloud environment.

The candidate must have excellent technical knowledge, agile experience, team focus and the ability to adapt to a dynamic environment with changing priorities.

Experience in delivering a genuine transformational concept utilising agile development practices within a Government agency will be highly regarded.

Please refer to the position description for further information.

Eligibility
AFMA staff are employed under the Australian Public Service Act 1999. All applicants must be Australian citizens.

The successful applicant must hold or have the ability to obtain and maintain a baseline security clearance.

Notes
An order of merit may be established to fill future ongoing and non-ongoing vacancies.

AFMA’s Majura Park office has an office setup that has an increased focus on agility and collaborative workspaces. Our technology and environment is built around activity based work where staff are not allocated a desk.

AFMA’s method of submission for applications is via our online Recruitment system. Please check our website http://afmacareers.nga.net.au/cp/index.cfm for more information on how to apply.

Before applying for this vacancy we advise you read the position description and Integrated Leadership System (ILS) tool associated with the classification of this vacancy.

name: WordPress Developer / Website Developer
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

Join one of the Central Coast’s leading marketing agencies, and be part of a dynamic award winning team!

We are a full service creative marketing agency looking to hire a full-time “Full Stack Developer”, who is passionate about making an impact on the success of our clients’ businesses.

You will be able to demonstrate your ability to effectively communicate with clients and team members, a willingness to take direction and learn, as well as initiative in solving problems and creating efficiencies. You must be passionate about delivering outstanding results and driven to succeed.

As well as back-end skills with PHP and MySQL, technical skills and experience working with WordPress, both Theme and Plugin development, will be a significant advantage.

General knowledge of website hosting, Linux, cPanel, as well as knowledge of .net, asp and other programming languages will also be advantageous.

You will be working with our creative team to develop websites, breaking down their designs into functional templates / pages / emails. You will also be required to develop plugins and add other functionalities.

We are looking for someone to focus largely on backend development; working heavily in WordPress you will be developing custom solutions to complex client challenges.

If you’re ambitious, motivated, forward-thinking, and you get a kick out of creating solutions with tech – this is the opportunity for you!

This is the dream – live AND work on the Central Coast doing something you love with people who are serious about success.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop WordPress Plugins
  • Integrating with APIs from other software solutions
  • Customise website layouts based on direction from our designers
  • Launching websites
  • Developing solutions utilising WordPress
  • Troubleshooting issues that crop up from time to time on websites
  • Work with an manage our Github repository

SKILLS AND REQUIREMENTS

Required Skills
  • WordPress knowledge and experience
  • Working knowledge of HTML5, CSS & Javascript
  • Php, MySQL
Highly Desired Skills
  • Bachelor Degree in Related field
  • Good task management, prioritisation and decision making skills
  • Ability to operate autonomously, as well as within a team environment

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Friendly work environment promoting work/life balance (most of the time at least)
  • A workplace where we work hard but have a good laugh
  • Fast growing business with lots of future opportunities
  • A competitive salary based on your experience
  • Creative work environment. We love fresh, new ideas and creative thinking

HOW TO APPLY

If you meet the above requirements and you have current working rights in Australia, apply now.

No overseas or out of state applicants as you will be required to work in the West Gosford office. Include your up to date resume and covering letter.

Only applications submitted through seek HERE will be considered.

name: Entry Level Web Developer
description:
The Country Fire Authority (CFA) is one of the world's largest, and most highly regarded, community-based emergency services organisations. We respond to fire and other emergencies 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Whilst our firefighters are the cornerstone of CFA services, what goes on behind the scenes is just as important in helping to protect lives and property.
About the Role: CFA delivers a wide range of web-based services to the community, CFA personnel and other agencies. A Web Developer within CFA Communications & Stakeholder Relations is a member of a dedicated design and development team responsible for the ongoing development of a range of web-based systems and web content across various online platforms.
The successful candidate will have: • A qualification in Information Technology or related field with entry level practical experience• Skills in HTML, CSS/SCSS & JavaScript and experience using industry standard tools for wire-framing, prototyping and web analytics• Understanding of CFA or another similar volunteer-based organisation highly desirable• Experience in working with content management systems.• Skills in Adobe design software eg Photoshop, Dreamweaver• Understanding of design layouts and fundamentals• Up-to-date knowledge of user interface and user experience trends, techniques, technologies and frameworks.• Problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to changing circumstances.• Good written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills, with the ability to develop effective relationshipsYour ApplicationWhen applying for a position with CFA, the key to progressing in the selection process is the quality of your application. Your application must demonstrate that you have the qualifications, experience, key attributes and skills required for the position.
Applicants must address the selection criteria outlined in the attached position description.
Your application should include: • Cover letter• Responses to the Key Selection Criteria as outlined in the Position Description• Resume
Please note: (if internal)• Transfers on a fixed term basis or higher duties assignments require the approval of your current manager.• Only CFA employees are eligible to apply for positions that have been advertised internally.Submitting your ApplicationWhen you click the 'apply' button you will be taken to the online application form. Here you will be asked to provide personal and contact details and respond to employment-related questions.
The successful applicant will be required to complete a National Police History Check.
CFA supports flexible working arrangements and is committed to being an inclusive, fair and child safe organisation for all staff, volunteers and the community.

name: Junior CRM Developer
description:
Metricon Homes, a leading multi award winning new home builder is committed to recruiting outstanding individuals who share our passion for delivering quality, service and award winning living solutions for Australian families.

With your junior / intermediate skills, build your career with a firm foundation. The role will focus on Level 2 or 3 Help Desk support but will move into a Junior CRM Developer over time as you build on your skills.

    Reporting to the Development Operations Manager, your responsibilities will include:
  • Provide application support and be the escalation point for more complex issues;
  • Develop systems to meet the requirement of the business;
  • Work with agile practices to deliver sprints to the stakeholder and team;
  • Troubleshoot technical complex issues and drive them through to resolution;
  • Assist in the build and delivery of new key product features, integration points and functionality and enhance and maintain existing product capabilities.
    Metricon will offer you:
  • A competitive salary and salary package opportunities;
  • Genuine career advancement opportunities;
  • Generous housing discounts on our award winning homes; and
  • Supportive and great team culture where great work is recognised.
    The successful candidate will have:
  • Bachelor qualification in Computer Science, engineering or related discipline.
  • 6-12 month professional experience of programming using Microsoft Dynamics CRM is essential;
  • Experience in developing and configuring of CRM Applications
  • Ability to juggle service desk escalations and doing development work for scrum/project teams
  • Knowledge in any of the following programming technologies: C# .NET, MVC Framework, ASP.NET
  • Knowledge in using any of the following code repositories: GIT, GitHub, Bitbucket, VSTS, TFS, Azure DevOps
  • Knowledge in any of the following database technologies: SQL, MySQL, PostGRE
  • Knowledge in agile, scrum or waterfall software development methodologies;
  • Can quickly learn software products and its functionalities
  • Good at managing time efficiently and effectively
  • Able to handle competing priorities with strict timelines.

This role requires a national police check to be undertaken.

name: CARS COM Integration Developer
description:
• Act as a Key Subject Matter Expert in our CARS COM Team;
  • Full Time, Permanent Opportunity;
  • Mile End Location, great flexibility.

About RAA:


As one of the state’s largest and most iconic organisations, we’re proud to keep our members – and SA – moving in the right direction. More than 750,000 members choose us to deliver peace of mind through our trusted range of motor, home and travel products and services. We’re also one of the state’s largest employers (and growing!), with more than 1000 employees working collectively with the common goal to keep our members moving.


About the role:


RAA is a trusted South Australian brand, and it’s is growing –fast. We’re already a complex and robust business that’s been serving SA members for 115 years. And as we scale, we are focused on evolving our technology across a broad range of areas. So, over the next five years, our IT experts will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our business.


We’re looking for people with passion. People who can bring diverse thinking to the table. People with strong business acumen and an innovative spirit. Whatever your area of expertise is, you’ll be joining a supportive team with a collaborative and engaged culture where you can use your skills to make a real impact.


You’ll be given the power to make moves that matter.


Responsibilities:


Reporting to the Service Delivery Manager, CARS COM, you will hold key accountability for the successful design, development, testing, release deployment and maintenance support of the national ACC Integration platform. You will have a fantastic opportunity to undertake a variety of integration projects, acting as the subject matter expert in performing the key duties required of the role:


  • Developing and maintaining the CARS Integration solution and supporting this environment to meet identified business needs;
  • Building strong professional relationships with the CARS COM team, national Club Delivery teams and national Club integration SME’s;
  • Leading in the troubleshooting and rectification of CARS Integration issues;
  • Effectively collaborating with key stakeholders and liaising with external vendors as required;
  • Implementing of Azure DevOps CI/CD pipelines;
  • Identifying opportunities within the wider CARS Applications Solutions team, and providing assistance in the implementation of new processes and technology improvements, where needed;
  • Participating in ACC Integration projects and initiatives and acting as a technical expert on areas of design, development, testing, release and deployment for integration components;
  • Maintaining a high level of customer awareness and familiarisation with customer integration interfaces and requirements; and
  • Participating in the provision of 24x7 production support, 2nd level fault analysis, incident, and problem management on ACC integration services and associated interfaces.

What you need:


At RAA we hire on cultural fit first and technical fit second! However, to be successful in the role you will need to have:


  • Tertiary Qualification in IT / Computer Science or a related discipline; or relevant industry experience;
  • A minimum of 5+ years of related experience in IT software design, development, and support using Microsoft Technologies;
  • A minimum of 3+ years of experience in design and implementation of integration solutions, preferably including REST APIs, Event Driven/Queue based integrations, Web Services, Enterprise Service Bus, Message oriented Middleware, Data modelling, Service Modelling, Integration patterns, Azure DevOps CI/CD pipeline and security;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of:
    • .Net Framework 4.5, ASP.NET 4.0, .NET Core, IIS 8.0, WCF services, ActiveMQ, SQL Server 2012 and sound SQL knowledge is mandatory, as well as sound knowledge in XML, JSON, XSD Schemas and XSLT Transforms;
    • RESTful API, WCF, and SOAP services is mandatory;
    • Microsoft Server environments and services, integration platforms, patterns and practices will be highly regarded;
    • Visual Studio 2019, Microsoft Team Foundation Server, Azure DevOps CI/CD, Git source control, JMS messaging integration will be highly regarded;
    • Integration debugging, monitoring and testing tools (such as SOAPUI, POSTMAN, Wireshark, Fiddler, Linux TCP Dump, will be highly desirable; and
    • Microservices in Azure and Microsoft Azure Components such as Service Fabric, Azure functions, and API management will be highly advantageous.

Your sound understanding of application development standards & methodology along with your strong analytical skills and ability to absorb information, assess and find solutions will see you succeed in this role. Furthermore, your ability to create processes, your practical and realistic mindset coupled with your excellent communication skills and ability to work in a strong team environment will add further to your success.


What we offer:


  • Free RAA Premium Road Service
  • Discounts on all RAA Products and Services
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Onsite Massage, Wellbeing Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • Annual Bonus Incentive
  • On-site Café

How to apply:


Follow the prompts to send us a cover letter (addressed to Selina Radetti, Recruitment Consultant) and a CV. Please upload as one document in PDF format. Applications close 9am on Thursday, 15th October 2020.

Any applications sent from agencies won’t be considered.


We’re committed to building a workplace that’s diverse and inclusive, where employees are embraced for their unique qualities and valued for their contributions. We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in everyone, and helps us to give our members better service.

name: Back End Developer
description:
Two fixed term roles available to support the LES MILLS™ Media team to deliver world class web and app experiences.
  • Two roles – both six month fixed term
  • Exciting and high growth digital product suite
  • Purpose-led, global business

Purpose and passion: it’s a potent combination that drives us to achieve true greatness. At Les Mills International, unlocking and amplifying that inner drive to achieve goals is something we’re not shy to say we’re great at. We do it for millions of people around the globe each week by delivering life-changing fitness experiences. And we do it every day for our own team by providing a mandate to thrive, to play to strengths and to be proud of the part we play in creating a fitter planet.

LES MILLS™ On Demand is changing the game when it comes to working out at home. With a true start-up spirit driving the team to success, we’re putting 1000+ workouts at our customers’ fingertips – on their devices in the comfort of their own homes. We’ve a bold vision and big plans for this innovative offering, so come and jump in on the action.

This role will lead the design and implementation of back end microservices for Les Mills digital products. We operate with AWS serverless technologies alongside a modern tech stack of integrated SaaS services.

This role will be part of a wider agile team, including tech design, UI design, mobile and web development, QA and product. We’re seeking a highly collaborative team player, with strong experience in AWS development, and a good understanding of micro service patterns, development cycles and multiple programming languages.

It’s an exciting time for us right now as we surge towards some steep growth goals and industry-leading innovations. We are an organization committed to providing a flexible, diverse and inclusive environment. In return for all you bring to us, we’ll return serve by giving you every chance to exercise your passion, and thrive with a company that’s out to change the world.

name: Salesforce/SaaS Developer
description:
SUMMARY OF PURPOSE

The role is primarily responsible for building, customising, and supporting our internal Salesforce and cloud/SaaS platforms (Service Now, Zendesk). It involves writing new applications and maintaining our various tools and processes around the current cloud platforms at Vocus.

Reporting to the Head of Digital for Vocus, this is a key role as part of our SaaS team within the larger digital and wider technology group. Vocus have over 600 staff across NZ and a large technology division to support our brands and services from the consumer market to the enterprise and government sector.


KEY FUNCTIONS

  • Building new applications, systems, and processes and supporting existing technologies in Salesforce and other cloud platforms
  • Writing code to integrate salesforce with internal billing platforms and other cloud platforms
  • Checking and validating application code by other teams and dealing with business data queries, creating reports, and resolving process errors.
  • Design and documentation of software and interfaces to allow ongoing regular tasks to be automated.
  • Develop clear, expandable, and documented source code to allow for potential modification and collaborative work with other areas of the business.
  • Provide objective recommendations for software changes to meet needs of the growing company.
  • Liaise with other application and web teams to ensure appropriate delivery of updates.
  • Provide documentation and training to other IT staff to ensure adequate support coverage of systems achieved.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

  • 2-4 years' experience in customizing, integration and working with SaaS platforms like Salesforce, ServiceNow etc.
  • Salesforce development, administration and cloud certifications highly desirable i.e. Salesforce Advanced Administrator Certification, Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I, II etc.
  • Knowledge of APEX classes, controllers, SOQL and triggers.
  • Developing experience on Lightning builder, including custom components and lightning Apps
  • Any skills/experience in C# .NET, .NET CORE and/or SQL Server, ORM would be advantageous
  • Experience in developing Restful APIs with/without API gateway-microservices framework would be advantageous
  • Understanding/knowledge of JavaScript, HTML, CSS and JS Frameworks like Angular, Vue would be advantageous
  • Experience with working in Agile Scrum environment would be advantageous
  • Some experience with, or at least an appreciation of SOA environments, and the design and development of reusable software
  • Experience with GIT, VSO/Azure DevOps and/or other version control software

name: Fixed Term Summer Internship Software Developer in Christchu...
description:
This employer is a healthcare innovation company that provides technology-based solutions to improve health care. The company is an established developer of 3D scanning and modelling technology for varied applications including, orthotics, prosthetics, skin and wound care. This employers primary solution, Silhouette, is a suite of products for imaging, measuring and documenting soft tissue and skin lesions, including wounds. Silhouette is used in both clinical practice and clinical trial environments, with more than 100 phase I to IV clinical studies globally having used it to provide accurate data for analysis.

Silhouette provides a lot of flexibility in the ability for each customer to have their own custom set of note fields that will be captured as part of a clinical assessment. However currently Silhouette is lacking a way for the customer to be able to set up and manage these as required. The project would be to design and build an admin user interface for this area of the product. This will involve writing both frontend code (typescript/html/css) as well as implementing some backend http apis (c# and asp. net).

The student would ideally be a 3 or 4th year Software Engineering student.

If this sounds like you, apply now!

name: Integration Support Analyst
description:
Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Job Description

Join our team and experience Workday!

Do you have what it takes to continuously provide outstanding Customer Support? Are you ready to take your knowledge of Application Integration, collaborating and problem solving to resolve Customer issues? We have a unique opportunity within the Workday Support team for a person with vision, a passion for excellence and a track record of success. This is not a role answering questions - it's about digging in and coming up with solutions to a variety of time sensitive, operational critical issues - it's about passion, innovation and excellence in a fast-paced and dynamic organization.

What would you do all day?

• Work directly with customers to research, troubleshoot, and lead resolution for integration issues in a timely manner

• Manage incoming case queue and maintain focus on resolving customer cases quickly and effectively in line with our service level agreements

• Clearly and succinctly document communications to customers using our issue management system

- Replicate and verify customer problems and log issues to development

A bit about you:

• Understanding of object-oriented and relational model concepts

• Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills

• Able to absorb new technologies and features quickly

• Excellent analytical, problem solving and multitasking skills

• Can work in a fast paced and fun team environment

• Team player who will work across the organization and company to continue improving the way we serve our customers

It would be really nice if you had:

• College degree in computer science or business systems

name: Python and front-end Developer
description:
SURROUND Australia is seeking a Python Web Applications Developer to work on full stack web applications with a particular focus on Python web frameworks. The developer will work with our team of Semantic Web and Machine Learning specialists to provide data-centric products and cutting-edge proof-of-concept systems. This role will also require some Python-based data processing.

About us:
SURROUND is a data tech company focused on Knowledge Graph and various forms of AI, especially explainable AI. We are also very involved with Internet data standards and spatial data. We work for government and companies on complex systems and research contracts and are building up a portfolio of fairly unique products.

Position location and qualifications:
All SURROUND staff work from home and live in various cities in Australia so we are used to working almost entirely remotely. Due to this, you may live in quite a range of places for this work within Australia or New Zealand. Australian citizenship is highly desirable and, even more so, Baseline government security clearance.

Scope of Work:

  • Implementing web apps using Python web frameworks, particularly Flask
  • Implementing web UIs for applications - this will involve HTML and JavaScript development
  • Building front-end components for a large, enterprise, data management system
  • Some CI/CD work to maintain apps
  • Some cloud systems management for web app delivery
  • Some Python data processing

Experience:

  • Demonstrable experience with Python web frameworks
  • Demonstrable experience with front-end web development, both “look and feel” HTML and styling and JavaScript frameworks
  • Demonstrable work with CI/CD and cloud platforms
  • While the successful applicant will have previous work experience, we are open to interviewing applicants at different points in their careers and then tailoring the work and pay to suit

Target Skills:

  • Python language and libraries – general software engineering and web app frameworks. You must be familiar with the use of Python libraries
  • Front-end development – both layout/display and frameworks
  • Some sense of style – we want pleasant looking applications! Full-on graphics design isn’t required but you must be able to make front-ends that don’t hurt the eyes
  • Learning – our projects are all different and applicants will need to be able to learn continuously while on the job
  • Finishing – we need someone who can complete work by themselves, a finisher. We are looking for team members who can take full responsibility for project components and bring them to completion

name: Senior Microsoft Developer, Permanent role
description:
ESR

  • Closing date: 05/10/2020
  • Full Time
  • Multiple Location Options

ESR is New Zealand’s Crown Research Institute specialising in science for communities. ESR uses world-leading science to safeguard our health, keep our communities safer, protect our food-based economy, and improve the health of our water and natural environment.

In response to the Covid-19 pandemic, ESR has an exciting opportunity to co-create world class systems and solutions together with their partners and clients to improve the notifiable disease system for New Zealand. In order to deliver on this opportunity, a new Scrum Team will be formed to work in an Agile manner (with two-week sprints) to focus on delivering leading solutions.

We are assisting ESR to identify a Senior Microsoft Developer, to be a part of this exciting journey. Reporting to the Development Lead, and in collaboration with other Developers, you will provide critical development expertise and thought leadership where you will have the opportunity to work with a new purpose-built Scrum team to design and implement market leading software solutions.

What is in it for you:

  • Flexi working available
  • Join a purpose-built product team
  • Senior role, have a voice in the product journey

Skills & Experience required:

A minimum of eight years of progressive work experience within a development team environment, using modern, current software technologies, preferably including

  • .NET, ASP.NET Core, EF Core, Angular, HTML5, CSS3
  • C#, LINQ, JavaScript, TypeScript, TSQL
  • NuGet, npm package managers
  • Visual Studio, VS Code, SSMS, PowerShell ISE
  • Unit, regression and integration testing
  • MVC, MVVM, REST
  • SOLID, OOP
  • Database integration and development (SQL Server)
  • UI/UX development best practice and design principles
  • Single Codebase design principles
  • Willingness to learn
  • SSIS, SSAS, SSRS
  • DevOps CI/CD
  • Containerisation using Docker
  • Git or similar
  • Build for Continuous Development, Build and Release
  • Test Driven Development, Unit & Integration Testing
  • Agile LEAN Development Principles (Mocking, Prototyping, Early Presentation & Stake Holder Engagement)

Desired but not Mandatory:

  • WinForms
  • Azure experience
  • AI/Machine Learning
  • A comprehensive understanding of the SDLC, Agile SCRUM and DevOps development methodologies and approach
  • A good understanding of responsive UI design principles
  • Familiarity with SQL Server Management Studio and Profiler
  • Familiarity with modern Functional and Procedural programming languages
  • Comfortable with development tools such as Visual Studio and modern code editors like Sublime and VS Code
  • Knowledge and experience designing for good application performance, monitoring, code metrics, maintainability and management
  • Actively keeping up with, learning and trying out current trends in software development and design
  • Experience and willingness to learn and mentor other team members
  • Ability to handle pressure and work to tight deadlines
  • Comprehensive understanding of working within Team Foundation Server
  • An understanding of microservices architecture patterns and best practice
  • Experience in systems analysis and requirements gathering
  • Formal education, training and/or work experience in Information Communication Technology, Science and/or Engineering
  • Demonstrated experience and understanding of laboratory requirements for Health / Environmental Science / Forensic Science
  • Relevant experience or training in specialised Laboratory Information Management Service solutions

Whilst this role is advertised in Wellington, this role may be based in either Wellington, Auckland or Christchurch.

Working at ESR: ESR aims to provide all employees with exciting and interesting work and opportunities for professional development. The provision of an energising work environment and a safe and healthy workplace is important. ESR encourage staff to maintain balanced lifestyles, recognise the importance of flexible working conditions and provision of opportunities for on-going personal and professional development. ESR proudly continues to work towards reflecting Te Tiriti o Waitangi, embedding a respect and increased awareness for tikanga Māori and Māori knowledge in their work.

To express your interest or apply for this role, please use the APPLY function in the first instance and/or contact Sureca.venter@findrecruitment.co.nz

Please note, applications close 12.00pm Monday 5 October.

name: Project Sales Consultant
description:
Company Description

Colliers International is a global property services company and best employer operating across 68 countries. We have a workforce of more than 17,000 professionals who think differently, share great ideas and provide service excellence to their clients.

Colliers have been involved in some of Auckland’s most successful developments – Alexandra Park Epsom, Fabric Onehunga, Boatshed Bay Snells Beach, OKLA Albany, Fraser Avenue Northcote, Kotuitui Manukau – all first-class residential developments marketed and sold by our leading Residential Projects team.

We have new and exciting affordable residential projects, well-designed and aimed at the most active part of Auckland’s residential market; these new projects will be in market over the coming months.


Job Description

Do you love real estate, enjoy architectural design and want to work with some of Auckland’s leading residential developers?

You may be starting your journey in residential sales and struggling to obtain listings or may be an experienced salesperson looking to try something different. Either way this opportunity is not one to be missed.

Our cutting-edge marketing programmes direct traffic to on-site sales display suites and straight to your phone, making your role a relatively simple one – listen to what prospective owners want and guide them through the different product offerings within the developments until they have enough information to be confident in purchasing their brand new home. How exciting!


Qualifications

We are looking for qualified salespeople that have a high level of customer service, proactive and effective electronic and personal communication skills, professional presentation and genuinely enjoy selling real estate. Your relationship management skills will be second to none, you will love working with prospects and purchasers, a team environment and be a results-driven professional.

You will be skilled at developing relationships to identify and connect with prospective purchasers from all backgrounds from initial enquiry stage right through to a successful sale, whilst collaborating with the wider Colliers network to maximise referral opportunities.

Please note you must hold a current Real Estate Salesperson's License to be eligible for this role.


Additional Information

Our current projects are aimed at the most active part of the residential market and we have a culture of excellence and collaboration that provides our people with the ideal platform to develop their skills and accelerate their careers. For you, this means a world of opportunity and the platform to learn, grow and succeed.

name: AEM Java Developer
description:
• Designing and developing high-volume, low-latency applications for mission-critical systems and delivering high-availability and performance.
  • Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements.
  • Writing well designed, testable, efficient code.
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle.
  • Ensure designs are in compliance with specifications.
  • Prepare and produce releases of software components.
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review.
  • Develop AEM solutions based on best practices.
  • Develop, document, and implement AEM Forms solutions.
  • Develop using TDD principles.
  • You have a keen eye for detail second to none.
  • You can produce a high standard of work in a very fast paced environment.
  • You are level headed, professional and approachable; personality is key as the team is very work focused.
  • You have excellent interpersonal skills, can manage your own workload and be extremely confident.
  • You enjoy being part of a diverse and inclusive team.
  • You have sound AEM/Adobe product knowledge, specifically:

o Content authoring

o Custom workflows

o Apache Sling

o OSGI o Tag management

o Custom metadata schemas and profiles

o Smart content and asset insights

o Information Architecture

o AEM Forms (HTLM5, XFA)

  • Basic knowledge of CSS and JavaScript is beneficial.
  • Experienced in test-driven development (TTD) methodologies using Junit and Mockito.
  • Experienced in object-oriented programming (OOP) principles, particularly using the Java language

Job Types: Full-time, Subcontract, Permanent

name: Customer Solutions Associate
description:
• Use your commerciality and intellect to provide exceptional customer service
  • Work enterprise wide to optimise customer experience and outcomes
  • Be part of an engaging agile team working to enable Aotearoa's energy future

Build exceptional relationships and enjoy a challenging and stimulating "business to business" role with truly meaningful work!

Transpower's Whakamana i Te Mauri Hiko - Empowering Our Energy Future reports outlines that electrification and renewable generation can provide over 50% of the non-forestry emissions reductions to achieve New Zealand's net carbon zero target by 2050 while significantly reducing household energy bills. Transpower's customers will be central to delivering this bright energy future.

About the opportunity

Due to our CSA taking on a new challenge within Transpower, we're seeking a Customer Solutions Associate to join our Customer Services team. You'll proactively manage the strategic relationships and day to day operations with our customers and stakeholders who connect directly to the grid, as well as developers and Infrastructure companies, for the benefit of New Zealand.

You'll be part of a tight knit agile team, working closely with the other Customer Solutions Associates and Relationship Managers, to establish and maintain positive relationships between Transpower and our customers.

The role is varied and includes:

  • Understanding the regulatory context within which Transpower operates
  • Operational customer and stakeholder management - you'll be the first point of contact for varied enquiries and problem resolution
  • Monthly bill preparation for existing customer contracts which is then passed to finance
  • Preparing reporting including insights and trend analysis
  • Interpreting and preparing contracts
  • Supporting our Relationship Managers to deliver key account plans

To be considered, your previous experience, CV and cover letter will demonstrate:

  • Well-developed communication and relationship management/customer centricity
  • Commercial/financial literacy
  • An ability to interpret and prepare contracts
  • The ability to manage expectations and balance multiple priorities at pace, ideally in a corporate environment
  • Experience working with cross functional teams to deliver for your customers and stakeholders

While not essential, the following experience will be highly regarded:

  • Experience with customer relationship management systems and agile tools (e.g. JIRA)
  • Electricity or Utility industry exposure
  • Process/continuous improvement experience

Why Transpower?

It's exciting! The scale, criticality and complexity of our enterprise is both stimulating and challenging. We are an equal opportunity employer and value the diversity of thought that comes from our people of over 28 nationalities.

How we are approaching our work is changing. We are looking to alternative ways of working which ensure business engagement that supports automation and efficiency goals.

You'll join a fun, hardworking team with great employee benefits - check them out here https://www.transpower.co.nz/about-us/careers/benefits and on the job professional growth and development over time.

Next Steps

We are committed to playing our role in helping to deliver a net zero carbon future for Aotearoa. To join our Customer Solutions Team within our Strategy Division, and enjoy working towards a new energy future, please review the position description below/via our website https://careers.transpower.co.nz/search and apply without delay.

Role closes Sunday 11th October however applications will be reviewed as they are received, and you may be asked to complete a video interview so we can get to know you better!

NB: Due to international border restrictions, we are only able to consider candidates currently residing in New Zealand with full work eligibility.

name: Intermediate Software Developer (C#.Net)
description:
Work on a variety of projects from end to end to really make a difference at the heart of central government

  • Agile, DevOps environment with a collaborative and supportive team
  • Deal directly with your customers to achieve great results
  • Build on your existing experience through working across the entire project lifecycle

The Treasury is the New Zealand Government's lead economic and financial advisor. Our vision is to be a world leading Treasury working towards higher living standards for New Zealanders. We provide corporate services to both ourselves and DPMC. Within IT, our Applications Team designs, develops and maintains software-based solutions ranging from web applications and databases to desktop and cloud applications.

The Opportunity

As an Intermediate Software Developer with us, you will work on a range of projects including the Government Budget Management System, workflow systems and web-based application development. You will have the opportunity to work across the entire software lifecycle and you will not just write well-structured code but you will be relied upon to engage effectively with the business to fully understand their needs, figure out what needs to be done and make it happen.

About You

As a skilled Software Developer with 2-3 years' hands on experience, the technical know-how and great soft skills that set you apart from others in your field. You'll also bring:

  • The ability to speak our language - .NET and C#, MVC, Entity Framework
  • An Understanding of data - SQL Server Data platform
  • Excellent problem-solving skills including research, analysis, evaluating alternatives, and creativity
  • A customer focused approach and the ability to see the big picture and be adaptable
  • A positive, can-do attitude, a team player attitude and strong inter-personal skills
  • A computer science or ICT related university degree or equivalent industry qualifications or experience.

About Us

We are small, friendly and collaborative team that works in a unique setting across two distinct agencies. It is a supportive environment, where we share ideas, learnings and celebrate team success. There is the opportunity to work with senior developers to hone your craft and we provide great exposure to working with business owners. We enjoy working on projects and upgrades but also carry out the little jobs amongst the bigger tasks. We value diversity and inclusion and encourage a positive work life balance so please talk to us about flexible work options.

Applications close - Monday 12 October. All applications must be made online.

name: Senior SmartCOMM Developer
description:
#CLOSER #BRAVER #FASTER

The Role

We're looking for a Senior SmartCOMM Developer to join our Customer Communications team here within Insurance Platforms at IAG! You will be responsible for handling the day-to-day initiatives and projects, working as a Senior Developer helping to lead the development cycle for our SmartCOMM/ Thunderhead applications.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Understand the SDLC model and what your specific activities are in designing and then delivering a solid, robust application;
  • Enhance coding and source code development standards;
  • Design and develop code that is clean, understandable, maintainable and extensible;
  • Design, develop and implement test plans to accurately test the application code, functions, modules and program;
  • Encourage maintenance of detailed and accurate documentation per all IAG standards;
  • Key contributor to the project estimation process reviewing and challenging where necessary, estimates for tasks;
  • Overseeing deployment of software components through non-production environments and where applicable into production and/or hand over to the relevant release team;
  • Pro-actively identify and recommend application improvements as part of the development or support activities and provide advice in situations where subtle changes to requirements yield savings in software development cost or application efficiency/performance;
  • Liaise with business system owners directly (where required) to refine requirements and provide guidance

Skills & Experience

  • Ideal candidate should have excellent CCM development experience with strong interpersonal/communication skills.
  • 5+ years using SmartCOMM/ Thunderhead
  • Sound knowledge of SMARTCOMM/ Thunderhead Suites of Products
  • Sound knowledge of Smart Communications Appliance Configuration and Deployment Models (Cloud/Hybrid)
  • Good knowledge about Thunderhead/Smart Communication API's
  • Should be well versed with preparation of the XML data schema and their mapping to business data objects
  • Hands on experience with template authoring, recognizing common graphical elements, information blocks, layouts, stylesets, variable data requirements and functional similarity
  • Should be well versed in creation of Static Layouts for Print and Responsive Layouts for Web
  • Good technical knowledge in creating Simple, Scriptable Batch Config/Template Selector and Output Configurations for post processing
  • Expertise in Java/J2EE, JSON, Web services is desirable

About Us

At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to:

#Proud to be me - we value difference, not sameness

#Together - harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to be our best for our customers & each other

#No boxes - it's not about labels, boxes or categories; It's about building a diverse and inclusive mindset into everything we do

IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand. We own some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC and WFI.

Let's Talk

Start your career journey with us and click 'Apply'! Applications close on Tuesday 6th October 2020

In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, up to 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.

At IAG we strongly believe to achieve success we must create a diverse and inclusive workforce. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and communities. IAG have committed to the reconciliation movement in Australia for First Nations people and focus on building a diverse culture by creating a safe and supportive work environment for all our employees. More information on our Reconciliation Action Plan can be found on our website: https://www.iag.com.au/reconciliation.

name: Developer Services Consultant
description:
Who are we?

MYOB is a business platform. Our purpose is to help more businesses in Australia and New Zealand start, survive and succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. To make all this happen, we are dedicated in creating an exceptional flexible employee experience for all team members and offer a culture where you can be yourself. We don’t want you to simply ‘fit’ into our already established culture, we want you to come and add to it, and make it even better!

We are looking for a passionate developer to help us craft software that brings real value for our clients to life!

More than just being a coder, this role provides the opportunity to collaboratively shape the work to be done, while honing your development skills to produce code that is maintainable, extensible and performant.

You will be working alongside a highly skilled team with diverse roles and skill sets.

To be successful in this role

  • 4+ years of validated .net development experience using C# in a professional capacity
  • Experience with web-based technologies as well as developing web-services and integration with 3rd party web-services
  • Firm grasp of database management systems such as MSSQL and MySql, including the ability to craft and analyse TSQL statements

The following would be helpful or advantageous for candidates:

  • Domain knowledge of financial or ERP systems
  • At least 1 year experience being part of a multi-functional team
  • Knowledge of\exposure to AWS
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

name: Junior Business Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Junior Business Analyst who will contribute to ongoing implementations globally on a broad range of technologies and platforms in the Fast Moving Consumer Goods industry. Some of the responsibilities of the role are working with on and offshore teams on product development projects in the following areas: Writing and reviewing functional specificationsExplaining functionality specifications to developers and testersReviewing pre-release functionality for compliance to specificationReviewing test plans for coverage of specificationsTriaging issues arising from testingInternal training on new features introduced in completed projectsParticipation in the development of white-papers for new product development projects based on gap analysis of the current product.Performing new product development feasibility studies.Developing functional specifications for new product development projects.Production of training materials, user and implementation guides.Reviewing the developed product to ensure that it meets with the white paper objectives.Developing content for product marketing materials.Researching and reporting on industry trends and activities.Researching and reporting on competitive products.Researching and reporting on implementation experiences by internal implementation groups and partners. The main requirements of the role include, but are not limited to the below (applicants will be required to provide evidence that they satisfy all of these requirements): 2 years’ experience in the phases of Design, Development, Testing and Release for Software release projects in the Consumer Goods Industry, including all of the below modalities of software products: Field Merchandizing SoftwareField Sales – Presell SoftwareField Sales – Van Sales SoftwareTelesales SoftwareDigital Merchandising SoftwareData Warehousing and Reporting SoftwareBack Office Administration Software”In addition to the above experience required, intermediate to advance proficiency in all of the following software/programs is a must: Microsoft B.Net, C#, HTML5, Javascript, CSS, SQL, Server Management Studio, VMWare, S3 Browser, Microsoft Visio, Power BI, Postman, Inflectra, SpiraTest, Inflectra SpiraTeam, Microsoft Project, and IIS. If you satisfy all of the above requirements and are interested in the role, register your interest in confidence by submitting your CV and a Cover Letter.

Applications are open from 25 September to 9 October.

name: Head of Development
description:
Head of Development

The Head of Development will operate at the leadership team level reporting to the CEO and will manage the development team consisting of Tech Leads, Senior Developers, Developers and Junior Developers.

They will have a close working collaboration relationship with the rest of the leadership team including Head of Delivery, Head of Sales & Marketing and the Head of Design & Strategy.

Lead and direct the software development process, setting short-term objectives and assessing progress as defined by the software development methodology.

Working with the Technical Leads with the definition of technical approach, solution design and tools required for building, testing and deploying sometimes very complex technical solutions for enterprise clients.

Key parts to the role:

  • Ensure the development teams deliver quality, working solutions to project specifications and requirements within time and budget.
  • Identify and address risks & issues relating to software development ensuring projects remain profitable.
  • Ensure maximum development efficiency through reuse and knowledge sharing to increase quality and profitability
  • Oversee and where necessary direct our technical recruitment process including reviewing applications and participating in the interview process to ensure our high-quality standards are maintained.

Other good stuff:

Technology Roadmap: Continuously apply significant knowledge of industry trends and development to improve the quality and timeliness of our solutions

Client services and pre-sales: Lead, prepare and deliver (in partnership with the Sales team) custom presentations, demonstrations, and solutions to the customer on the benefits of proposed solutions. Work with the sales team, delivery and development leads in a pre-sales capacity to provide in-depth technical support and estimates during the sales process

Communication: Demonstrate thought leadership including the ability to adjust communication style to suit different audiences i.e. talk in layman’s language for those less technical. Meet with prospective and existing clients to demonstrate and provide technical insight into different technologies that we are able to support.

Experience and skills needed:

  • A Technical leader who has a background in software development and managing teams
  • Significant experience leading, influencing and coaching development teams
  • To be engaged and having strategic conversations with senior executives including CTOs, CIOs and CEOs focussing on both business and technology outcomes.
  • Superior analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.
  • 10+ years of hands-on programming experience in a range of development technologies, preferably including .NET.
  • Understanding of enterprise architecture and related technical areas, and familiarity with systems lifecycle management and the related commercial issues.
  • Deep understanding of Agile environments, and the needs of people in these settings.
  • Experience in containerisation and orchestration technology, such as Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Knowledge of a range of CMS platforms.
  • Solid understanding of software development methodologies, object-oriented programming, database design and development

Get involved in company bowling nights, go-kart racing, orientation afternoons - not that anyone is competitive in this business!

name: Technical Specialist Developer - Application Services
description:
At Transpower, we stand together to keep the lights on for New Zealand - planning, building and operating the system that powers our country and lives, 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

About the team

Our Application Services group, within our Information Services and Technology Division, manages Transpower's inventory of applications and integrations, including enterprise and critical IT systems - with a focus on the practical and cost effective integration of systems to meet business requirements through:

  • Applications acquisition or development
  • Applications life-cycle management
  • Problem resolution
  • Additions and enhancements

About the opportunity

As a senior member of the team, you'll provide technical leadership, direction, guidance and expertise relating to application and integration development and maintenance.

You'll be responsible for a range of application development services, including options analysis, design, development and lifecycle management of integration services

We're looking to you to help build our development capability - partnering with our vendors, designers and architects to help set the direction, approaches and standards used across the team.

To be considered, your CV and covering letter will clearly demonstrate:

  • 10+ years of analysis and programming experience
  • Ability to translate user requirements into technical designs and specifications within an enterprise architecture, while creating and/or maintaining the end to end technical integrity of the system (essential)
  • Experience leading application development, building development capability and championing the use of proven software development methodologies, standards and technologies to drive continuous improvements
  • Experience working with applications DevOps tool-chains for continuous build, integration, packaging and deployment
  • Experience working in both Agile and Waterfall software development environments

Demonstrable skills for these languages / frameworks:

  • Java
  • Experience of building RESTful web services and JSON
  • Distributed services / REST / micro services architecture
  • Linux (RHEL)
  • Spring
  • Maven/Gradle
  • Oracle

Preferred experience with:

  • Red Hat OpenShift
  • Kafka
  • Experience with Swagger
  • Apache Camel
  • Apache CXF
  • Apache ActiveMQ
  • Atlassian Tool suite - Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo, Jira
  • Elastic Search, LogStash, Grafana
  • Git
  • IntelliJ IDEA
  • Nagios
  • Experience integrating disparate systems and knowledge of integration patterns, standards and technologies

You will have a Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or Computer Science or other related field, or equivalent work experience.

Why work for us

It's exciting! The scale, criticality and complexity of our ICT environment is incredibly stimulating and always a challenge as our sector evolves at pace.

As an equal opportunity employer, we embrace diversity. Our people are made up of 28 nationalities which makes for a dynamic and stimulating environment. Your wellbeing is supported with on the job learning and a range employee health and wellness benefits - view them here https://www.transpower.co.nz/about-us/careers/benefits.

Next Steps

If you're ready to join a fun, collaborative and results focused Applications Services team who enjoy a varied and full programme of work, please review the detailed position description below or via our career site and apply without delay.

Role closes Sunday 18 October, 2020. Applications will be reviewed as they are received.

Please note: due to border restrictions, we are only able to consider candidates currently residing in New Zealand with full work eligibility, or NZ citizens/residents returning home in 2020.

name: Front End Developer (Mobile)
description:
Join the LES MILLS™ Media team, driving a digital ecosystem that helps millions of people each week fall in love with fitness.
  • Six month fixed term opportunity
  • Exciting and high growth digital product suite
  • Join a global business committed to creating a fitter planet

Purpose and passion: it’s a potent combination that drives us to achieve true greatness. At Les Mills International, unlocking and amplifying that inner drive to achieve goals is something we’re not shy to say we’re great at. We do it for millions of people around the globe each week by delivering life-changing fitness experiences. And we do it every day for our own team by providing a mandate to thrive, to play to strengths and to be proud of the part we play in creating a fitter planet.

LES MILLS™ On Demand is changing the game when it comes to working out at home. With a true start-up spirit driving the team to success, we’re putting 1000+ workouts at our customers’ fingertips – on their devices in the comfort of their own homes. We’ve a bold vision and big plans for this innovative offering, so come and jump in on the action.

The Mobile App Developer will join the On Demand team and lead out the design and delivery of our new digital product. Our apps are built in React Native, and you will have extensive experience with React, alongside a good understanding of native design and development.

You will be well versed in agile lean methodology, full development cycles, design patterns and multiple programming languages. We build solutions that are always on and serve customers around the world.

This role will be part of a wider team, including tech design, UI design, back end development, QA and product. We’re seeking a highly collaborative team player, who builds effective relationships across the business with strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

It’s an exciting time for us right now as we surge towards some steep growth goals and industry-leading innovations. We are an organization committed to providing a flexible, diverse and inclusive environment. In return for all you bring to us, we’ll return serve by giving you every chance to exercise your passion, and thrive with a company that’s out to change the world.

name: Magento Developer
description:
• Large scale digital transformation
