name: UX Designer
description:
We have an outstanding new opportunity for a UX Designer to join our team, reporting to the CX/UX Chapter Lead.

In this role you will contribute to the success of Tower by designing our digital user experience. You will use research, testing, low-fi wireframing and stakeholder collaboration to outline and design the desired user experience guided by our customer experience and design principles.

We are tight knit team so cultural fit will be key. You will be passionate about UX and delivering great outcomes for our customers. You will be a natural collaborator with excellent stake holder management skills and feel comfortable working in cross-functional teams.

We'd love to hear from you if you have:

  • Experience in a UX role, ideally within a financial services environment
  • Strong understanding of user experience design, user interface design, design systems, UX research and UX/UI design tools.
  • A strong level of general digital knowledge, preferably within B2C markets
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams, including project managers, product managers, business analysts, developers and technical leads
  • Proven track record delivering outstanding digital experiences in a complex environment
  • Experience in agile methodologies is essential
  • Excellent relationship management and communication skills; must be able to work closely with senior leaders, internal stakeholders and external agencies

Tower prides itself on being a diverse and inclusive environment. We embrace and encourage our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and to celebrate their age, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion and anything else that helps to make our people unique. We are proud holders of the Rainbow Tick which is a really important symbol for us.

Check out the position description for more details about the role. This is an exciting opportunity to grow your career and make your mark in this challenging and rewarding role. If this sounds like you, then apply today.

Applications close 12 October 2020

name: Developer Services Consultant (FTC)
description:
Who are we?

MYOB is a business platform. Our purpose is to help more businesses in Australia and New Zealand start, survive and succeed. Our team is continually growing, inventing and disrupting conventions. To make all this happen, we are dedicated in creating an exceptional flexible employee experience for all team members and offer a culture where you can be yourself. We don’t want you to simply ‘fit’ into our already established culture, we want you to come and add to it, and make it even better!

We are looking for a passionate developer to help us craft software that brings real value for our clients to life!

More than just being a coder, this role provides the opportunity to collaboratively shape the work to be done, while honing your development skills to produce code that is maintainable, extensible and performant.

You will be working alongside a highly skilled team with diverse roles and skill sets.

To be successful in this role

  • 4+ years of validated .net development experience using C# in a professional capacity
  • Experience with web-based technologies as well as developing web-services and integration with 3rd party web-services
  • Firm grasp of database management systems such as MSSQL and MySql, including the ability to craft and analyse TSQL statements

The following would be helpful or advantageous for candidates:

  • Domain knowledge of financial or ERP systems
  • At least 1 year experience being part of a multi-functional team
  • Knowledge of\exposure to AWS
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

name: Intermediate Full Stack Developer (Data Vis)
description:
Looking for something different?

Epi-interactive, based in Wellington’s creativity and tech hub Miramar, is looking for a full stack developer to join our growing team. If you have a passion for creating innovative dashboards and user interfaces, we would love to hear from you.

With clients from around the globe we improve human, animal and environmental health with information technology powered solutions. We like to push boundaries and no two days are the same in our office; if you are keen to be part of a hard-working and visionary team and like to make a difference – you will fit right in.

You will work on a diverse set of data visualisation projects across the full stack, from data acquisition, processing and analytics to creating dashboards that are intuitive and connect with our audience. We also have some website projects on the go which link to those services where we would need your help.

Your skillset:
  • Frontend web development using JavaScript, CSS and HTML
  • R and R Shiny – our preferred tool for data visualisations; this is not mandatory and we can up-skill you, however a strong interest in coding analytical dashboards is a must!
  • Database development (SQL, T-SQL, PostGreSQL), REST APIs
  • Experience with LAMP installations and website development using PhP and Silverstripe
  • Thinking out of the box to develop solutions - we love exploring innovative ways to make data and information easier to access

This role is right for you if you are passionate about and have 3+ years’ work experience with responsive web development, i.e. using a framework like Bootstrap. You should feel comfortable in a Linux command line environment and working with Git. AWS or Azure knowledge and experience with DevOps would be a benefit. Since many of our projects link to specialist data, experience and interest in data analysis, processing and statistics are key.

If this sounds like your dream job and you have not yet accumulated all the experience required, please send your CV anyway as we are currently also recruiting a junior/student developer.

Ah – before we forget. We do have two office dogs which visit our office frequently, so if you like being around dogs, even better. And we are passionate about good coffee!

name: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Technical Lead
description:

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

Short Description:

If your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for you.

  • Contribute to and maintain system standards.
  • Maintain consistent installation and configuration procedures
  • Install, configure and monitor all aspects of Microsoft Dynamics CRM in production and non-production environments.
  • Deliver high quality code deliverables for a module, lead validation for all types of testing and support activities related to implementation, transition and warranty
  • creating high-level and detailed-level design artifacts.
  • Configuration and Customization of Dynamics 365 CRM.
Skills /Competencies:

Essential :

  • Hands-on experience on Azure services like Azure Function Apps, Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, Azure Key Vault.
  • Should have experience working on integrations, in Agile projects and using tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
  • Experience working on Dynamics CRM or PowerApps Portals
  • Should have been involved in at-least one full-cycle implementation of Dynamics 365 CRM.
  • Tertiary Qualification in IT / Computer Science / related discipline.
Preferred:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience on MS Dynamics 365 CRM with an overall experience of 7+ years on CRM.

  • Should be able to create Dashboards, Charts and Reports

  • Azure experience preferred.
Additional Skills:

  • Excellent customer interfacing skills.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills.

All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. description:

name: Senior Experience Analyst
description:
Senior Experience Analyst

Senior Experience Analyst

We're all about freedom. The freedom to solve the problems our clients face, not just the ones they think they do. Freedom to do things differently - to grow, be challenged and make a difference. No two days are the same. No two people, no two projects. It's the nature of who we are. We're a joint team of creative collaborators, driven by the Why? in EVERYTHING we do. We seek people with similar values to join our growing team of 40 people. Right now we are looking for an exceptional Senior Experience Analyst.

What you’ll be doing…

Our Experience Analysts own and communicate the vision of our projects to core and extended team members, including designers, tech leads, solution architects, project managers, developers and testers. They are critical in creating and inspiring a motivated team working collaboratively towards delivery of the vision.

You will:

  • Plan and effectively facilitate internal and client facing workshops to understand the problem we are trying to solve, define business and customer measurable success criteria, relevant personas and user journeys.
  • Create high level backlogs that define a roadmap and communicates the vision for the solution.
  • Create prioritised user stories that clearly define the business value including well-defined and concise acceptance criteria that can be clearly understood by the whole team.
  • Work directly with digital experience designer(s) to develop high and low fidelity design outputs that effectively communicate design direction and support the user stories.
  • Lead stakeholders, clients and the technical team through the build phase to continually refine and prioritise user stories so that the right business value is delivered within each iteration/sprint, taking into account technical dependencies and risks.

What we need to see…

  • 5+ years of Experience Analyst and Agile experience with a strong emphasis on Product Ownership
  • A collaborative attitude and ability to work well with cross-disciplinary teams
  • Accountability for and leadership of your digital projects
  • Ability to think laterally and come up with innovative ways to solve our customers biggest problems
  • A strong background in digital technologies, solution architecture and/or development.

What else you’ll bring…

  • Experience with Sitecore content editing would be very advantageous
  • An ability to communicate effectively at all levels of an organisation and to influence people positively towards achieving common goals
  • Enthusiasm, positive energy and passion for connecting humans and digital tech
  • We like to have fun, bring your sense of humour
  • Ability to juggle multiple commitments that are at different stages and keep the plates spinning

Excited…?

If you're as fired up as we are about what the future holds for our industry, our company and our team, come and join us on our exciting journey.

  • Auckland CBD location however flexibility to work from home fulltime
Our client is currently building a new digital team to focus on building a new customer portal that will be used by customers throughout the world. This role will give you the autonomy to develop across the full-stack focusing on a full-stack Javascript tech stack.

You’ll be a highly skilled Full-stack Developer with solid commercial experience under your belt. Must-haves for this role will be the ability to develop both the front and back end components of a web application, contribute to solution design, and provide high-class quality code. This code will be crafted using full-stack Javascript so we are looking for solid ReactJS, NodeJS experience.

What you’ll need to succeed:
  • 4 years’ + full-stack development experience
  • Commercial ReactJS & NodeJS experience
  • Exposure and knowledge to Azure would be highly sought after
  • GraphQL experience
  • Strong communication skills – you will be communicating with vendors
  • Friendly attitude, open to mentor, and grow skills in a wider dev team!
Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.

Please apply using an MS WORD version of your CV, as if we proceed with your application this is the format we’ll require to submit to clients.

Note: We review all CV's manually and you will only be contacted if your skills and experience meet the requirements of any of our clients.

name: ServiceNow Architect
description:
The Covid-19 pandemic is creating seismic challenges around the world. Our purpose, to build a better working world, has never been more important. Life at EY has been transformed dramatically but our strong culture of flexible and remote working has helped EY people navigate new ways of working and remain connected with each other and our clients.

A better working world truly starts with the people at EY who are building it every day. Now more than ever we need talented people from diverse backgrounds to help our clients navigate the complexities of this Transformative Age: people with the passion, curiosity and drive to make things better.

Please note at this time we can only take applications from people who are NZ citizens or residents due to the COVID-19 pandemic and border restrictions.

The opportunity

In this role you will be responsible for giving guidance and expertise on client facing solutions leveraging the ServiceNow platform. You will be business-issue focused as you work closely with clients to transform their ways of working. You will have a solid foundation of technical skills and solution architecture that you are able to leverage while working within a team of other Developers, Implementation Specialists, Product Managers and Architects to meet our client’s requirements throughout the software development life cycle.
Your key responsibilities
  • Ability to define at an architectural and design level of detail, technical solutions aligned with client’s business problems
  • Define scope and technical Consulting services to assist in clients implementing a ServiceNow program of work
  • Understand customer requirements and translate to this into workable solutions for the client
  • Understand customer objectives and provide continuity for architecture and roadmap exercises
  • Create and maintain Platform Implementation Roadmaps and provide hands on assistance with the detailed design and implementation approach of selected engagements
  • Demonstrate product and technical leadership on ServiceNow engagements
Skills and attributes for success
  • Experience with business processes in at least one area of the enterprise such as HR, GRC(IRM), CSM, ITSM, ITOM, ITBM (experience in multiple areas is highly desirable)
  • Ability to build strong and credible relationships with business and technical stakeholders at each level
  • Demonstrated expertise in business analysis, requirements gathering and solution design
  • Proven experience in designing and implementing solutions on the ServiceNow platform
  • Service Portal experience (HTML, CSS, Angular, Bootstrap, etc.) and ServiceNow Application Development using ServiceNow Studio
  • Fundamental understanding of the key technologies relevant to the ServiceNow integration solutions including: SSO, SAML, SSL, SOAP/REST Web Services, LDAP, JDBC/ODBC
Ideally you will also have
  • Quick learning ability and be an early adopter of new technology with the ability to self-manage and overcome objections in a presales and engagement delivery context
  • A keen eye for detail and problem-solving skills with experience in Agile methodologies and understanding of popular coding languages (e.g. JavaScript) will set you apart.
What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your performance. In addition, our comprehensive Total Rewards package can be tailored to your individual needs, to give you the freedom to manage your role in a way that’s right for you. This includes;
  • a variety of flexible working and leave arrangements
  • personalised career development including coaching and support to help you build your career and access to formal learning so you can develop the skills you’ll need to thrive in the future
  • a range of tools and benefits to guide and support your health and wellbeing throughout your entire EY career
About EY

At EY, we hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. Through our inclusive leadership behaviours, a variety of internal networks, flexible working and mentoring programs, you will have the support and flexibility to build an exceptional career.

EY is committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process for people with disability. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone + 64 9 300 7044.

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
Apply now.

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider.

name: Customer Solutions Associate - 18 month fixed term
description:
• Use your commerciality and intellect to provide exceptional customer service
  • Work enterprise wide to optimise customer experience and outcomes
  • Be part of an engaging agile team working to enable Aotearoa's energy future

Build exceptional relationships and enjoy a challenging and stimulating "business to business" role with truly meaningful work!

Transpower's Whakamana i Te Mauri Hiko - Empowering Our Energy Future report outlines that electrification and renewable generation can provide over 50% of the non-forestry emissions reductions to achieve New Zealand's net carbon zero target by 2050 while significantly reducing household energy bills. Transpower's customers will be central to delivering this bright energy future.

About the opportunity

Due to internal secondment, we have an opportunity for a Customer Solutions Associate to join our Customer Services team for an 18 month fixed term. You'll proactively manage the strategic relationships and day to day operations with our customers and stakeholders who connect directly to the grid, as well as developers and Infrastructure companies, for the benefit of New Zealand.

You'll be part of a tight knit agile team, working closely with the other Customer Solutions Associates and Relationship Managers, to establish and maintain positive relationships between Transpower and our customers.

The role is varied and includes:

  • Understanding the regulatory context within which Transpower operates
  • Operational customer and stakeholder management - you'll be the first point of contact for varied enquiries and problem resolution
  • Monthly bill preparation for existing customer contracts which is then passed to finance
  • Preparing reporting, including insights and trend analysis
  • Interpreting and preparing contracts
  • Supporting our Relationship Managers to deliver key account plans

To be considered, your previous experience, CV and cover letter will demonstrate:

  • Well-developed communication and relationship management/customer centricity
  • Commercial/financial literacy
  • An ability to interpret and prepare contracts
  • The ability to manage expectations and balance multiple priorities at pace, ideally in a corporate environment
  • Experience working with cross functional teams to deliver for your customers and stakeholders

While not essential, the following experience will be highly regarded:

  • Experience with customer relationship management systems and agile tools (e.g. JIRA)
  • Electricity or Utility industry exposure
  • Process/continuous improvement experience

Why Transpower?

It's exciting! The scale, criticality and complexity of our enterprise is both stimulating and challenging. We are an equal opportunity employer and value the diversity of thought that comes from our people of over 28 nationalities.

How we are approaching our work is changing. We are looking to alternative ways of working which ensures business engagement that supports automation and efficiency goals.

You'll join a fun, hardworking team, and have 18 months to immerse yourself in our business and demonstrate your skills whilst building enduring relationships across Transpower!

Next Steps

We are committed to playing our role in helping to deliver a net zero carbon future for Aotearoa. To join our Customer Solutions Team within our Strategy Division, and enjoy working towards a new energy future, please review the position description below/via our website https://careers.transpower.co.nz/search and apply without delay.

Role closes Sunday 11th October however applications will be reviewed as they are received, and you may be asked to complete a video interview so we can get to know you better!

NB: Due to international border restrictions, we are only able to consider candidates currently residing in New Zealand with full work eligibility.

name: Web Developer - Angular
description:
Trimble is an exciting, entrepreneurial company, with a history of exceptional growth coupled with a disciplined and strategic focus on being the best. While GPS is at our core, we have grown beyond this technology to embrace other sophisticated positioning technologies and, in doing so; we are changing the way the world works.

Our solutions are used in over 140 countries and we have incredibly diverse lines of business. Our employees represent this diversity and can be found in over 30 countries, working closely with their colleagues around the world. Due to our geographic, product and customer reach, there is plenty of room at Trimble for exceptional people to grow. Come position yourself with an innovative industry leader and position yourself for success.

Job Summary

Joining our Map Viewer team, you'll be part of the New Zealand Geospatial development group that is responsible for delivering significant user facing GIS functionality across the division’s product range. This is a 12 month fixed term position.

What you'll do?
You will be responsible for building innovative solutions in software to meet defined requirements. This involves:

  • Working with the project team to identify/clarify project goals, establish useful milestones, and develop a breakdown of the engineering tasks to be performed.

  • Working effectively with NZ-based service engineers and India-based web developers to develop against requirements defined at a high level.

  • Demonstrating a set of fundamental software engineering skills that result in predictability in engineering, scheduling and the quality of products developed.

  • Participating in technical/design reviews as required by the project framework.

  • Working with testers, application specialists & support staff to identify and resolve issues.

  • Maintaining documentation, source code, and other work products necessary for the project.


What you'll bring?

  • Relevant tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Engineering or other relevant Software Engineering discipline.

  • At least 3 years Application Developer skills in a production environment using a range of tools & languages.

  • Experienced with HTML/CSS, Angular, TypeScript, Atlassian products and Trunk Based Development

  • Design and development of significant new features.

  • Working knowledge of RESTful APIs to connect to back-end services.

  • Ability to collaborate, with a proven track record delivering agile products from a team environment.

  • Ensure all code is of high-quality and well tested.

  • Any knowledge of Windows, Linux or iOS development using OOP languages (C*) is a plus.

Only applicants who are legally entitled to work permanently in New Zealand, will be considered for this role.

name: .NET Developer
description:
• High performance .NET Technologies
  • Strong industry support and backers.


An awesome SaaS startup in Wellington is heading into their first round of recruitment, and looking for a senior level C# ASP .NET developer. With that comes the opportunity to get elbows deep at an early stage, where you can have huge exposure and work directly with a very strong technical leadership team. Seriously punching above their weight in ID and credential management, they have been recognised by both Microsoft and the NZ energy industry, bringing huge opportunities in both execution and market share.

Digitising a manual training records process, they bring a huge amount of additional support, security and confidence to the energy industry, with a scalable SaaS application with heaps more space to grow. Locally built, and backed by a big player in the global ID market, they have the best of both worlds, small enough to make a difference and with the scope to be something really special.

What will I be doing?
  • Support and enhance our API to be easily consumable for client integrations by multi-language environments such as JavaScript, Java, Python, PHP, etc
  • Development and enhancement of our data interfaces for Credential Management Systems and Learning Management Systems (Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics etc)
  • Diagnosing and resolve API, integration data and code issues
  • Continuously improve our API and integration solutions
  • Documentation for our API SDK
What do I need to know?

  • They are a .Net shop so knowledge of C# will be essential so you can read the code and can contribute to discussions. For this role, specialist knowledge of .NET Core, WebAPI, Dapper ORM, SQL Server, HTML/CSS, PowerShell and cryptography will be required
  • Contemporary knowledge about API/REST interfaces (such as using Swagger) including modern authentication such as OpenID and Oauth utilising JWT, JWS
  • Write and refactor C# code, SQL queries, data access code, API validation code
  • Familiarity with modern code management, build pipelines and tools with Azure DevOps and Git being our primary toolset for this
  • Microsoft Azure services in general such as App services and functions for serverless applications. Knowledge of Azure Service bus would be an advantage
  • Data exchange standards, formats and schemas such as JSON Schema, web hooks etc
  • Self-motivation, pragmatism and simplicity – you love working in a fast-paced environment and understand how to balance competing priorities and understand the benefits of delivering value to end users in an iterative manner
We’d love to see some of this, but it’s not a dealbreaker
  • Knowledge of Identity standards such as W3C Verifiable credentials, DID and any wider knowledge of the self-sovereign identity ecosystem
  • Prior experience working within a front-end environment built on React or a similar modern JavaScript framework would be advantageous. Even more of a bonus if you have done any work with Web Assembly; including PWAs and Blazor
If you want to work in a tight, high performing team with some cutting edge technologies and a project with a huge future, then drop us a line here or email peter@talent.army to set up a discreet chat.

name: EXHIBITIONS MANAGER
description:
OUR VISION: To be the “must experience” museum that uses past, present and future Kiwi
technology and ingenuity to educate and inspire the innovators of tomorrow.

- KIA WHAKATŌMURI TE HAERE WHAKAMUA -

Position: Exhibitions Manager

Reports to: General Manager – Museum Experience


PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

The Exhibition Manager plays a central role in ensuring that the MOTAT visitor experience is aligned with the
vision, audience, and collection. The role is responsible for leading the development and delivery of temporary
and longer-term exhibitions at all MOTAT sites, as well as touring exhibitions. This strategic role is responsible for
a unique and complex programme of exhibitions and the associated operating and capital budgets, with
accountability for the Museum’s success in these areas.

In line with MOTAT’s vision, the Exhibitions Manager is responsible for building a programme of exhibitions that
are educative and inspiring, creative and imaginative, as the Museum strives to engage its target audiences.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead and manage MOTAT’s Exhibitions team, fostering collaboration and mutual support among
teams and functions. Inspiring the team to innovate to achieve the objectives set out in the MOTAT
Master Strategy, Visitor Experience Plan, and Annual Plan and in delivering a uniquely MOTAT
exhibition programme.
  • Plan, develop, and implement strategy and processes for exhibitions development and interpretation
(including but not limited to exhibition proposals, content plans, policies, and business cases). This
extends to the development of all exhibitions at MOTAT, bringing in touring exhibitions, and touring
MOTAT exhibitions.
  • Act as both a programme manager and a project manager on Exhibitions projects. As Exhibitions
Manager you are accountable for managing a complex exhibitions programme, therefore projects will
often be led by other members of the Exhibitions team and you will operate as a Programme Manager.
  • Consider the needs and motivations of audiences in the design and development of exhibitions that
achieve MOTAT's vision. Each exhibition should be innovative and should be informed by audience
research and brand alignment.
  • Champion the incorporation of te ao Māori from the concept stage of exhibition development,
seeking advice and expertise as required, and growing the capability of the Exhibitions team in the
process.
  • Scan the environment to ensure that the exhibitions programme is responding to the latest trends
and innovations in the visitor experience space.
  • Proactively develop and manage relationships with external individuals and organisations where they
contribute as partners to the exhibition programme.

  • Drive initiatives to achieve MOTAT’s key performance indicators for audience development, increased
visitation, digital engagement, and increased access to collections.
  • Work closely with the other Museum Experience hub managers to develop exhibitions around which
wider museum offers can be developed, specifically Public Programmes, Education, and Digital
Engagement.
  • Work with other MOTAT Team Members to utilise MOTAT Collection and display collection objects in
line with standards of interpretation and collection care.
  • Establish, lead, and manage multi-disciplinary teams from across the Museum for each exhibition,
promoting a collaborative, flexible, and creative approach.
  • Lead the team to consistently deliver exhibitions on time and within budget, providing management
reports, including Board Reports, as required.
  • Manage exhibitions spaces and the facilities set aside for permanent and temporary touring
exhibitions.
  • Ensure that high quality content and interpretation is developed and commissioned as part of
exhibition planning, including the input of external third parties.
  • Contribute to the management and leadership of MOTAT through participation in the Museum
Experience hub, managing change and building relationships internally.
  • Procure and manage contractor services, including but not limited to exhibition designers, specialist
fit-out contractors, and content developers; managing the contracts and relationships with these
organisations, including for touring exhibitions, as required.
  • Effectively manage schedules, resources, and budgets (both CAPEX and OPEX) in accordance with
MOTAT’s financial guidelines and parameters.
  • Provide effective leadership and management of the Exhibitions team and follow all People & Culture
people management policies and procedures.
  • Follow all museum policies and procedures including but not limited to Health & Safety and the
Museums Aotearoa Code of Ethics.
  • Undertake any other reasonable duties as may be required from time-to-time to ensure that MOTAT’s
business objectives are met.

KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS

  • Timely delivery and execution of all strategies and plans as relevant to this position.
  • Meet all objectives related to the development, management, and communication of the exhibition
programme as agreed annually with the General Manager – Museum Experience.
  • Lead a high-performing exhibitions team that delivers exhibitions within time and on budget.
  • Meet or exceed exhibition visitation targets.
  • Align exhibition programme with key strategies, including the Collections and Digital strategies.
  • Collaborative, creative, and inclusive approach with high audience focus.

KEY RELATIONSHIPS / DELEGATED AUTHORITY

Responsible for: Exhibitions Team

Internal Liaison: Museum Experience Managers (Education, Public Programmes, External Relations, Digital
Engagement), Collections Hub, Conservation Manager, Registrar, People & Culture,
MOTAT Team

External Liaison: Exhibition Partnership Organisations, Contractors (including designers and audience
researchers), Industry Sector Groups, Professional Associations

BUDGETARY AUTHORITIES

$10,000


SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in exhibition development and delivery with proven management and leadership
experience gained through a museum or visitor attraction environment.
  • Experience in a programme management role in an audience-focussed organisation, including responsibility for
the programme, budget, and logistics.
  • Demonstrated business acumen; strategic planning, resource allocation, budget management, leadership,
project management, and coordination of people and resources.
  • Demonstrated understanding of matauranga Māori and experience incorporating both te ao Māori and te reo
Māori into the development of visitor experiences.
  • Proven leadership experience and experience leading high-performing teams, ideally within the GLAM or
tourism or visitor sectors.
  • Ability to identify complex problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and
implement solutions.
  • Extremely organised and able to multitask and demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with, and
present to others in writing and orally.
  • Technically savvy; proficient on all standard office software such as Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Demonstrated understanding of budgets and financial processes.
  • Exposure to media production desirable; communication and dissemination techniques and methods including
alternative ways to inform and entertain via written, oral, visual, and digital media.
  • High attention to detail, with a strong sense of accountability.
  • Relevant tertiary qualification or equivalent experience.


OUR VALUES
Ō MĀTUA UARA

Innovation We will be courageous and try new things.

Collaboration We will work as a team that respects and supports others.

Integrity We will act ethically and with respect and transparency.

Sustainability We will foster knowledge and promote technology that is beneficial to our community.

This document covers the broad results expected from the position and will form the basis

of specific objectives to be agreed and reviewed on a regular basis.

name: Test Automation Engineer
description:
The role has arisen as the company is growing exponentially, so we need a specialist QA to “own” the testing practice.

Currently our developers do their own testing which although it has been working well, we recognise that we need a specialist in this area.

We already have some automation testing set up however the majority is still manual. This role will primarily be responsible for manual testing in the short term, however, will naturally move towards automated testing asap - this role wouldn’t suit someone who wants to spend the majority of their time on automated testing in the short term.

Key Skills

  • Experience testing an enterprise-level product
  • Performance testing
  • Load and stress testing
  • JavaScript test automation using Jest/Selenium or Cypress
  • Backend API testing automation
  • Security testing is a plus

Your Profile

You will have at least 2 years of testing experience, be comfortable working in a sole-charge capacity, and as you will be liaising with people across the business, excellent communication skills are essential.

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

  • Testing: 2 years (Required)

Work Eligibility:

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Preferred)

name: Intermediate Software Developer (C#.Net)
description:
Work on a variety of projects from end to end to really make a difference at the heart of central government

  • Agile, DevOps environment with a collaborative and supportive team
  • Deal directly with your customers to achieve great results
  • Build on your existing experience through working across the entire project lifecycle
The Treasury is the New Zealand Government's lead economic and financial advisor. Our vision is to be a world leading Treasury working towards higher living standards for New Zealanders. We provide corporate services to both ourselves and DPMC. Within IT, our Applications Team designs, develops and maintains software-based solutions ranging from web applications and databases to desktop and cloud applications.

The Opportunity

As an Intermediate Software Developer with us, you will work on a range of projects including the Government Budget Management System, workflow systems and web-based application development. You will have the opportunity to work across the entire software lifecycle and you will not just write well-structured code but you will be relied upon to engage effectively with the business to fully understand their needs, figure out what needs to be done and make it happen.

About You

As a skilled Software Developer with 2-3 years' hands on experience, the technical know-how and great soft skills that set you apart from others in your field. You'll also bring:

  • The ability to speak our language - .NET and C#, MVC, Entity Framework
  • An Understanding of data - SQL Server Data platform
  • Excellent problem-solving skills including research, analysis, evaluating alternatives, and creativity
  • A customer focused approach and the ability to see the big picture and be adaptable
  • A positive, can-do attitude, a team player attitude and strong inter-personal skills
  • A computer science or ICT related university degree or equivalent industry qualifications or experience.
About Us

We are small, friendly and collaborative team that works in a unique setting across two distinct agencies. It is a supportive environment, where we share ideas, learnings and celebrate team success. There is the opportunity to work with senior developers to hone your craft and we provide great exposure to working with business owners. We enjoy working on projects and upgrades but also carry out the little jobs amongst the bigger tasks. We value diversity and inclusion and encourage a positive work life balance so please talk to us about flexible work options.

Applications close - Monday 12 October. All applications must be made online.

Please see the attached Job Description for further detail and for more information please contact, Graham Muggeridge, Applications Manager graham.muggeridge@cass.govt.nz.

name: Engineering Officer - Land Development
description:
• Use your Construction / Engineering experience
  • Nelson Location
  • Make a difference in the place we live

We are seeking a motivated Engineering Officer with a focus on subdivisions and land development to join our small and effective team. Our team is responsible for ensuring that the design, construction and reporting of land development works comply with the Nelson Resource Management Plan, and that Infrastructural Assets vested to Council comply with the Land Development Manual.

Reporting to the Senior Engineer Land Development, you will co-ordinate and undertake the checking, reporting and approval of land development engineering design and as built plans. This includes site testing, inspections, monitoring and reporting of land development construction works. You will provide land development guidance to other Council Officers as well as technical advice and information to the general public as requested. This diverse role will also draw on your relationship management skills to ensure your effective working relationships with stakeholders including developers, professional designers and contractors.


In your cover letter, tell us about your:

  • Civil Engineering qualification, or your substantial industry experience where you have demonstrated understanding of Civil Engineering, land development design, construction and documentation
  • experience with conducting site inspections and audits
  • outstanding relationships management skills
  • positive customer and team focus
  • ability to work autonomously

At Nelson City Council we believe that taking care of Nelson starts with taking care of our people. We value people bringing diverse skills and experience to the team, and in return we offer flexibility, variety, and opportunities for professional development. If you are seeking a change and want to join a team dedicated to our city, then we’d love to hear from you.


Applications close midnight Monday 5 October 2020.

For more information about this role please contact Shane Overend, Senior Engineer Land Development, on 03 546 0200 or email shane.overend@ncc.govt.nz

name: Full Stack Developer - IS
description:
It is an exciting time for Gallagher's Information Services Customer eXperience department as we're building new platforms to support the growing demand for Gallagher technology - our solutions are award winning, so we need to ensure our web platforms are equally as good for our customers.

Apart from your expertise in .net development, we are also looking for leadership in cloud technologies. You will be responsible for providing the best technical expertise, quality checks, software development processes, relationship management and proactively looking at ways to improve knowledge and skills.

The ideal person for this role will have:

  • A relevant tertiary IT qualification
  • Minimum of 2 year's experience with .net development

It’s a diverse campus with around 700 people on site every day and part of a network of over 1000 people across all business units worldwide. Of course, the Waikato is about an hours’ drive from Auckland, Tauranga and Rotorua, making Hamilton an ideal career and lifestyle destination.

name: Senior .Net Developer
description:
South Auckland

name: Mobile Developer (iOS/Android)
description:
The opportunity:

Rarely do you see a blend of edgy tech, a team bound by purpose building a product for an industry that truly was open for a disruption - cliche but true. And here it is. The need to complement current capabilities and achieve a critical mass of mobile software knowledge has led to a need for a new Senior Mobile Engineer. This is not a salvage job as the team is performing well. It's a growth proposition. The opportunity is for an effective, contemporary senior engineer who understands sophisticated mobile software across both core platforms, iOS and Android. This kind of engineer will allow the team to hit their true world-class potential. This engineer will be able to communicate effectively and help to provide some form of technical leadership and guidance (especially in iOS) to the less senior members of the team. The result of this? Even happier customers, and interesting technical challenges

Company profile:

Founded by two kiwis who saw the opportunity to digitize an analog & paper-based industry putting real-time, tech power into the hands of their customers. Now their prospective customers are clamoring to bring the productivity gains this software provides into their businesses leading to ramping growth. This has led to an ever-expanding customer and sales team in North Carolina already led by a US Director. Given the scale of this opportunity, this business has employed and acquired an executive team renowned for the successful growth of some of NZ's most recently listed tech sector sharemarket darlings. They've built a company from scratch that leveraged technology and strong industry knowledge leading them to recently win Start-up of the year at the NZ Hi-Tech Awards among other trophies and accolades. The first versions of the products are doing well, but the requirements to scale and bring new features to the market to meet the hungry demands fo their customers are increasing.

Role snapshot:

The journey of growth and change this business has been on has been radical. And it's not slowing down. This Senior Engineer role has emerged to build new software and provide technical oversight and horsepower to build great apps.

The role breaks down into four core components:

  • Technical guidance - work with the leadership and product team to best challenge and build new software

  • Delivery - work with VP and team to create deliverable features

  • Engineering - build new software across both iOS and a little Android and oversee

  • DevOps - help then team to refine and govern their DevOps systems


The fit:

To be able to fulfill this role you will be driven by the opportunity to build great software, specifically across mobile platforms. You'll celebrate kiwi product development and fast-growth, homegrown success stories, getting behind the purpose and goals of the business and team. Emerging from a background in mobile engineering, you will have rolled out successful, scalable mobile software and be keen on simple, customer-centric apps. Growth opportunities are ever-present in this business in all capacities so if you want to strengthen your development capability and join a rocket-ship business expanding fast, here is your opportunity.

Technical checklist:
iOS/Swift
Android
DevOps and CI/CD maturity
SaaS

For more information please contact Julian to discuss this position on julian@potentia.co.nz or apply now.

name: .Net Software Developer - Manaaki Whenua
description:
We need a talented developer to join our team...

If you are

  • a full stack.NET Developer
  • looking for a dynamic and invigorating technology environment
  • interested in environmental issues, biodiversity, and/or geospatial information
  • looking for an opportunity to apply your technical leadership in a small-team environment
  • ready to leap at the chance to work across the software stack - from database to web, from services to apps and to deployment

This is an excellent opportunity for a skilled developer with a passion for developing .NET applications for web and Windows platforms to join Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research's Informatics Team. The position blends new product development with enhancing and upgrading existing products and tools. It offers the chance to take part in projects that range from solo efforts to collaborations with the wider team.

The position will provide opportunities for growth and to apply your emerging technical leadership skills to a range of challenges. There are also opportunities for specialisation science information delivery and integration.

This position is open-term (permanent) and fulltime (37.5 hours per week). It is based at our Lincoln site.

You will

  • have well developed full stack .NET development skills, including C#, VB, with MS SQL server
  • have proven experience in web and web services development
  • have a strong understanding of database principles with broad applied experience
  • have a sound awareness of software engineering principles and their application
  • hold a graduate degree in software engineering, computer science or similar, with 6+ years of professional experience
  • be ready to use your emerging technical leadership skills to help grow the team in support of the team leader
  • have excellent written and spoken English, and strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • be able to collaborate well in a team environment, but also be self-reliant when needed
  • have an interest, qualification or experience in science fields such as biology/biodiversity, bioinformatics, environmental data, landscapes, ecosystems, or data science
  • have cross-platform development (e.g. Linux) experience with a range of languages (e.g. Python, R, Java, and XML technologies).

About us

Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research is the Crown Research Institute for the land environment. As New Zealand's leading provider of science and solutions that enhance land environments, our advice and tools - based on world-class science - enable New Zealanders to protect and use their natural resources sustainably and lift Aotearoa's environmental and economic performance.

As an employee of Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research, you will work with passionate and talented people in a caring and family friendly environment. As with all New Zealanders, we identify closely with our land and with its rich biodiversity and natural resources that define our way of life. This position offers great staff benefits and the opportunity to specialise for significant personal growth and career development.

How to apply

For further details about Manaaki Whenua-Landcare Research, watch this short clip: Manaaki Whenua and visit our website: www.landcareresearch.co.nz

Apply online by viewing the position description and then clicking the 'Apply Now' button below.

name: Product Manager - FTC
description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

Xero Contacts is a core part of the Xero product - it’s how businesses manage their customer and supplier details to be used in other key workflows like invoicing and bills. Contacts is essential for the Xero product to operate.

There’s some exciting work to do within Contacts coming up to modernise the technology and experience as well as ensuring we are focussed on solving the high impact Contacts related customer problems.

The team has re-established itself in our Auckland office after the product transitioned from New York last year. They are an enthusiastic and high performing team of product people, developers, and designers.

As our Product Manager, you’ll have the unique opportunity to lead our development teams to define and ship software.

This opportunity is for a 12 month maternity leave cover.

What are we looking for in a Product Manager?

  • Experience as a Product Manager in a software company
  • Proven leadership skills
  • Experience with problem discovery and solution framing activities
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills
  • Customer centric attitudeInclusive attitude and agile mindset
  • Experience with cloud and/or SaaS products would also help

What you’ll do?

  • Understanding customer problems; you will be the champion of the ‘what’ and the ‘why’ and deliver value through defining, driving and executing a product roadmap aligned with the Xero Contacts and Xero vision
  • Bridging technical and business worlds as you lead strong and positive relationships with global business partners to understand and deliver on market needs and priorities, and evangelise the Xero Contacts vision
  • Lead our product development teams, in conjunction with your product owner and specialist direct reports. You’ll also take active involvement in development team resource planning and recruitment
  • Lead engagement with other Xero product teams to build alignment and delivery towards shared outcomes
  • Working with strategy, product marketing, data and research teams to drive user and competitive research, in order to uncover customer needs and new product value propositions in line with Xero’s vision
  • Working closely with your peers across Xero to deliver quality software with amazing user experiences that tackle real customer problems
  • Cultivating a fun, creative and motivated culture that lives and breathes our Xero value

If you want to work with an internationally acclaimed, award-winning product right here in Auckland then this is the opportunity you’re looking for. We’ve got huge global reach and appeal, have a strategy in place for continued success and now is the time to be a part of it all.

Xero’s environment is an awesome place to develop in: we have a diverse and inclusive culture that we’re proud of. Whether you’re after a workplace with a social vibe, or a workplace which understands your family is priority - Xero is all of that and more.

We’re a big part of the development community and you’ll find Xero’s attending and speaking at conferences, hosting meetups or mentoring students. We’re really open in our discussions at Xero, from the latest product management thinking to improving diversity and inclusion.

At Xero, we encourage flexible working hours and arrangements that allow you to balance your life and passions. We trust you to build to the best of your ability and will support your real passion for continual learning with training and career mentorship to help you flourish.

As part of our awesome package you’ll get Xero shares as well as a swathe of other cool perks to make your time here that much more fun than elsewhere.

Xero is an NZ Immigration Accredited Employer and Rainbow Tick certified too.

Please include a cover letter in your application, telling us why you’re a great fit for this position.

name: Test Analyst
description:
Job description

Test Analyst

Position Purpose The Test Analyst defines and undertakes manual and automated
testing to provide confidence that the quality of changes delivered to
systems and processes meet the required standards. Testing of
software changes is based upon the complexity of each change and
potential business risk.

This role contributes to improving the effectiveness and efficiency of
testing methods and tools.,


Department: Information Technology Services ITS

Location: Manawatu

Reports to: Manager, UX & Application Testing
Responsible for: -
Delegations: -
Job Title: Test Analyst

Senior Managers ITS
All Application Services teams

ITS Staff
Massey staff and stakeholders

Context: We are a world-leading university in many academic disciplines and
fields of research. Our point of difference is research that is connected
Massey University to community and industry. Our researchers are developing expertise
and skills to advance human knowledge and understanding. Working
together across disciplines and locations, we solve national and global
problems through fundamental, applied and interdisciplinary research,
while culturally and artistically enriching our world.

We are deeply committed to being a Tiriti-led university, demonstrating
authentic leadership in contemporary Aotearoa New Zealand as we
uphold Te Tiriti o Waitangi, the founding document of our nation, and
its principles through our practice. We embrace this not just as an
obligation but as a real opportunity for the nation and its people.

Our educators are preparing a new generation of global leaders. Our
students are diverse and are attracted to Massey because they want
to achieve their personal goals or make their mark in the world. They
experience world-class learning that recognises their intellectual and
cultural strengths, expands their horizons and prepares them to
contribute to a rapidly transforming world with skills, critical and
creative thinking and leadership.

We will be renowned for our passion and caring attitude. All Massey

campuses will be innovation ecosystems, acting as magnets for smart

enterprises. Wherever we are, we will operate in partnerships founded

on respect, trust and mutual benefit. Massey is not only defined by

what we do, but by how we do it.

1


Application Services
The Application Services team focuses on ensuring the University can

respond with agility to the rapidly changing use of applications in the
education sector to create a world-leading student, researcher and staff
user experience of applications at Massey.

The team provides across-University application analysis, design,
build, testing, implementation and support services to all parts of
Massey to help achieve the University’s strategic goals and business
plans and to meet agreed user requirements. As a primary customer-
facing part of ITS, the team supports Massey’s strategic, operational
and transformational business process and application change needs.


2

Massey core capabilities

3

Accountabilities


Software Testing • Testing of new software to ensure it meets functional requirements,

system compliance, and technical specifications.

  • Writing, executing and maintaining test plans and scripts for software
changes
  • Defining environments and data required to undertake planned
testing.
  • Keeping written records of defects and bugs that are discovered
during testing, running triage process and managing all test defects
through to closure.
  • Developing or recommending solutions to fix any problems
discovered during testing
  • Providing structured plans, acceptance criteria, advice and assistance
to business users involved in User Acceptance Testing
  • Collaborating effectively with project managers, business analysts
and development teams as required during the build, testing and
release phases
  • Providing release assessment and recommendations to managers
based on test results.


Continuous • Participating in the development of quality assurance measures and
Improvement testing standards for new applications, products, technology solutions,
and/or enhancements to existing applications.

  • Leveraging automated test tools and data collection tools to support
the test process, increasing test velocity, coverage, quality and
visibility to stakeholders.
  • Reviewing production incidents to determine effectiveness of test
effort and providing input into process improvement within test effort.
  • Developing reusable test assets (regression test suite) to improve the
efficiency of testing effort over multiple releases, this includes keeping
test documentation current.
  • Provide insights on defect trends to appropriate stakeholders.

Qualifications and Experience

Qualifications: • A tertiary qualification or equivalent experience is a requirement.

  • ISTQB Certification (desirable)


Knowledge and • Experience as a high-level user of large business applications
Experience: • Experience in or knowledge of software development approaches

  • Experience working with technical teams (eg system architects,
developers and business analysts) to diagnose issues and facilitate
business outcomes and desired quality.
  • Current knowledge of technology solutions and trends.
  • Previous experience in testing roles designing test cases, executing
and reporting on findings, using test planning and management tools,
defining test approach/strategies and planning and guiding business
users in user testing is desirable.
  • A working knowledge of SQL and databases is an advantage

4

Capabilities:

Accuracy and • Processes large amounts of detailed information with good accuracy.
Attention to detail • Utilises specific approaches and tools for checking and cross-

checking outputs.

Essential • Develops and uses checklists to ensure that information goes out
error-free.

  • Accurately gauges the impact and cost of errors, omissions, and
oversights.
  • Learns from mistakes and applies lessons learned.

Communication • Written and oral communications that produces clear and complete
communication for stakeholders

  • Analyses audiences to understand their composition and Essential
perspectives.
  • Recognises which communications need to be formalised to provide
clarity, including when escalation is required.
  • Confirms understanding by restating others' positions.
  • Adapts listening and facilitation styles to others' communication styles.

Continuous • Implements new systems, procedures and tools efficiently when
Transformation changes occur in the work environment.

  • Adjusts current working processes or adopts new approaches in

response to changes in the business environment. Essential
• Seeks challenging opportunities or assignments to grow and develop

one's own knowledge, skills and abilities.

  • Explains lessons or experiences learned from mistakes and failures
as well as successes.
  • Communicates and analyses assumptions about a particular issue
with colleagues to gain new perspectives or more effective solutions.

Information Capture • Fulfils routine information capture needs in own area with accuracy,
efficiency and attention to detail.

  • Follows defined procedures to document all routine information. Essential
• Identifies relevant established standards, policies and practices.
  • Cites examples of different types of relevant information that need to
be captured.
  • Uses automated tools to capture, organise and archive relevant
information.

Interpersonal • Works with key stakeholders internally and externally. Applies
Relationships confidentiality when required.

  • Adapts interaction style appropriate to different situations and people.
  • Identifies roles and responsibilities for self and others.
Essential • Demonstrates an understanding of alternative points of view.

5

Priority Setting • Performs at least 2-3 concurrent activities without reducing

  • Completes current work according to assigned priorities.
Essential • Recognises changing demands and priorities; validates changes with

management.

  • Responds to day-to-day operational priorities while still making

Results Orientation • Maintains focus on critical work standards and expectations

Essential and outcomes.

and best practices.

Service Excellence • Provides direct service to internal or external stakeholders

  • Able to respond to common stakeholder queries and problems or
Essential escalate if required.
  • Responds to unexpected stakeholder requests with a sense of
urgency and positive action.
  • Provides a level of customer centric service excellence that
contributes to the departments objectives.

System Testing • Tests system components for compliance with functional
requirements.

  • Supports the project leader in developing and executing system test
Desirable plans.
  • Executes test cases, analyses test results and reports on findings
regularly.
  • Participates in the testing of a system's ability to recover from
hardware or software failures.
  • Evaluates system documentation and user manuals for usability,
accuracy and completeness.

Technical • Handles calls related to product features, applications, and
Troubleshooting compatibility standards.

  • Analyses code, logs, and current systems as part of advanced

troubleshooting.
Desirable • Works with vendor-specific diagnostic guides, tools and utilities.

  • Discovers, analyses, and resolves hardware, software or application
problems.
  • Records and reports specific technical problems, solving processes
and tools that have been used.

6

General Computer • Working knowledge and confidence in using core systems Massey
Proficiency University.

  • Demonstrates intermediate levels of knowledge and experience in the

use of Microsoft Office software.

name: Senior Management Consultant - Major Projects Advisory
description:
KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise, clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges, steer change, strengthen, transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

KPMG’s Global Infrastructure business is one of the world's leading advisors to the infrastructure sector (www.kpmg.com/infrastructure). Our team in New Zealand advises public and private sector clients on all aspects of the financing, structuring, procurement, delivery and operations of infrastructure. Our advice is independent and draws on deep sector experience within our local regional and global teams.

The role:

  • KPMG’s New Zealand Infrastructure Advisory team is experiencing rapid growth and is seeking to hire a highly skilled professional with deep experience advising on and managing the establishment and delivery of major projects.
  • We are seeking a senior leader at Senior Manager to Director level. This is a strategic role with leadership responsibility and will report directly to the lead Partner of Major Project Advisory.

Day to Day you will:

  • Manage and lead complex client engagements and projects and act as the key client interface
  • Develop effective client and stakeholder relationships with Government, Developers, Construction Groups, Design Consultants, Technology Providers, Investors, Industry Associations and other stakeholders in the industry
  • Lead a wide range of complex assignments across diverse subject matter areas including public policy advisory, project management, project controls advisory, asset management advisory, project risk management, project procurement and contract development and other strategic advisory support with respect to the planning and delivery of major projects
  • Lead and coordinate team members in delivering client research, benchmarking, analysis, high quality client reports and presentations, client proposals, thought leadership publications, internal reports and other materials as required in the course of business
  • Proactively support implementing the team’s growth strategy
  • Lead marketing and communication activities related to infrastructure
  • Proactive engagement with KPMG’s global and regional Major Projects Advisory and Infrastructure networks

What you'll bring to our team:

  • 12+ years professional experience across design, consulting, project management, engineering or related activities
  • Consulting experience as well as construction project delivery experience;
  • A degree and professional qualification in project management, engineering, architecture, planning or accounting
  • Strong interest and passion for complex projects; infrastructure, government, project management, construction and engineering
  • Deep experience in developing and delivering project controls services, commercial and contract advice, project reviews and risk management services to infrastructure and real estate projects in an advisory/consulting environment.
  • Strong analytical, financial, contractual and commercial skills
  • A positive and flexible attitude and an enthusiasm to embrace new challenges and growth opportunities to gain experience
  • A demonstrable track record of building lasting client relationships, winning new business and developing existing business
  • Strong interpersonal skills will enable you to successfully engage with a variety of internal and external stakeholders and an ability to bring people together, develop meaningful relationships, integrate services and work collaboratively with a team of experts across the wider consulting teams

  • With current border and quarantine restrictions in place, KPMG New Zealand are unable to consider applications from candidates that do not currently have the right to live and work in New Zealand. To be legally entitled to work in New Zealand, you should be a New Zealand citizen or permanent resident, or hold a valid work visa. Please check the New Zealand Immigration website for the most up to date information.
We are a 2020 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

name: Front End React.js / Redux Developer
description:
• Great tech in a start-up environment
  • Work with high performance technology, including Blazor
  • Early phase, with great industry support


An awesome SaaS startup in Wellington is heading into their first round of recruitment, and looking for a Front End Developer with strong React.js / Redux knowledge, and potentially interested in moving to a Blazor environment in the future. With that comes the opportunity to get elbows deep at an early stage, where you can have huge exposure and work directly with a very strong technical leadership team. Seriously punching above their weight in ID and credential management, they have been recognised by both Microsoft and the NZ energy industry, bringing huge opportunities in both execution and market share.

Digitising a manual training records process, they bring a huge amount of additional support, security and confidence to the energy industry, with a scalable SaaS application with heaps more space to grow. Locally built, and backed by a big player in the global ID market, they have the best of both worlds, small enough to make a difference and with the scope to be something really special.

What will I be doing?
  • Making good looking, accessible and awesome user experiences
  • Support and enhance our web applications
  • Diagnosing and resolve front end workflow, usability and code issues
  • Continuously improve our solutions
  • Documentation for our applications
What do I need to know?
  • Specialist knowledge of front end technologies, including JavaScript and DOM manipulation, React.js, Redux, HTML/CSS and NPM. If you are looking to widen your skills, they are already looking at Blazor as their “next generation” Front End platform
  • Contemporary knowledge API/REST interfaces (such as using Swagger) including modern authentication such as OpenID and Oauth utilising JWT, JWS
  • Familiarity with modern code management, build pipelines and tools with Azure DevOps and Git being our primary toolset for this
  • Microsoft Azure services in general such as App services and functions for serverless applications. Knowledge of Azure Service bus would be an advantage
  • Data exchange standards, formats and schemas such as JSON Schema, web hooks etc
  • Even more of a bonus if you have done any work with Web Assembly; including PWAs
We’d love to see some of this, but it’s not a dealbreaker
  • They are a .Net shop some so knowledge of C# and will be preferable so you can read the code and can contribute to discussions.
  • Knowledge of Identity standards such as W3C Verifiable credentials, DID and any wider knowledge of the self-sovereign identity ecosystem
If you want to work in a tight, high performing team with some cutting edge technologies and a project with a huge future, then drop us a line here or email peter@talent.army to set up a discreet chat.

name: Fixed Term Summer Internship Software Tester in Christchurch
description:
This employer is a healthcare innovation company that provides technology-based solutions to improve health care. The company is an established developer of 3D scanning and modelling technology for varied applications including, orthotics, prosthetics, skin and wound care. The employers Medical’s primary solution, Silhouette, is a suite of products for imaging, measuring and documenting soft tissue and skin lesions, including wounds. Silhouette is used in both clinical practice and clinical trial environments, with more than 100 phase I to IV clinical studies globally having used it to provide accurate data for analysis.

Our summer project requires research, design and automation of various test clinical workflows in iOS native applications. The first aspect of the project will be an evaluation of commonly used iOS test frameworks followed by the implementation of automated testing of workflows on multiple devices and iOS versions.

The student will be directly involved in the evaluation and selection of an iOS test framework. The student will be writing code (Swift or Objective C) in XCode on a Mac in order to automate clinical workflows. The student will be integrating their test suite with our existing build and deployment pipeline framework (Jenkins). This includes the recording of test results and executing the test suite on different devices.

The student would ideally be a 3 or 4th year Software Engineering student with a passion for software testing.

If this sounds like you, apply now!

name: Senior Test Analyst
description:
Role type: Permanent
Location: Auckland
Job published on: 30 September 2020

Our client specialises in delivering end-to-end, outcome-focused digital technology solutions and are looking for a Senior Test Analyst to join their Auckland based team

Everybody wants to work in an environment where collegial support, mutual respect, a shared vision and a sense of fun prevail. Here you will be joining a tight-knit, high performing and well-respected team. You will be working with developers and business analysts to test client projects
You will be required to analyse requirements and write up test cases for testing as part of agile scrum teams. The teams are multifunctional and the delivery is sprint based.

To qualify you will have the following:
  • 7+ years experience
  • ISTQB certified (foundation level)
  • Experience testing API's
  • Ability to undertake functional testing
  • Write test plans and test exit reports as needed
  • Knowledge of testing tools such as Loadrunner, API, JMetre, Automoation software including Selenium, cucumber
  • Experience working in an Agile enviornment
  • Team player with excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Nice to have skills would inclue:
  • Performance testing
  • Security testing of web threats (eg: OWASP top 10)
  • Test automation (using a BDD framework)
Please note, to apply for this role you will need to be currently residing in New Zealand.

If you would like to be part of a fun and passionate team, be recognised for excellence and have the opportunity to develop your skills, then this is the place for you. If you are interested in the above role please send your CV and cover letter and ‘apply now’ .

name: Oracle Apex Developer
description:
Our client is a large Government Organisation and they have a project piece of work for x2 Oracle Apex Developers. You will sit in a team of 15 people and will the have the opportunity to be in the office and also work from home.

Being the Oracle Apex Developer, you will work on our clients project as they plan to upgrade their Apex platform. Before this can occur, the existing APEX applications need to be upgraded to the Oracle Apex Universal Theme.

There are 28 applications that will not migrate over in their current form, so they will need upgrading. So in this role you will be following a universal theme template across applications and upgrading the applications so they can be uplifted and moved to a later version.

The work is low level in terms of coding and will suit a person whom is looking for a short contract, as it is an ASAP start and goes for 2 ½ months.

Key skills needed:

  • Has oracle APEX knowledge and/or experience
  • Can work quickly and efficiently
  • Proactive
  • Excellent communications skills

Your Laptop/Desktop will be provided. So if you have Oracle Apex experience give us a call today!

Robert Walters endeavours to review all applications in a maximum of five working days. If you have not received correspondence within this timeframe please do not hesitate to contact Ange Chapman on 04 471 9707.
