name: Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack Developer
description:
iQualify is seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer - Full Stack Developer who wants to be part of a successful and fast growing ed tech product. This role can be based in Lower Hutt or remotely.

We're discovering how to make the world's most engaging vocational learning experience every day for hundreds of New Zealand businesses and hundreds of thousands of learners. Join the team that builds iQualify, New Zealand's fastest growing social learning platform.

Backed by 70 years of distance learning experience by The Open Polytechnic, New Zealand's specialist provider of open and distance learning, from certificate to diploma and degree level, and is internationally recognised in its field.

What's the role?

We are looking for an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), to join a broad product team with roles ranging from UX, visual design, learning design, customer experience and software developers.

What you'll need:

  • Extensive experience as a Full Stack Developer
  • Experience in production monitoring and service improvement
  • Experience in developing and delivering automation systems
  • Extensive programming experience in web application development technologies including Angular, Node JS, Javascript, CSS, HTML(5)
  • Experience with database application design and development in NoSQL and document data stores
  • Experience working within a team in applications development
  • Experience with effective use of development platforms and tools
  • Good experience with cloud platforms
  • Experience with lean, agile and XP development practices

We are looking for someone who:

  • Is right at home troubleshooting and diagnosing potential issues. Diving into the technical detail is your thing
  • Has experience working with software platforms and tools to make people's lives easier
  • Has well-developed problem solving skills - you'll need these every day
  • Is able to think proactively, anticipate problems and work with team members to implement innovative solutions
  • Has plenty of opinions about how to make things better
  • Is a results-orientated approach to initiative
  • Has great relationship building skills
  • Loves working with users to analyse, define and document requirements and specifications
  • Has excellent verbal and written communication skills that you'll demonstrate by writing an outstanding cover letter showing us why you're the person we're looking for. Wow us with your style.

What's in it for you?

  • We provide a supportive and creative place to work developing learning solutions that help learners and our partners succeed.
  • We're equipped with coffee and frequent pet visitors.
  • We're located out in the Hutt Valley if that's a bonus for you, or you can work from anywhere within NZ
  • You'll be challenged and supported and be an integral part of a team developing the world's most engaging social learning platform.

Still interested? We're keen for you to interview us. Hit the apply button.

Applications close midday Wednesday 7 October 2020. Please note only online applications will be accepted.

name: Senior Business Analyst
description:
You'll be working as a senior member of the team that delivers TVNZ OnDemand and OneNews, playing a pivotal role in delivering news and entertainment to all New Zealanders.

In this role you will work on initiatives and see them through to a successful implementation, while ensuring that existing systems continue to meet the high expectations of our customers.

Our team uses a collaborative and agile approach, working closely with product managers, developers, testers and business experts.

About you:

Ideally you will have significant business analysis experience using Agile delivery to continuously improve digital products. We're looking for someone who likes to jump into the detail, but can also step back to provide a viewer/client/business perspective.

You will be someone who enjoys working with people to build strong teams to drive delivery. Other experience and strengths you'll bring to the table:

  • Background in Media or Digital products.
  • Familiar with Jira, Slack, Confluence, Trello and Teams.
  • Passion for improving viewer experience by defining user epics and stories.
  • Great communicator.
  • A motivated self-starter.
  • Inquisitive problem solver.


About the team:

The digital team is a passionate group of cross-functional people covering engineering, test, product management, business analysis and user experience/design. We imagine, prioritise, build, release and support every aspect of our digital offerings.

We have various options available to provide flexibility around hours and place of work, although we do value regular time in the office together. There are just some things that work better in person! This means we can work together around things like school drop offs and/or other responsibilities you may have.

We're a diverse bunch and we place a high value on teamwork & joint ownership.

We bring our whole selves to work and we'd love it if you did too!


About TVNZ:

TVNZ is one of New Zealand's best known and most well loved businesses. Every day we join over 2 million kiwis in their lunchrooms, lounge rooms, bedrooms and on whatever gadget they carry around. Whether we're breaking news, following adventures, sharing stories, or simply putting smiles on faces, we're all about doing it better, smarter and on more screens than anyone else.

name: Java Developer (Analyst Programmer)
description:
Requisition Title -
Java Developer (Analyst Programmer)

Job Number: - NEW042205

Description
  • Open Banking is an exciting opportunity to work with a broad range of internal, 3rd party and external stakeholders to create new customer propositions and capabilities
  • Solving new and interesting problems at scale in a collaborative team environment
  • Shape a high performing culture that will set up the team to be successful
About The Role
As an Analyst Programmer, you will be empowered to help define and build a banking experience that delivers value to our Customers. As part of the Open Banking Programme there is potential to revolutionise the financial sector and be part of a team to drive transformation and innovation.

To achieve this, you will:
  • Be part of a cross-functional team working collaboratively within high-performing Agile teams.
  • We are looking for someone with Java experience that enjoys building micro services.
  • You will be passionate about advocating change and improvements in Development, test automation and the continuous delivery spaces, improving software quality, delivering software faster and more reliably.
Role Location: Wellington CBD
Role Type: Permanent, full-time opportunity
Working Hours: Standard business hours with plenty flexible work options available

About You
To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:
  • You will be a communicator. You will be spending your day working alongside a team where you will need to be able to communicate technical issues.
  • You will be working in small teams where collaboration and relationship building is key.
  • You are passionate about writing well-tested code that follows good software development principles.
  • You will have proven experience working as a Developer, and are open to contribute to improvements within the development practices.
  • You will be comfortable with the unknowns.
  • You will have a pragmatic approach with a healthy dose of quality mixed in.
  • You’ll be open to share knowledge with your peers and obtain mentoring from team members.
Essential Skills & Experiences:
  • Java development experience (Java 8+, Spring Boot preferable)
  • Experience with Rest APIs
  • API development and integration (REST/JSON, SOAP/XML, message queues)
  • Experience with building and maintaining Java based microservices
  • Database systems (Oracle, SQL Server)
  • Container-based platform experience (Openshift 3.x)
  • Linux
  • CI/CD pipeline automation (Jenkins)
  • Strong experience working in an agile environment (ideally Scrum)
  • Testing - unit, acceptance. TDD / BDD
Some of our other benefits include:
  • Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave
  • Staff Banking and Insurance benefits
  • Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career
  • Southern Cross Health Insurance
To find out more about what it is like to work in ANZ’s Technology team watch this short video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6ccJeITDTc&feature=youtu.be&fbclid=IwAR0laTpfWblMpT3vKZMqMOEleQpRwKOEJZvrS4KnQYou6Y8k_qkdtOZBxms
About ANZ
Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.
ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.
The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.
Integrity – We are honest and fair
Collaboration – We work together for the customer
Accountability – We take ownership and get things done
Respect – We care for all those we serve
Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better
We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.
ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world.
To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit http://www.anz.co.nz/careers
You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for the reference number NEW042205.
Applications close 16 October 2020 although we reserve the option to withdraw the ad should sufficient suitable candidates apply prior to closing date.
Please note, because of the urgency of this role and current COVID-19 related NZ Border restrictions, applications will only be considered from those that have a current, indefinite and unrestricted right to work in New Zealand.

name: Road Corridor Manager
description:
Tauranga is New Zealand's fastest growing and fifth largest city. Managing this growth makes for a challenging and dynamic work environment. Tauranga City Council is focused on the City's future and responding to the changing needs of the community. We want to work with our community to successfully plan for and understand their needs and expectations.

At Tauranga City Council we are responsible for managing activities on the roading network to ensure safe, efficient and reliable journeys to customers across the Bay of Plenty region. The Road Corridor Manager plays a crucial role by reviewing and approving corridor access requests which means dealing with developers, contractors, consultants, utility operators, event organisers and the general public on a daily basis. The Road Corridor Manager has a finger on the pulse of everything that's going on in Tauranga and no two days are the same.

We are looking for an exceptional Road Corridor Manager to join our team, reporting to the Team Leader: Corridor Access & Temporary Traffic Management. Ensuring worker and public safety, managing the impact to all modes of transport and providing a top level of customer service whilst maintaining a professional attitude at all times. This is an exciting opportunity for an organised, self-motivated individual to make a positive impact on the community. The successful applicant will be confident working in a high performing team building relationships both internally and externally while being a subject matter expert in traffic management and activities in the road reserve.

For this role, you will ideally have;

  • A Temporary Traffic Management qualification STMS Level 2/3 (NP)
  • Minimum of three years' experience in a traffic management, roading, utilities or similar role, preferably working with or alongside Local Government or NZTA.
  • Exposure to relevant legislations and regulations such as Health & Safety at Work Act 2015, Utilities Act 2010 and the Code of Practice for Temporary Traffic Management (CoPTTM).
  • Well-developed problem solving skills and a commitment to continuous improvement
  • Sound organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritise tasks
  • Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Digitally savvy, particularly in the Microsoft Office suite.

At Tauranga City Council, we believe in supporting our talent and we offer a range of learning and development opportunities and flexible working conditions to help you achieve the most from your career.

If you're looking for a career where you can make a real difference, then we would love to hear from you and have you join our team!

Applications close Friday 23 October 2020.

name: Mobile Software Engineer (iOS & Android)
description:
ClearPoint
ClearPoint is a digital design and engineering company. We bring together all the parts we know are essential for creating great digital experiences – great product and design that puts people at the center; fast and safe engineering that helps customers scale; integrating market-leading platforms in the cloud and helping get more out of data.
Our diverse team of strategists, innovators, engineers, architects, developers, and designers help solve complex business problems for many of NZ and Australia’s leading enterprises. Every day is a day of learning at ClearPoint and striving to be the best we can be.

The Role
We are currently on the lookout for an experienced Mobile Software Engineer to join our ClearPoint Engineering Chapter here in Auckland, New Zealand to help consult, innovate and develop world class mobile experiences for our customers.
Working with key technology influencers across sectors such as Funds Management, Banking and Financial Services you’ll become part of our highly skilled team working on complex Mobile applications and software integration solutions. This is a diverse role where you’ll have ample opportunity to apply your cross-domain, cross-functional and cross-industry expertise. You are a software engineer who has excellent understanding of web, mobile, front-end development, design patterns, commercial knowledge of mobile applications and services.
We’re looking for proven experience in these following areas
  • Enterprise Software Development Experience in iOS (Swift, Objective C) or Android (Kotlin, Java), with desire to learn & develop on the other platforms (e.g. Google Flutter, React Native)
  • Experience with related tools such as Xcode 9+, Xcode IDE, CocoaPods etc. as well as Gradle, Fastlane, Circle CI, Android SDK, Android Studio, Java, Git, Bamboo, Jira, Confluence, etc.
  • Object-Oriented Programming and Design Patterns
  • Agile software methodology/delivery – FDD, BDD, TDD, SCRUM
  • Sound understanding of Micro-services Architecture and implementation
  • Cloud platform/services experience with GCP, AWS or Microsoft Azure
  • Ability to consult, negotiate and influence with stakeholders and members of the team
  • Passion for technology for continuous learning of new tools and concepts
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong stakeholder engagement skills

Next Steps
Our passion for innovative design, technology, shared learning, and the desire to get the best outcomes for our clients, team, and community is what drives us. If this role sounds like you, please apply and one of our Recruitment & Resourcing team will be in touch for a confidential discussion. You must be eligible to work in New Zealand (with a valid working Visa, Residency, or Citizenship) to be successful in this application.

name: Mobile Developer (iOS/Android)
description:
The opportunity:

Rarely do you see a blend of edgy tech, a team bound by purpose building a product for an industry that truly was open for a disruption - cliche but true. And here it is. The need to complement current capabilities and achieve a critical mass of mobile software knowledge has led to a need for a new Senior Mobile Engineer. This is not a salvage job as the team is performing well. It's a growth proposition. The opportunity is for an effective, contemporary senior engineer who understands sophisticated mobile software across both core platforms, iOS and Android. This kind of engineer will allow the team to hit their true world-class potential. This engineer will be able to communicate effectively and help to provide some form of technical leadership and guidance (especially in iOS) to the less senior members of the team. The result of this? Even happier customers, and interesting technical challenges

Company profile:

Founded by two kiwis who saw the opportunity to digitize an analog & paper-based industry putting real-time, tech power into the hands of their customers. Now their prospective customers are clamoring to bring the productivity gains this software provides into their businesses leading to ramping growth. This has led to an ever-expanding customer and sales team in North Carolina already led by a US Director. Given the scale of this opportunity, this business has employed and acquired an executive team renowned for the successful growth of some of NZ's most recently listed tech sector sharemarket darlings. They've built a company from scratch that leveraged technology and strong industry knowledge leading them to recently win Start-up of the year at the NZ Hi-Tech Awards among other trophies and accolades. The first versions of the products are doing well, but the requirements to scale and bring new features to the market to meet the hungry demands fo their customers are increasing.

Role snapshot:

The journey of growth and change this business has been on has been radical. And it's not slowing down. This Senior Engineer role has emerged to build new software and provide technical oversight and horsepower to build great apps.

The role breaks down into four core components:

  • Technical guidance - work with the leadership and product team to best challenge and build new software

  • Delivery - work with VP and team to create deliverable features

  • Engineering - build new software across both iOS and a little Android and oversee

  • DevOps - help then team to refine and govern their DevOps systems


The fit:

To be able to fulfill this role you will be driven by the opportunity to build great software, specifically across mobile platforms. You'll celebrate kiwi product development and fast-growth, homegrown success stories, getting behind the purpose and goals of the business and team. Emerging from a background in mobile engineering, you will have rolled out successful, scalable mobile software and be keen on simple, customer-centric apps. Growth opportunities are ever-present in this business in all capacities so if you want to strengthen your development capability and join a rocket-ship business expanding fast, here is your opportunity.

Technical checklist:
iOS/Swift
Android
DevOps and CI/CD maturity
SaaS

For more information please contact Julian to discuss this position on julian@potentia.co.nz or apply now.

name: .Net Software Developer - Manaaki Whenua
description:
We need a talented developer to join our team...

If you are

  • a full stack.NET Developer
  • looking for a dynamic and invigorating technology environment
  • interested in environmental issues, biodiversity, and/or geospatial information
  • looking for an opportunity to apply your technical leadership in a small-team environment
  • ready to leap at the chance to work across the software stack - from database to web, from services to apps and to deployment

This is an excellent opportunity for a skilled developer with a passion for developing .NET applications for web and Windows platforms to join Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research's Informatics Team. The position blends new product development with enhancing and upgrading existing products and tools. It offers the chance to take part in projects that range from solo efforts to collaborations with the wider team.

The position will provide opportunities for growth and to apply your emerging technical leadership skills to a range of challenges. There are also opportunities for specialisation science information delivery and integration.

This position is open-term (permanent) and fulltime (37.5 hours per week). It is based at our Lincoln site.

You will

  • have well developed full stack .NET development skills, including C#, VB, with MS SQL server
  • have proven experience in web and web services development
  • have a strong understanding of database principles with broad applied experience
  • have a sound awareness of software engineering principles and their application
  • hold a graduate degree in software engineering, computer science or similar, with 6+ years of professional experience
  • be ready to use your emerging technical leadership skills to help grow the team in support of the team leader
  • have excellent written and spoken English, and strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • be able to collaborate well in a team environment, but also be self-reliant when needed
  • have an interest, qualification or experience in science fields such as biology/biodiversity, bioinformatics, environmental data, landscapes, ecosystems, or data science
  • have cross-platform development (e.g. Linux) experience with a range of languages (e.g. Python, R, Java, and XML technologies).

About us

Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research is the Crown Research Institute for the land environment. As New Zealand's leading provider of science and solutions that enhance land environments, our advice and tools - based on world-class science - enable New Zealanders to protect and use their natural resources sustainably and lift Aotearoa's environmental and economic performance.

As an employee of Manaaki Whenua - Landcare Research, you will work with passionate and talented people in a caring and family friendly environment. As with all New Zealanders, we identify closely with our land and with its rich biodiversity and natural resources that define our way of life. This position offers great staff benefits and the opportunity to specialise for significant personal growth and career development.

How to apply

For further details about Manaaki Whenua-Landcare Research, watch this short clip: Manaaki Whenua and visit our website: www.landcareresearch.co.nz

Apply online by viewing the position description and then clicking the 'Apply Now' button below.

name: Product Manager - FTC
description:
Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

Xero Contacts is a core part of the Xero product - it’s how businesses manage their customer and supplier details to be used in other key workflows like invoicing and bills. Contacts is essential for the Xero product to operate.

There’s some exciting work to do within Contacts coming up to modernise the technology and experience as well as ensuring we are focussed on solving the high impact Contacts related customer problems.

The team has re-established itself in our Auckland office after the product transitioned from New York last year. They are an enthusiastic and high performing team of product people, developers, and designers.

As our Product Manager, you’ll have the unique opportunity to lead our development teams to define and ship software.

This opportunity is for a 12 month maternity leave cover.

What are we looking for in a Product Manager?

  • Experience as a Product Manager in a software company
  • Proven leadership skills
  • Experience with problem discovery and solution framing activities
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills
  • Customer centric attitudeInclusive attitude and agile mindset
  • Experience with cloud and/or SaaS products would also help

What you’ll do?

  • Understanding customer problems; you will be the champion of the ‘what’ and the ‘why’ and deliver value through defining, driving and executing a product roadmap aligned with the Xero Contacts and Xero vision
  • Bridging technical and business worlds as you lead strong and positive relationships with global business partners to understand and deliver on market needs and priorities, and evangelise the Xero Contacts vision
  • Lead our product development teams, in conjunction with your product owner and specialist direct reports. You’ll also take active involvement in development team resource planning and recruitment
  • Lead engagement with other Xero product teams to build alignment and delivery towards shared outcomes
  • Working with strategy, product marketing, data and research teams to drive user and competitive research, in order to uncover customer needs and new product value propositions in line with Xero’s vision
  • Working closely with your peers across Xero to deliver quality software with amazing user experiences that tackle real customer problems
  • Cultivating a fun, creative and motivated culture that lives and breathes our Xero value

If you want to work with an internationally acclaimed, award-winning product right here in Auckland then this is the opportunity you’re looking for. We’ve got huge global reach and appeal, have a strategy in place for continued success and now is the time to be a part of it all.

Xero’s environment is an awesome place to develop in: we have a diverse and inclusive culture that we’re proud of. Whether you’re after a workplace with a social vibe, or a workplace which understands your family is priority - Xero is all of that and more.

We’re a big part of the development community and you’ll find Xero’s attending and speaking at conferences, hosting meetups or mentoring students. We’re really open in our discussions at Xero, from the latest product management thinking to improving diversity and inclusion.

At Xero, we encourage flexible working hours and arrangements that allow you to balance your life and passions. We trust you to build to the best of your ability and will support your real passion for continual learning with training and career mentorship to help you flourish.

As part of our awesome package you’ll get Xero shares as well as a swathe of other cool perks to make your time here that much more fun than elsewhere.

Xero is an NZ Immigration Accredited Employer and Rainbow Tick certified too.

Please include a cover letter in your application, telling us why you’re a great fit for this position.

name: Test Analyst
description:
Job description

Test Analyst

Position Purpose The Test Analyst defines and undertakes manual and automated
testing to provide confidence that the quality of changes delivered to
systems and processes meet the required standards. Testing of
software changes is based upon the complexity of each change and
potential business risk.

This role contributes to improving the effectiveness and efficiency of
testing methods and tools.,


Department: Information Technology Services ITS

Location: Manawatu

Reports to: Manager, UX & Application Testing
Responsible for: -
Delegations: -
Job Title: Test Analyst


Key relationships: Internal

Senior Managers ITS
All Application Services teams

ITS Staff
Massey staff and stakeholders

Context: We are a world-leading university in many academic disciplines and
fields of research. Our point of difference is research that is connected
Massey University to community and industry. Our researchers are developing expertise
and skills to advance human knowledge and understanding. Working
together across disciplines and locations, we solve national and global
problems through fundamental, applied and interdisciplinary research,
while culturally and artistically enriching our world.

We are deeply committed to being a Tiriti-led university, demonstrating
authentic leadership in contemporary Aotearoa New Zealand as we
uphold Te Tiriti o Waitangi, the founding document of our nation, and
its principles through our practice. We embrace this not just as an
obligation but as a real opportunity for the nation and its people.

Our educators are preparing a new generation of global leaders. Our
students are diverse and are attracted to Massey because they want
to achieve their personal goals or make their mark in the world. They
experience world-class learning that recognises their intellectual and
cultural strengths, expands their horizons and prepares them to
contribute to a rapidly transforming world with skills, critical and
creative thinking and leadership.

We will be renowned for our passion and caring attitude. All Massey

campuses will be innovation ecosystems, acting as magnets for smart

enterprises. Wherever we are, we will operate in partnerships founded

on respect, trust and mutual benefit. Massey is not only defined by

what we do, but by how we do it.

1


Application Services
The Application Services team focuses on ensuring the University can

respond with agility to the rapidly changing use of applications in the
education sector to create a world-leading student, researcher and staff
user experience of applications at Massey.

The team provides across-University application analysis, design,
build, testing, implementation and support services to all parts of
Massey to help achieve the University’s strategic goals and business
plans and to meet agreed user requirements. As a primary customer-
facing part of ITS, the team supports Massey’s strategic, operational
and transformational business process and application change needs.


2

Massey core capabilities

3

Accountabilities


Software Testing • Testing of new software to ensure it meets functional requirements,

system compliance, and technical specifications.

  • Writing, executing and maintaining test plans and scripts for software
changes
  • Defining environments and data required to undertake planned
testing.
  • Keeping written records of defects and bugs that are discovered
during testing, running triage process and managing all test defects
through to closure.
  • Developing or recommending solutions to fix any problems
discovered during testing
  • Providing structured plans, acceptance criteria, advice and assistance
to business users involved in User Acceptance Testing
  • Collaborating effectively with project managers, business analysts
and development teams as required during the build, testing and
release phases
  • Providing release assessment and recommendations to managers
based on test results.


Continuous • Participating in the development of quality assurance measures and
Improvement testing standards for new applications, products, technology solutions,
and/or enhancements to existing applications.

  • Leveraging automated test tools and data collection tools to support
the test process, increasing test velocity, coverage, quality and
visibility to stakeholders.
  • Reviewing production incidents to determine effectiveness of test
effort and providing input into process improvement within test effort.
  • Developing reusable test assets (regression test suite) to improve the
efficiency of testing effort over multiple releases, this includes keeping
test documentation current.
  • Provide insights on defect trends to appropriate stakeholders.

Qualifications and Experience

Qualifications: • A tertiary qualification or equivalent experience is a requirement.

  • ISTQB Certification (desirable)


Knowledge and • Experience as a high-level user of large business applications
Experience: • Experience in or knowledge of software development approaches

  • Experience working with technical teams (eg system architects,
developers and business analysts) to diagnose issues and facilitate
business outcomes and desired quality.
  • Current knowledge of technology solutions and trends.
  • Previous experience in testing roles designing test cases, executing
and reporting on findings, using test planning and management tools,
defining test approach/strategies and planning and guiding business
users in user testing is desirable.
  • A working knowledge of SQL and databases is an advantage

4

Capabilities:

Accuracy and • Processes large amounts of detailed information with good accuracy.
Attention to detail • Utilises specific approaches and tools for checking and cross-

checking outputs.

Essential • Develops and uses checklists to ensure that information goes out
error-free.

  • Accurately gauges the impact and cost of errors, omissions, and
oversights.
  • Learns from mistakes and applies lessons learned.

name: Senior Angular Developer
description:
The Company

Operating in the health industry, this stable NZ owned company is in rapid growth phase due to winning a large number of new contracts overseas. They operate out of convenient offices close to public transport in Newmarket, offer relatively flexible working hours and an incredibly supportive team environment

The Role

As the Senior Angular Developer, you will be reporting to the Lead Front End Developer as part of a wider team of nine in development. From a front-end perspective, you will work alongside one other junior Angular Developer who you will assist with mentoring on a day-to-day basis. As the company currently develops in Angular 6, any experience with Angular2+ is very beneficial

Your Profile

You will have at least 5 years of development experience, ideally focused on front end development. Excellent communication skills are essential as is having NZ residency/citizenship - candidates who hold work visas are unfortunately not being considered for this position

Apply Today

Please send your resume in Microsoft Word format by clicking on the apply button or for further information, contact Sean Smyth, Ian, Thomas or Josh in our Auckland office on 09-915-6700.

Job Reference No: 06900-0011562966

name: Contract Android Engineer
description:
The Company

The rapidly growing company has been operating for over 15 years and are the global leader in their field. They have a large project that is due to be completed by June 2021 and as such, are looking for an experienced senior Android Engineer to join their team. They are happy to wait 4 weeks for the right person so are happy to accommodate someone who is currently in a permanent role but looking to start their contracting career

The Role

As the Senior Android Engineer you will be reporting to the Software Development manager as part of a wider team of ~30 in development in Auckland, with other developers spread out throughout the World. The company is expanding their embedded Android offering so are looking for an experienced Android Engineer with in-depth Android knowledge

Key Tech:

  • Android (essential)
  • Kotlin (Essential)
  • C++ (ability to read C++ is preferred but not essential)

Your Profile

You will be an experienced Android Developer with at least 5 years experience specialising in Android development. Although you will be working as part of a bigger team, you will have the ability to self-manage and have the ability to "hit the ground running". Clear communication skills are essential and experience in embedded Android is preferred but not essential

Please send your resume in Microsoft Word format by clicking on the apply button or for further information, contact Sean Smyth or Ian Hamilton in our Auckland office on 09-915-6700.

Job Reference No: 06900-0011570325

name: Intermediate Front End Developer
description:
We develop and distribute disruptive technology that innovates, automates, and changes the Veterinary market globally. Auckland HQ is where the bulk of the engineering horsepower is based with a turbo charged London operation that continues to grow. We run a pod structure (currently 7), follow agile methodology, write elegant code to the tune of Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 on black widow mechanical keyboards…well not really but it sounds provocative.

We are in the process of releasing a re-architected application with completely separated Front End & Back End. The Front End is being rebuilt in ReactJS/Redux and the Back End is being rebuilt in Laravel, all with best practice principles front and center. Think the stability of a established application with the code standards of a start-up code base.

We are on a quest for an Intermediate Front End Developer. You will be part of our small Front End team who is taking charge of upgrading our legacy application into a new, revamped ReactJS App. As a Front End Developer, you'll be 100% dedicated to the new tools

What your day may look like:

  • The design and build of front end framework to achieve a completely separated back and front end of ezyVet.
  • Taking an active role in project planning discussions, collaborating with project engineers and key stakeholders, and leading on front end development considerations.
  • Auditing and evaluating front-end code structure resulting in a consistent, clean, scalable and robust front end.
  • Documenting processes and policies to be utilized by the wider development team.
  • Training and mentoring developers.

What you'll bring

  • 2+ years of commercial front-end web development experience.
  • Proven success with React.
  • A keen interest in the look, feel and experience for cloud applications
  • A great attitude - our team is filled with a bunch of inspirational, driven individuals that have a great attitude towards development
  • Experience developing and/or consuming API's

We're looking for someone passionate, curious and collaborative to fill this role. If you're hungry to learn, keen to grow and excited by our journey, then we'd love to hear from you!

About ezyVet

With a little kiwi ingenuity and a lot of passion, ezyVet came into existence. A cloud-based, feature rich software solution for Veterinary Practices all around the world. ezyVet is quietly disrupting the global veterinary industry. With customers in over 20 countries, 120+ staff across offices in London, Dallas and Auckland, there's no better time than now to join the ezyVet journey.

name: Trading Systems Data Engineer
description:
Company Profile:

Kenetic Trading is a proprietary trading firm that deploys medium and high frequency trading strategies in the global cryptocurrency markets. Based in Hong Kong, we are a 24/7 business, trading digital assets in 10+ locations around the globe, with a team of world-class talent spanning 5 countries.

We are one of the fastest growing market makers in the entire industry. Our arbitrage engines generate tens of millions of orders per day, and our trading team combines a systematic approach with sophisticated pricing models, iterating regularly to ensure robust trading performance.

More information can be found on our company website: http://www.kenetic.capital

Summary of Position:

This is an opportunity to become both steward and champion for the firm's market and trading data archives and the systems which capture, transform and load trading data to and from those archives.

You’ll learn from our experienced trading team and help develop and support systems that execute millions of trades on ‘crypto’ exchanges across the globe.

Reporting to: Chief Technology Officer

Job responsibilities include:

  • Assume end to end accountability for the warehoused data, helping modify trading systems to add telemetry as well as conducting the design and deployment of the data pipeline infrastructure
  • Create tools to automate the configuration, deployment and troubleshooting of the data pipeline
  • Develop strategies to make our data pipeline efficient, timely and robust in a 24/7 trading environment
  • Implement monitoring that measures the completeness and accuracy of captured data
  • Manage the impact that changes to trading systems and upstream protocols have on the data pipeline
  • Back populate and clean historical datasets
  • Collaborate with traders and trading system developers to understand our data analysis requirements, and to continue to improve the quality of our stored data
  • Develop tools, APIs and screens to provide easy access to the archived data

Position Requirements:

  • A Python programmer, experienced using asyncio
  • 3+ years experience developing in C++, on linux
  • Experience with developing real time large scale data pipelines, with petabytes of data
  • Experience with distributed, high performance SQL and NoSQL database systems
  • You have excellent written and verbal English
  • You are reliable, take pride in delivering robust software and are willing to be on call to support the systems you develop.
  • A bachelor's degree (or above) in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar, with excellent results.
  • Experience with AWS or other cloud computing infrastructure

Highly Desirable:

o Linux system administration skills

o Protocol level network analysis experience

o Experience with terraform

o Experience with Hive and Hadoop

o Experience with cryptocurrency exchanges, and cryptocurrency trading

Job Type: Full-time

Experience:

  • developing in C++ on linux: 3 years (Required)

Education:

  • Secondary School (Preferred)

name: Pre-Construction Manager (In Vancouver, CANADA)
description:
ABOUT US

LifeTec Construction Group is a new company on the leading edge of the construction industry, using the world’s most advanced end-to-end cold-formed steel (CFS) building design and construction technology. We are the first organization in Western Canada and the Pacific Northwest to introduce FRAMECAD’s proprietary steel framing technology. By applying the world’s most advanced steel printing software and CNC machinery, we render, print and assemble light gauge steel structures in ¼ of the time when compared to traditional framing methods. We pre-assemble our panels in our factory and install steel wall panels, floor joists, and roof trusses, which is where you come in.

PRE-CONSTRUCTION MANAGER - Cold Form Steel (CFS)

This full-time position located in Surrey, BC (outside of Vancouver, BC Canada) is very important to our organization. It needs a quick-minded, bright and energetic individual, capable of working semi-autonomously, with a commitment to integrity, honesty and forthrightness in all dealings, both externally and internally and with a genuine passion for estimating.

Your responsibilities will include;

  • Develop business plans and sales strategies to continue to grow the business and support revenue and profit objectives
  • Create and be accountable for annual departmental budget
  • Oversee and manage members of the pre-construction team, including the directing and motivating of their efforts within assigned divisions and clients
  • Lead weekly sales meetings, prepare and issue meeting minutes, manage the forward progress of all leads by way of thoughtful and proactive client management, including holding staff accountable for daily tasks and meaningful reporting
  • Along with the CEO and Board of Directors, play a major role in setting and achieving monthly, quarterly and annual sales objectives and targets
  • Lead the development and delivery of high-quality professional proposals including distilling requirements of an RFP, forming the team to respond and managing all parties and information towards the deadline
  • Provide input and direction for the Go or No Go Process
  • Manage all aspects of the bid process from request to submission
  • Prepare thorough and accurate cost estimates for prospective work
  • Align cost estimate templates with accounting for generation of cost reports
  • Building an estimating database which allows for quick reference on repetitive and recurring items
  • Conduct material and pricing research locally and abroad
  • From time to time, participate in value engineering exercises
  • Always be on the watch for “Murphy”, meaning, anticipate where things could go wrong will go wrong and plan accordingly
  • Successfully negotiate and close sales
  • Follow thru and report on lost sales opportunities
  • Lead the handover of successful proposals to Project Management, including scope, estimate, schedule and particular client issues
  • Develop and maintain detailed knowledge of the Company’s products and services
  • Be aware of the activities of our competitors
  • Provide input to the team on Marketing to support sales objectives
  • Provide intelligence of Marketing collateral, including print, digital media, website and social media
  • Assist with the writing of design marketing materials (articles, presentations, brochures, press releases, monthly company newsletter, etc)
  • Participate with website updates including content, organization, updates, blogs and posts to Twitter and Linkedin
  • Collect, organize and manage photograph storage and quality
  • Plan and lead our attendance at strategically selected trade shows
  • Actively develop and maintain a professional network through participation in appropriate industry functions and meetings
  • Nurture prospective client relationships to create specific opportunities where our experience and expertise can be leveraged, including the possibility of travelling to meet them
  • Establish and maintain strong relationships with the community, developers, municipal officials, economic development representatives, consulting teams, general contractors and other prospective clients locally and abroad
  • Maintain and grow your technical knowledge in order to offer our clients timely and impromptu solutions to their technical challenges
  • Be a growing source of expertise both in-house and to external clients
  • Represent the Company and its reputation through proactive involvement in lunch & learn sessions, technical seminars and committees
  • Manage the accuracy of information in our pipeline
  • Lead in the implementation of a new CRM system including data export of all relevant Company data
  • Establish and manage systems to bring greater efficiency to all Pre-Con activities.

REQUIREMENTS

As our work is technical, a university degree in a related field is preferred, though a combination of post-secondary education and industry experience may substitute. A minimum of 5 years in a construction related field is required as is work experience in cold-formed steel. In addition you will bring strong practical math skills, with a keen awareness of what the numbers mean, you will be comfortable with reading construction drawings and specification with experience in both metric and imperial measurement systems. Personally you will be detailed, accurate, organized and disciplined in your approach and delivery. Intermediate to advanced skills in AutoCad and MS Project and advanced in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) and PDF manipulations. Your ability to free hand sketch will be considered and asset. A competitive salary and benefits plan can be expected.

Reference ID: 103

Job Type: Full-time

COVID-19 considerations:
Remote working options are possible until COVID-19 travel restrictions are lifted. Consider applying to this role, if you are interested in relocating to Vancouver, BC Canada.

Experience:

  • Pre-Construction : 5 years (Preferred)
  • Cold Form Steel (CFS): 3 years (Required)

Work Remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

name: Senior Consultant- Functional and Support - BC
description:
Auckland

Intergen is seeking a Senior Consultant to take ownership for the implementation, configuration and delivery of Dynamics D365 BC projects!



As a Senior Functional and Support Consultant (BC) within our Business Applications team you’ll take ownership for the implementation, configuration and delivery of Dynamics D365 BC projects (and Dynamics NAV where relevant) and handling Support Cases to provide outstanding business solutions.

Work will be split of work between Delivery and Support. You'll be involved in pre-sales when required as well as Response For Proposals (RFP) responses and building those customer relationships from the get-go.

You'll work in partnership with our clients, advising them how to use Business Applications to meet their business objectives within agreed timelines.

  • Take ownership of consultancy, configuration engagements and solution delivery (incl. Scope of engagement and Project Plan definition), working with peers (Consultants, Developers from both – Service and Operations focus points), Project Managers / Project Coordinators, Solution Specialists, National D365 BC Practice Lead and Business Applications Practice Manager, as well as with clients to ensure successful delivery and on-going support as needed. Work on the projects in New Zealand, Australia and United States and aim to broaden the geographical footprint of Intergen’s “yellowness”.
  • Undertake client consultancy and product configuration in line with business requirements and form Functional Requirements and/or Functional Design / Functional Specification, as required. Provide guidance and clarifications to more junior members of the team and to the developers. Participate in developing solution prototypes to prove solution approach and design. Analyse available in the AppSource options for streamlined delivery of Vertical- and Horizontal Solutions for D365 BC.
  • Respond to the Cases raised by Clients (as Incidents or Requests) or internal Team in the defined timeframe (and with focused efforts initial analysis and response 30min., follow-up with estimates in collaboration with developers - further 1.5 Hrs.), update Support Cases frequently and aim for quick resolutions.
  • Provide quality assurance (incl. health-check, diagnostics and estimates review) across solutions and client engagements as a value-add to the quality of solutions and deliverables.
  • Work in partnership with clients, advising them how to use information technology thus enabling them to meet their business objectives (based on benefits analysis), overcome problems and gain an understanding of high-level technical concepts (incl. ERP and integration points with external systems).
  • Help more junior Team members in Cases resolutions and project work.
  • Adhere to the efficient time management, avoid growing backlog of the Cases and tasks.


The Person
You will be passionate, reliable, disciplined, stress-resistant, result-oriented, highly motivated, striving to achieve above and beyond, and client focused team-member.

You need to prove that you have deep knowledge of D365 BC or previous versions of NAV (preferable Microsoft certifications), and have a good business understanding (and experience) of advanced inventory & logistics (supply chain management) and advanced warehouse management. Good knowledge of financial module and consolidation is a must; advanced manufacturing is a bonus.

Intergen has a vibrant culture and aims to get the best out of its people (leveraging diversity, promoting advantages and working together on capabilities gaps and areas to improve) so if you like striving to new heights and working with the latest solutions then you’ll slot right in.

You will have:

  • Great experience in collaboration with the Team of top experts in D365 BC in New Zealand.
  • Extensive commercial experience in installation, configuration and delivery of Dynamics D365 BC solutions (standard, customised with Extensions, and integrated), along with some experience or desire to drive value with the Power Platform (incl. Power Apps, Logic Apps, PowerBI);
  • Experience from presales to final delivery; ensuring that each element of solution is properly scoped, designed, implemented and functionally tested to meet our client's business needs.
  • Confidence working directly with clients (remotely or on-site), and aptitude for gaining a thorough understanding of their vision will be huge strengths.
  • A hunger for knowledge with the passion to learn about the latest innovations in the industry (and multiple industries representing Clients’ breadth), which you will enjoy sharing with the wider team.

The Benefits
Aside from offering a great job in a great New Zealand city with the excellent lifestyle (balance), with an awesome team, we offer ongoing support and development for your future career growth (including an option to architect your own career under supervision of Practice Lead and Practice Managers), an awesome social calendar – weekly social gatherings, team sports events, a focus on health and well being, including a flexible Work from Home program, sporting teams, discounted health insurance, Friday Meetings and much more! We make sure you are connected to your colleagues with the latest technologies, have a fantastic reward and recognition program and we’re a Public Company (ASX listed).

Apply online today for further information.

name: Staircase Designer
description:
We are looking for a designer (industrial / architectural) to join our client working with a luxury range of staircases. The company provides beautiful and long lasting staircases that are used by architects, builders, homeowners and developers all around New Zealand.

You will be the designer who will design staircases according to customer specifications and these designs will then be manufactured by their in-house manufacturing department. The company has been running for over 20 years and they have built up a great reputation with their customers.

You will be joining a successful company with the right values in place.

The role:

  • Using computer programs to design the product
  • Design and program the product so the factory team can manufacture them and the installers can install them
  • Accurate design and programming with no errors
  • Liaise with customer to ensure the product is as they desire
  • Assist customers with choosing their final design
  • Able to use computer software to program CNC router
  • Clear job card designs and programmes, so the factory knows exactly what to make
  • Issuing of installation documents to ensure a smooth installation process.

What we need from you:

  • Studies in industrial design would be highly regarded
  • Architectural experience or manufacturing experience
  • Experienced in using a range of design programmes (or ability to learn quickly) - 3D Design experience, using CAD software
  • Highly detail orientated
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • See work through from start to finish

If this sounds like you, then apply today! This is a company that likes to take care of their employee's and offer reumeration reflective of experience. This is not a creative role as such, and would suit someone interested in problem solving and detail orientated.

For any questions please contact Lara Evans - Lara.evans@awf.co.nz or 0212466017

name: Cloud Engineer
description:
• Can be based in Auckland or Wellington
New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments. We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion. We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.
About the role
It's an exciting time to join us as we transform the way we work and deliver technology to meet the needs of our customers. Our Networks and Infrastructure team have ambitious goals to migrate our applications and data to the public cloud to maintain our currency and set us up for continued future success. As a Cloud Engineer, you will enable our cloud journey by using AWS and Azure to engineer and build scalable, secure, reliable and cost-effective cloud environments.
You will have the opportunity to build and implement self-service models for developers and users to consume cloud platforms, and will work within cross-functional product teams to ensure proper implementation of the product vision, with a particular focus on simplicity and ease of use.
About you
You'll have to roll your sleeves up for this hands-on role, and you will have skills and experience across a wide range of cloud services and strong knowledge of DevOps processes and tools in the cloud. We're really interested in hearing about your experience in transforming legacy on-premise architecture into modernised cloud-based solutions including utilising micro-services, containerisation and serverless models. You'll need to be able to programme using at least one scripting language, and your superb communication and engagement skills with the capability to translate for non-technical audiences will be needed to provide consulting services for internal business units and development teams.
Interested?
We're offering you the chance to work with a great team and get stuck in to some interesting and rewarding work that adds real value as we drive our transformation. If you have the skills and experience we are looking for and a willingness to grow and develop your skills further we invite you to apply now. We are only accepting applications via www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter. For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz
Applications close 4 October 2020. We will be reviewing applications regularly and may close the advertising period early.
All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and may be required to undertake a drug test and credit check.

name: Senior Developer Application Services
description:
Finance and Technology Palmerston North
Du​e to Covid-19 and the worldwide pandemic, we are currently only accepting applications from New Zealand Citizens, New Zealand Residents who are either residing in New Zealand or overseas OR applicants who hold a valid work visa and are currently living in New Zealand.
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to build software solutions to support engagement with students and assist them on their University journey?
In this Senior Developer Applications Services role, we are looking for a talented, experienced individual that will assume a key role that includes technical leadership, architecture, design and development within the University's Student ecosystem.
You will work closely with other software developers, business analysts, software architects and IT professionals to develop solutions for our Application Services team. In addition, you will be willing and able to mentor Developers and Graduate Developers and share your knowledge with the wider team.

To work with us you will need the following:
  • To be enthusiastic, highly motivated and client focused
  • Have ideally five years' experience in software development including analysis and solution design experience over the entire SDLC
  • Proven skills in software development projects specifically using agile
  • Office 365 with Microsoft Power Apps skills
You will need to have proven interpersonal skills to develop relationships and communicate software complexities in a simple yet persuasive manner at a senior level. Attention to detail, documentation, the ability to reason logically - yet creatively and sound problem solving skills are key components of this role.
Massey University offers plenty of opportunity for professional development, a great team environment and an opportunity to engage with a wide range of different teams across the organisation. Palmerston North City and Manawatū offers a beautiful environment where it is easy to manage a work-life balance, thanks to the stunning scenery, short commutes, excellent city facilities and affordable housing.
So, what are you waiting for?
We really want to hear from you, even if it's just to ask some questions about this job or to have a chat in confidence. Please call Rodney Stacey - UX and Application Development Manager (06) 3569099 ext. 83727
Applications close 11:30pm Sunday, 4 October 2020.
For further information and to apply online, visit: http://masseyunicareers.nga.net.nz

name: Foreman
description:
Ryman Construction is seeking an experienced Foreman to join our team in Christchurch to work our Riccarton Park project.

  • Large scale project work
  • Work for a developer, designer, builder and operator
  • Work for a company that is committed to safety

About Ryman Healthcare
At Ryman we are pioneering a new way to live for a new retirement generation - who are pioneering what it means to live life to the full. We always have, and always will, challenge the status quo and adapt to better serve our residents and team members.

At Ryman, we care about every detail, which is why we design and build and operate all our retirement villages ourselves - to ensure everything is perfect. To achieve this, we need to hire the best people.

Our land bank is the strongest it's ever been - we are about to move into our biggest ever build programme. We expect to have 15 sites under construction in the next 12 months.


The Project

Our Riccarton Park Retirement Village is located on a 5-hectare site off Steadman Rd, which overlooks the racecourse and will provide great views across to the Port Hills and Southern Alps.

The village provides independent and assisted living options, with a total of approx. 60 townhouses and 5 apartment blocks (with basement), as well as a care centre main block (with basement), which offers rest home, hospital and dementia-level care.

Amenities will include an indoor swimming pool, a movie theatre, cafe, hair and beauty salon and a bowling green.

What will you do?

Reporting to the site-based Project Manager, you will lead a site-based construction team and take responsibility for health & safety, project planning, execution and quality assurance of the works.


Who Are You:

  • You value people and kindness, and are passionate about delivering excellent results
  • As a resilient person you keep going, even when there are bumps in the road and you show composure under pressure
  • You believe in the value of strong, positive, trusting teams who work together as one
  • You value communication that is simple, clear and straight to the point
  • Have an enthusiastic 'can do' attitude and are able to fit into a dynamic and proactive team

What's in it for you?
This is your opportunity to join a team with ambitions to lead the industry at a global level. You will be surrounded by people who are not content with "standard" and will work for a company that will support you to be your best self and do the same for your team.

In addition, a career at Ryman offers:

  • Ongoing support for professional development, with tailored leadership programmes
  • The opportunity to join the Ryman Employee Share Scheme
  • Additional wellbeing leave and you'll access to over 60 discounts with well-known brands across a variety of sectors including; health and wellbeing, banking, insurance, and retail
  • You'll get to use your initiative and work on exciting large-scale projects

Senior Frontend Developer

ABOUT THE COMPANY
Innovative organisation working on a digital and unique B2B solution. Very cool and new age company which is growing fast!

We’re looking for an experienced Senior Frontend Developer with a “can-do” attitude. The role will be a mix of coding, developing, support and maintenance as well as proposing new ideas to enhance the platform. The main project you’ll be working on is a mobile app, however there will be other pieces of work you’ll be contributing to.
This organisation very much welcomes the thoughts of its employees and is after someone that can work autonomously and is comfortable running a dedicated project and taking all the responsibilities.

  • Continuing the transitioning to their React frontend

  • Paying down technical debt by refactoring old code
  • Improving frontend practices
  • Championing automated testing
  • Championing code reviews
  • Championing Internal documentation
  • Extending our Mobile (Flutter) app with the next set of features

ABOUT YOU
You are a seasoned frontend UX expert with solid commercial experience and knowledge of React, ES6, Typescript. You practice and preach unit/integration testing, enjoy reviewing PRs, working in a close-knit team and keeping up to date with your craft. You relish clean and well architectured code. You are pragmatic, results oriented, and get a strong sense of satisfaction knowing customers are using your UI to make their lives easier.
You may not have any mobile cross platform development experience (eg RN, Flutter) but have an interest in doing so. Whilst your primary language is JS you are comfortable learning new languages and frameworks and probably have used a variety of other programming languages in a past lifetime which gives you wisdom beyond your years.

COMPANY CULTURE & BENEFITS
Flexible working hours and ability to partly work from home. Smart casual dress-code. A great location and offices plus an amazing work environment. Be part of a fast-growing organisation!

name: Major Developments Lead - Infrastructure
description:
Permanent position working 40 hours per week.

Napier is a lively and vibrant city, offering an exceptional climate as well as plentiful opportunities for family, recreation and relaxation. Improved road and air links are helping to make Napier one of New Zealand's most popular, liveable and easily accessible cities.

Napier City Council is one of Napier's biggest and most desirable employers - we value excellence, integrity, sustainability and outstanding customer and community service.

The purpose of this newly created role is to deliver Council's internal residential subdivision, Parklands, and to lead the delivery of Council infrastructure for key major greenfield developments across the city. We are looking for someone who understands the development industry and is able to develop collaborative relationships with developers, their agents and key internal people. You need to be customer-focused and enjoy resolving issues.

In addition to the management, timely development and forward planning of the Parklands subdivision, you will have a clear oversight of all major non-council developments to ensure they are enabled and adhere to the Council's code of practice and the District Plan.

You will bring your previous experience in project management involving civil infrastructure, and your knowledge of RMA subdivision and survey processes as well as a working of legislation, regulations and policies at a national, regional and local level. Experience in preparing reports to a professional standard is required.

Other requirements:

  • A tertiary qualification in planning or engineering or equivalent level of knowledge (e.g. 10+ years in a development or project management role involving civil infrastructure)
  • Proven successful project management - on time and on budget
  • Broad knowledge and practical application of engineering, environmental and planning principles
  • Excellent communication and organisational skills with proven ability to meet deadlines and manage stress

If you meet the requirements above and you're looking for a role where you can facilitate change and directly influence the subdivisions around Napier City, look no further - apply now!

You can download the full job description from the careers page on the Napier City Council website.

We will be interviewing suitable candidates as applications are received and may close this advertisement when we have found the right person.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Our preferred candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment screening which includes drug testing and, for some roles, health screening.



Applications Close: 25 Oct 2020

name: Senior Java Developer
description:
Halo Consulting is partnering with Chelmer, a leading Wealth Management business to hire Java Developers as their business continue to flourish. Chelmer is a New Zealand-founded financial software company, on a mission to make investing and wealth creation simple, intuitive, and accessible for all. They invest in technology and people and are now seeking to hire multiple Java Developers to join a high-performing team based here in Auckland.

Established in 1988, they have been pioneering broking-, trading- and wealth management technology for over 30 years. Their platforms are trusted by leading financial institutions across Asia Pacific and manage billions of dollars of investor assets.

Chelmer are expanding and we are now looking for Senior Java Developer to join their team. You will collaborate with a team of highly experienced engineers who are developing complex trading systems used within the New Zealand banking and financial market industry.

You will be an accomplished Senior Java Developer with a strong background in system integration. You will be a strong communicator who can meet deadlines and get up to speed with growing trends. Your background will show a thorough history in Java development, working as a senior and full-stack engineer.

What you will be doing:
  • Creating software architecture by designing and developing a reusable software component
  • Defining and promoting the use of well-defined and established software design patterns
  • Designing high performing and scalable software solutions
  • Ensuring code follows standard and is documented
  • Ensuring software architecture integrates with legacy, external and future systems
  • Creating unit tests, regression tests and integration tests
  • Replicating, understanding and fixing issues as quickly as possible

Key Skills and Experience:
  • Java development experience at a senior level – enterprise experience
  • Several years of experience working with Java and Java-related technologies.
  • Experience developing solutions using ElasticSearch
  • Experience developing solutions with REST-based WebServices
  • Commercial experience or the desire to learn to develop solutions with RedHat jBPM.
  • Cloud development experience in AWS, Azure would be highly desirable
  • Enthusiasm and experience working in Agile environments, particularly continuous delivery
  • Team player, fun, outgoing and passionate about high-quality code
Previous experience in Wealth Management is a bonus!

You'll need to possess a passion for technology and a work portfolio that reflects this.

This role will bring you a lot of satisfaction and will allow you to develop your career. You will need to have a passion for technology and a work history that illustrates a strong direction aimed at career growth.

Must have PR or NZ citizenship.

Note: Chelmer will not accept any unsolicited CV’s or any external applications for this position.

Note: We review all CV's manually and you will only be contacted if your skills and experience meet the requirements of any of our clients.
