name: Cloud Engineer
description:
• Can be based in Auckland or Wellington
New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments. We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion. We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.
About the role
It's an exciting time to join us as we transform the way we work and deliver technology to meet the needs of our customers. Our Networks and Infrastructure team have ambitious goals to migrate our applications and data to the public cloud to maintain our currency and set us up for continued future success. As a Cloud Engineer, you will enable our cloud journey by using AWS and Azure to engineer and build scalable, secure, reliable and cost-effective cloud environments.
You will have the opportunity to build and implement self-service models for developers and users to consume cloud platforms, and will work within cross-functional product teams to ensure proper implementation of the product vision, with a particular focus on simplicity and ease of use.
About you
You'll have to roll your sleeves up for this hands-on role, and you will have skills and experience across a wide range of cloud services and strong knowledge of DevOps processes and tools in the cloud. We're really interested in hearing about your experience in transforming legacy on-premise architecture into modernised cloud-based solutions including utilising micro-services, containerisation and serverless models. You'll need to be able to programme using at least one scripting language, and your superb communication and engagement skills with the capability to translate for non-technical audiences will be needed to provide consulting services for internal business units and development teams.
Interested?
We're offering you the chance to work with a great team and get stuck in to some interesting and rewarding work that adds real value as we drive our transformation. If you have the skills and experience we are looking for and a willingness to grow and develop your skills further we invite you to apply now. We are only accepting applications via www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter. For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz
Applications close 4 October 2020. We will be reviewing applications regularly and may close the advertising period early.
All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and may be required to undertake a drug test and credit check.

name: Cyber Security Specialist
description:
Cyber Security, it starts with you!

  • Royal NZ Police College, Wellington
  • Office of Constab / Police Employee
  • Permanent, Full-Time
  • From $95,725 Negotiable

About the role

We have an opportunity for two senior cyber security specialists who have the drive and determination to ensure that Police operates safely and successfully. These positions are within the Cyber Security Team, based at the Royal New Zealand Police College, Wellington.

You will provide expertise in the security standards, monitoring and processes used to keep Police information safe.

We are looking for experience and technically skilled Windows and/or linux engineers and administrators who have a real interest in cyber security and are looking to make the step up to a dedicated cyber security role within a growing security focused team. Ideally we are seeking technology professionals with at least 3 years of cloud platform experience in administrating the security aspects of Microsoft 365, Azure or AWS.

You will have led the technical response to cyber security within your existing role and would like to make the move to an organisation with the focus and resources to allow you to progress your career in cyber security.

You may be a developer with a strong cyber security career interest and have lead secure code practice. You will already be familiar with a wide range of cyber security applications and platforms over and above malware protection and patching. Able to demonstrate advanced management of security software and appliances. You will also understand the importance of constant monitoring and visibility to protect our information assets.

You will be able to comfortably hold and contribute to technical discussion across a wide range of technical disciplines such as networks, servers, storage applications and developers

Key Accountabilities:

  • Commitment to continuous improvement – Having the experience to apply creative and diverse thinking and share innovative approaches in an ever changing cyber environment.
  • Creating an adaptive operating environment – working across different systems and services with a strategic mindset, and coordinating teams and resources.
  • Planning and Prioritising – strategically managing time, priorities and responsibilities within projects.
  • Writing and preparing written documents to a high standard, whilst applying lateral thinking to our security approaches.
  • Upholding integrity – Ensuring the highest ethical standards are applied and upheld.
  • Enabling through leadership – Developing the capability of our people by ensuring the have the correct tools and technology to safely deliver Our Business.

Special Requirements:

  • To apply for this role you must be a NZ or Australian Citizen or NZ permanent resident
  • Have top secret security clearance or the ability to obtain it
  • The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full reference and security check prior to any offer of employment being made
  • As a part of the selection process applicants will be required to undergo a psychometric test

What you’ll bring

Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others

We are looking for experience and technically skilled Windows and/or linux engineers and administrators who have a real interest in cyber security and are looking to make the step up to a dedicated cyber security role within a growing security focused team.

  • Working knowledge of cloud platform experience in administrating the security aspects of Microsoft 365, Azure or AWS.
  • have lead secure code practice
  • familiar with a wide range of cyber security applications and platforms over and above malware protection and patching
  • understand the importance of constant monitoring and visibility to protect our information assets

You will have led the technical response to cyber security within your existing role and would like to make the move to an organisation with the focus and resources to allow you to progress your career in cyber security.

You may be a developer with a strong cyber security career interest and have lead secure code practice. You will be able to comfortably hold and contribute to technical discussion across a wide range of technical disciplines such as networks, servers, storage applications and developers.

This role is set at Individual Contributor level, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.

We will ask you questions based on “ How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor. For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf . These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf

To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser: https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/09-2020/cyber_security_specialist_0.pdf

About us

Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure.

Working Flexibly

Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business.

For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers

How to apply

If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers

If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact your Talent Pathway Advisor at Lauren.Gennills@police.govt.nz .

Applications will close at 5pm on Friday 2nd October 2020.

name: Software Engineer - BI & Data Warehouse
description:

The BI and Analytics team exists to support good decision making and evolve strategic thinking by providing a world-class data platform.

You will work alongside the BI and data warehouse experts to deliver excellent BI Solutions for the Council. You will enjoy working hands-on with data warehouse development, ETL, SAP BW and cloud solutions. You will also be able to provide technical input and guidance to the team.

name: Senior Experience Designer
description:
Your skills & experience

In your role as a Senior Experience Designer, your day-to-day tasks will consist of collaborating with clients and Pikselin teams to understand the opportunity presented to us holistically while analysing, understanding, and coming up with a solution that is fit for purpose.

One of the key aspects of your role is to design a solution by creating design assets for a wide range of products, including websites and online applications.

You will work closely with the team to lead conversations with the clients while engaging and realising opportunities for Pikselin.

A Senior Experience Designer will be able to plan, execute and document all the following activities:

  • Engage clients to define business goals, use cases, requirements in context of the project and technical specifications for developers
  • Content analysis to define Information Architecture, test and refine solution
  • User research, usability testing, analysis of data and report writing
  • Create experience maps, user journeys and flows
  • Develop wireframes and prototypes
  • Execute all visual & UI design stages from brand briefing, concept to final hand-off to developers
  • Define specification for developers for design implementation
  • Work with developers to refine design during application build

Consulting & discovery

Work with client to understand and articulate their strategy, business goals, problem statements and vision.

Presentation & pitching

Talk about the design process in context of Pikselin's work in an engaging story telling way.

Workshopping

Organise and facilitate stakeholder workshops to achieve agreement on scope, understand needs, discuss potential solutions, showcase work completed and gain feedback.

Collaboration with team & clients

Work closely with your colleagues and clients in a collaborative manner while taking the lead throughout the lifecycle of design & development

Planning for a project

Able to plan tasks while undertaking a project. Have the maturity to understand when a project needs to pivot and work with the client and Pikselin team to provide workable solutions to reach the end goal.

Workload management

Take responsibility and be proactive in managing work allocated on projects. In complex projects, take the lead on assisting successful delivery of the project to the clients.

Project estimations

Plan and estimate design activities required during pre-sales engagement.

Culture fit

Be a strong fit to our internal culture and values – Empathetic, Connected, Pragmatic, Thoughtful, Flexible & no egos!

Interested in talking to us?

If you are interested in finding out more and having a chat with us, feel free to drop in a line with your CV and portfolio.

You will bring your previous experience in project management involving civil infrastructure, and your knowledge of RMA subdivision and survey processes as well as a working of legislation, regulations and policies at a national, regional and local level. Experience in preparing reports to a professional standard is required.

Other requirements:

  • Broad knowledge and practical application of engineering, environmental and planning principles
  • Excellent communication and organisational skills with proven ability to meet deadlines and manage stress

If you meet the requirements above and you're looking for a role where you can facilitate change and directly influence the subdivisions around Napier City, look no further - apply now!

You can download the full job description from the careers page on the Napier City Council website.

We will be interviewing suitable candidates as applications are received and may close this advertisement when we have found the right person.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

Our preferred candidates will be required to undergo pre-employment screening which includes drug testing and, for some roles, health screening.

name: Developer Lead - Portainer.io
description:
Portainer.io: Developer Lead: Who, What, Why & Where

Portainer is on a mission to make container management simple, quick and easy. Whether it's Kubernetes, Swarm, Docker, or Edge compute, the drive to create expert, elegant, simple, yet powerful tools that make the complex simple is what makes us tick.

In its first three years, Portainer has experienced staggering global uptake of its Open Source product, with hundreds of thousands of active users and many hundreds of millions of downloads. Now we're making the transition to our first commercial product, backed by an awesome group of global investors.

To help us bring our vision for Portainer to life, we're searching for a second Developer Lead to manage a small team of developers.

Who?

We're looking for a person, perhaps a first-time leader, with the skills and passion to:

  • Define and implement modern software architectural principles that will underpin the scalability, security, and reliability of the Portainer code who can work across the wider developer community
  • Work cross-functionally inside Portainer and have the ability to influence decision making inside and outside the company
  • Help build and recruit and then lead a world-class, smart and talented development team; through active team leadership, mentoring and coaching
  • Ensure that product release timelines are met and that only quality and secure code is released into the public domain in an agile way.


What?

As the Developer Lead, you will be responsible for:

  • Managing your team of developers to create quality features
  • Managing the day to day developer backlog of your team, and cross-team where appropriate
  • Playing an active role in developing new features for Portainer.io


For this to be the right job for you, you'll need to have demonstrable experience:

  • Developing in AngularJS 1.8 and GoLang. (This is a must-have. Please do not apply if you haven't got these 'must haves' nailed).
  • Building and using Docker and Kubernetes platforms and APIs (almost as critical).
  • Working with cloud provider managed Kubernetes offerings (AKS, EKS, GKE).
  • Using container registry solutions (Docker Registry, Gitlab Registry, Quay.io Registry).
  • Authentication Providers; LDAP (MS AD and OpenLDAP), oAuth (Azure AD, Google Auth, Auth0, OKTA).
  • Monitoring Tools (Prometheus and Graphana).
  • Reverse Proxies (Traefik and Nginx, with and without TLS).
  • Linux and Windows Operating Systems running the Docker engine.
  • Logging tools (ELK stack or GreyLog)

Where?

Portainer is a global company with employees spread across the world. We've invested heavily to ensure that geography doesn't get in our way, and we plan to expand our global footprint rapidly over the coming months.

The right candidate can work in any country they choose, however, our preference is for the person to be in a time zone that allows regular day time interactions with developers in Europe, New Zealand, and the Middle East.

For the right candidate, Portainer.io will offer a sponsored work visa, allowing you to live and work in New Zealand. Consider it a perk of the job!


Why?

Portainer is already exploding; however, we're still very much in our infancy. We are hugely excited about our launch into the commercial world, and we believe we're at the start of a wild ride. Joining Portainer as our Developer Lead will give you:

  • The opportunity to play an instrumental role in shaping a truly disruptive company at the beginning of it's journey.
  • A great remuneration package
  • The flexibility to work remotely as part of a world-class team working on great tech
  • The opportunity to spend time or live in New Zealand, if not the best country in the world, then the best country for the world.

About us:

Hundreds of thousands of organisations around the world have turned to Portainer to help them manage their container platforms. With deployments in almost every country of the world, and at a scale from very small to impressively large, Portainer has become synonymous with our catchphrase of "expert simplicity". Our goal is to provide the most user-friendly means to manage your micro-service platform, regardless of orchestrator, cloud provider, or underlying technology.

name: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
He Waka Eke Noa | Creating Great Together

Here at BNZ, it's about more than just banking. We work together in an agile, energising environment to create innovative solutions that won't just help our customers be good with money, but also do great things with it.

We are looking for a Developer to help create our Digital banking applications, deliver new and innovative features to give our customers a great banking experience. This is a 12 month fixed term opportunity.

Te Kaiurungi | About the Role

You will deliver a range of software applications/development services through design, development, programming, testing and maintenance of technology solutions aligned with business objectives. This includes:

  • Work within an Agile Team to analyse business processes, procedures and user requirements in order to establish system requirements
  • Contribute to system/application design including production of system and program documentation as well as ongoing maintenance
  • Develop solutions and specifications so that agreed requirements can be converted into functional systems
  • Undertake testing activities in relation to software solutions ensuring that quality meets agreed specifications/requirements
  • Create development and support documentation and provide advice regarding applications to enable support functions to operate effectively
  • Contribute to the review and redesign of processes or procedures, on an ongoing basis, to deliver improved system productivity or efficiency
  • Resolve production incidents (through diagnosis, testing & applying fix) for assigned application/s

Ō Pūkenga | About You

You'll be a team player who has excellent communication skills, with a huge desire to learn. You will also bring:

  • Experience in development and maintenance of technology applications
  • Experience with modern development frameworks & languages (Apigee, JWT, Openshift, API's, Mulesoft, ServerSide development, Javascript, AWS}
  • Experience in programming using Java, Java Script, basic or working understanding of REST APIs, XML, JSON data formats. Basic UNIX commands.
  • Experience in using relational database (E.g. MySQL, Postgress, DB2 etc.,)
  • Experience in using source control tools like Git, SVN
  • Experience with Integration technologies
  • Understanding of or Competent Agile practitioner, not just following practices, but translating principals into action
  • Proven ability to communicate ideas and designs clearly and concisely
  • Keen to learn and be mentored by others

Nau mai ki te Pēke o Aotearoa |Working at BNZ

At BNZ, we're passionate about building and sustaining a high-performance culture that motivates our people to deliver exceptional results. We know that every BNZer is unique, with a wide range of goals, ambitions, and lifestyles, so we offer a wide range of benefits and working styles to suit you.

  • Wellbeing: Your wellbeing is important to us. When we're at our best, physically and mentally, in and out of work, we can truly create great things together. We're here to support you to be your best with a number of wellbeing initiatives.
  • Leave: We all need a bit of time off every now and then. At BNZ we're proud to offer the generous leave options you need and deserve - whether it's for a special occasion, an unexpected event, or an extended vacation.
  • Flexibility: We're big on helping you balance life and work. We offer a range of flexible working options that help you be your best, wherever you're based. Talk to us about how we can make this work for you.


Haere mai ki Te Peke o Aotearoa | Come to the Bank of New Zealand

This is an exciting opportunity to join us! BNZ is an award winning, forward-thinking, diverse and inclusive organisation with an ambitious change agenda. We're bold thinkers who are taking brave steps to create a company that people want to work for, and customers want to bank with. If you're ready to progress your career with BNZ, apply now and help more New Zealander's be good with money, so they can do great things with it.

name: Principal Solutions Architect
description:
To thrive in this roles it is anticipated that you will have:
  • In depth experience with the design and implementation of distributed applications
  • Experience with modern cloud architectures
  • Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.)
  • A background in software development tools and methodologies with experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT projects
  • A drive to deliver the best outcome for your customer that goes beyond their expectations

Come build the future with us! We are a company of builders with diverse backgrounds, ideas and points of view who invent on behalf of our customers.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated technologists who possess a unique balance of technical depth, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills. Following an internal move, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to join our Architecture team as a trusted advisor to iconic New Zealand brands who are leading the field in SaaS solutions on AWS.

As a trusted customer advocate, the Principal Solutions Architect will work to understand their business needs and provide guidance and best practices on how to leverage cloud technologies to solve these with innovative solutions. The ability to connect technology with measureable business value and help customers solve problems is critical to a solutions architect. You will represent AWS in face-to-face meetings and own the overall technical relationship between AWS and the customer up to C-level.

It is expected you will have a strong understanding of large scale computing solutions and experience leading deep architecture discussions. You must be self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges and have a passion for educating, training, and designing cloud solutions for enterprise customers. Software will be your thing and though you may only dabble in hands on coding now you will have a development background to call on and remain committed to curiosity around technology and its evolution.

With a diverse team, flexible work environment and a fantastic culture this is a role where you can take ownership and have a meaningful impact.

This role can be based in either Auckland or Wellington.


In addition to the above it would be great if you have:
  • Technical degree; Computer Science or Math background desired,
· Working knowledge of software development tools and methodologies · Experience architecting or operating solutions build on AWS or other public cloud platform
  • Experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or technical consulting
  • Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers
  • Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud

“Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.”

name: Senior Cadwork Detailer
description:
Offsite Design Ltd are experts in off-site manufacture of timber buildings offering unique design, engineering, and drafting services to prefabricators, contractors, and developers to help build the timber buildings of tomorrow. From tiny house, family homes to medium-rise, residential and commercial projects. Domestic and overseas clients.
Our specialist services include: DfMA (Design for Manufacture and Assembly), 3D fabrication modelling, 2D shop drawings, and file-to-factory export to drive CNC equipment and the factory.

Timber construction and prefabrication are experiencing strong interest in New Zealand, Australia and beyond, e.g. CAD/CAM integrated fabrication processes are being introduced, panelised prefabrication is taken up by small and large companies, cross- and parallel-laminated timber (CLT and PLT) are produced locally at scale.
A severe housing shortage in Auckland, and general productivity, affordability, and sustainability issues in the industry demand an alternative approach to construction. Prefabrication and timber buildings are increasingly seen as solutions to these challenges.
Offsite Design Ltd are actively involved in these trends and we are keen to hire senior Cadwork detailers from October 2020.

Responsibilities
  • Production of 3D models and 2D drawings supporting the prefabrication and construction of a variety of timber buildings, from small family home to medium rise/multi-storey.
  • Modelling of light timber frame (LTF) panelised residential buildings for fabrication, incl. services.
  • 2D drafting/detailing of factory and assembly documentation.

Your experience and skills
  • In-depth knowledge and experience (min 5 years) of Cadwork.
  • Hands-on experience of construction and prefabrication of timber buildings (e.g Zimmererlehre, apprenticeship...).
  • Advanced experience using CADWORK , incl Element Module, machine export, etc.
  • Self-starter, with energy, passion, and genuine interest and exposure to timber construction.
  • Attention to detail and pride in your work.

We offer
  • A wide variety of projects across the whole range of engineered timber products and building typologies; from tiny house to multi-storey engineered timber structure.
  • Work at the leading edge of timber prefabrication and offsite manufacture in this part of the world, including involvement in R&D projects moving the industry forward.
- Work and Play in the outdoor paradise #1 of the south pacific - New Zealand.
  • A diverse and friendly team of individuals with a passion for building with wood, raising the quality of our built environment and the productivity of our industry.
  • Remuneration according to your skill set and experience.
Contact
Johann Betz
www.offsitedesign.co.nz

Resn is looking for a full time senior creative Javascript and CSS/HTML developer for our studio in Wellington, New Zealand.


You'll be working on the biggest and brightest international brands in global time zones (with a focus on APAC and USA). Your peerless development skills ensure that projects are completed to the highest standards, on time, within budget and with a smile on everyone's dials.


What sets you apart is your ability to make the front end come to life through code driven animations, transitions and little touches of class. You have a keen visual eye and understand the importance of getting it to look amazing. You care as much about the visuals as you do about the code.


You possess a deep understanding about the limitations of browsers and devices as you try to squeeze every drop of performance out of them.


Responsibilities

  • Hands-on front-end development for multiple projects including, but not limited to, campaign microsites, web based applications, large scale complex Javascript mobile and desktop websites, 3D experiences, games, installations, experiments and AR/VR experiences.
  • Defining project front end requirements, assisting with technical design documentation, project budget estimates and assessing feasibility of technical deliverables with your esteemed Creative and Producer colleagues.
  • Research and development into latest and greatest front end wizardry and processes.
  • Project tech leadership role as required.


Skills and Experience

  • 5+ years of development experience, ideally at senior or tech lead level.
  • Broad experience and solid understanding of interactive web technologies and front-end development using Javascript, HTML, CSS/LESS/SASS, Vue.js.
  • Experience working on large and complex interactive projects with multidisciplinary creative and technical teams.
  • Experience with short production timelines, hard deadlines, and moving targets.
  • A love of planning, scrumming combined with fantastic written and verbal communication skills.
  • The ability to maintain composure and focus when the escalating demands of work rear up like a rampant wildebeest.
  • Unbounding optimism and the desire to achieve the impossible!


Bonus Points

  • Experience with Three.js / GLSL / React Native / Unity.
  • Any other visually driven development languages.


Check us out

www.resn.co.nz



Powered by JazzHR

name: Project Manager - Light Commercial Construction
description:
Project Manager – Commercial Construction

We are looking for an experienced Project Manager with 5 years + NZ Commercial Construction experience and over 10 years within Construction. Our client is based in Rosedale, Auckland but sites are all over Auckland.

You would be reporting directly to the Managing Director and be the led on all Commercial projects and making sure everything on site including health & Safety standards are adhered too.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the full project from inception to handover.
  • Take responsibility and accountability for project planning and execution.
  • Make sure the project is on time and on budget, overseeing contractual variations and changes.
  • Knowledge of NZS 3910
  • Deal with all queries.
  • Knowledge of construction programming
  • The ability to drive and achieve deadlines
  • Deal with multiple subcontractors.
  • Report to the Directors on the status of the projects weekly/fortnightly.
  • Delegate tasks to other team members on the project.
  • Liaise and negotiate with various subcontractors and suppliers
  • Measure and order materials
  • Strong communication and people management skills
  • Good Problem-solving skills
  • A positive attitude.
  • Perform other related duties for the Projects as and when required.

Experience Required:

  • You need to have at least 5 years of NZ Commercial Construction (light commercial) experience.
  • Minimum of 10 years in Construction
  • Previous Site Manager and Project Management experience
  • Able to build rapport with staff and site contractors.
  • Pro-active and able to work well under pressure.

In return:

This is a newly created position and a fantastic opportunity to join a well-established organisation where you will enjoy an inclusive social culture, long-term, gainful employment, and an opportunity to grow with the company, working on exciting light commercial projects.

You will be remunerated on experience and will be a very valuable member of the business.

Please note that while we welcome candidates with overseas experience, for this position, it is essential to hold at least 5 years New Zealand experience within the NZ commercial construction market. You would also need to be a resident, citizen or have a valid work visa.

If this sounds like a role you are interested in, feel free to contact me Lee Jatho for a confidential chat or apply directly to this advert.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $95,000.00 – $140,000.00 per year

Experience:

  • Commercial Construction: 5 years (Required)

Work Eligibility:

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Preferred)

Job Duties:

  • Consult blueprints, designs, and client instructions to develop construction plans for the team
  • Manage construction sites, ensuring that workers adhere to construction plans and safety codes
  • Work with key stakeholders (e.g. owners, developers, contractors) to ensure project completion within budget and deadlines
  • Manage procurement, tendering and bidding processes
  • Liaise with local authorities to submit plans and arrange inspections
  • Other duties as requested

name: Senior Dynamics 365 CRM Consultant
description:
Some of NZ’s largest and diverse Dynamics CRM projects with an award winning, Enterprise IT Solutions organisation based in Auckland City outskirts.

Within this role, you will work with an existing team of D365 Developers and Consultants and will have the opportunity to be very customer facing while providing pre-sales solutions followed by end to end implementations and deployments of D365 CRM.

Along with a great base salary, you will gain additional Kiwisaver, flexibility in much of your working and super opportunities to evolve your knowledge and technical capability aligned to MS products.
The skills that will encourage success in your application include:

  • MS Dynamics CRM – at least 5yrs commercial experience to include operating as a Functional expert
  • Functions – completion of multiple end to end implementations of D365 CRM / CRM upgrades / Rebuilds of D365 CRM / Workshop Facilitation / CRM Solution Design & Build
  • CRM Modules – essentially require Sales Service & Marketing).
  • Customer Engagement (crucial) – being very much a Consultant in that you work very closely with the end customers and have experience in engaging with Senior Management teams and decision makers.
  • Other (not essential but worth knowing) – any experience with other Dynamics 365 suite such as ERP (AX, BC, NAV)

We are really keen to commence the interview process ASAP and can happily bring the selected individual aboard at short notice (we are aware that you likely have an existing 4 weeks notice period).

PLEASE NOTE: Due to NZ border restrictions, we are unable to sponsor Visa’s and as such, we will only accept applications from either individuals already in NZ or returning NZ Residents and Citizens.

name: Senior Security Cloud Consultant
description:
• Can be based in Auckland or Wellington
New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments. We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion. We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.
About the role
We're excited about the transformative journey we are on and the benefits we'll see in migrating our on-premise applications and data to the public cloud. As a Senior Security Cloud Consultant your key focus will be to secure our cloud environment by working with our delivery teams on the security design and development of solutions to meet business and client needs, ensuring the use of appropriate security tools and frameworks. You'll be an active and influential member of our high performing agile team and you'll provide thought leadership to contribute to the maturity of our DevSecOps functions. Getting involved with early design of applications, you'll use products like Checkpoint, Fortinet, RedShield, Amazon Detective, AWS IAM Access Analyser and Azure Security Centre to create robust solutions that keep our applications and data secure.
About you
Naturally you'll need demonstrated knowledge of the core principles of Enterprise Security techniques and technology, and the ability to work within Agile and DevSecOps environments. Our ideal candidate will be very technical, you will have started as a Developer (preferably within API and microservices) then moved into Engineering roles before following your interest toward security. You will need to bring your learnings and successes of previous cloud migrations from on-prem to cloud and you'll have proven experience with Identity and Access Management Solution, Auth0 or OKTA.
A willingness to pitch in and get in on the action to get the job done is a must, along with your flexible, agile, resilient mindset and the ability to focus on multiple business initiatives at the same time.
Interested?
Can you bring energy and thought leadership to our relentless pursuit for continuous improvement? If you answered yes and have the skills and experience we are looking for, we invite you to apply now. We are only accepting applications via www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter. For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz
Applications close 4 October 2020. We will be reviewing applications regularly and may close the advertising period early.
All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and may be required to undertake a drug test and credit check.

name: Dynamics 365 CE (CRM) Developer
description:
• Leading NZ CRM Consultancy Company
  • Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE/CRM Partner
  • Excellent Remuneration

About the Employer

Our Client is a leading CRM consultancy company and a Dynamics 365 CE/PowerApps partner specialising in the implementation of business solutions for a diverse range of Enterprise and SME clients through New Zealand.

About the Role:

Working with the latest generation of Microsoft development tools; our client is extending their team of CRM Developers. They are seeking an experienced Dynamics 365 CE/CRM Developer that will be responsible for successfully delivering Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE/CRM/PowerApps projects and fostering ongoing relationships within their customer base.

Benefits:
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Total focus is on Dynamics 365 CE/PowerApps
  • Opportunity to work with talented, amazing people, surrounded by the best in the industry
Duties:
  • Configuring, customising and developing solutions for Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE/CRM/PowerApps
  • Designing, and interacting with Functional Consultants/Business Analysts to develop outstanding Dynamics CRM-centric solutions
  • Interact with customers on small and large projects as a senior technical resource
  • Setting and maintaining coding and development standards with the team
  • Working with other team members to continually refine and improve best practice both developmentally and for the business.
Skills and Experience:
  • Proven experience and a deep understanding of designing and implementing solutions in C# and/or the Dynamics CRM/PowerApps platform
  • Development experience and expertise in .Net
  • Ability to communicate to a high standard with internal and external customers across multiple channels (verbal and written)
  • Experience in designing integrated systems in SSIS, Flow, Azure or using the Microsoft Dynamics product suite
  • Experience with integration solutions, such as Scribe or KingswaySoft and SSIS is favourable
  • Experience with PowerBI is favourable
  • Experience with Telephony systems integration is favourable
  • Experience with Marketing solutions is favourable
  • Create workflows and automate business processes
  • Write plugins utilizing C#
  • Customize and configuring Dynamics CRM systems
  • Perform integrations with third party tools
  • Create custom reports and dashboards in the Dynamics 365 CE/PowerApps systems
  • Experience of Azure, SharePoint and PowerApps
  • Strong experience with front end development (HTML 5, CCS 3, JavaScript, JQuery)
  • Any Microsoft Certifications and in particular Dynamics 365 CE/PowerApps exams are favourable
This position presents a great opportunity for career development as well as family and work life balance. With a competitive salary package this is an exciting opportunity for a motivated and driven IT professional.

Please forward your cover letter and resume in WORD format.

Please note only candidates that meet our client’s selection criteria will be contacted.

Job ID: JPDE06

name: Product Designer
description:
Optimal Workshop is in the business of doing things differently. We have created a UX platform of tools designed to help our customers craft better human experiences across the world. Locally, we look to craft better day to day experiences through how we work together, our work environment and our company culture. In our mind - the tried and true is something to be built upon and improved.
We are currently looking for a Product Designer to come and join us in creating the future. If a collaborative work environment, supportive and flexible work culture and a product offering that is trying to change the world sounds exciting to you - read on!

We would be really keen to have a chat if you have:
  • 2+ years of professional experience in a collaborative design or tech environment;
  • an ability to work collaboratively with developers on projects;
  • expert eyes for detail;
  • strong written and oral communication and presentation skills;
  • a strategic and curious mindset;
  • a love for all things UX;
  • an appreciation of A/B testing and talking to customers to inform design decisions;
  • a proactive approach to your work;
  • a desire to grow in your discipline by seeking constructive feedback and providing it in return; and front-end and design system experience.
On any given day you could be:
  • introducing and maintaining a UX/UI workflow;
  • building interface templates as part of a new design system;
  • turning visions, strategic requirements and insights into concepts;
  • working alongside our UX writer for UX and UI concepts;
  • prototypes testing with our customers;
  • creating guidelines for scope and acceptance criteria;
  • designing delightful and usable interfaces to align with the product vision
  • exporting assets for implementation;
  • ensuring implemented assets look great and function properly;
  • facilitate co-designs with key stakeholders; and
  • document all processes and work.
SaaS and accessibility experience preferred but not essential. Ultimately, we are looking for an amazing person first - not just a list of bullet points. In exchange for your skills and awesomeness, we will provide you with the tools you need, the work environment you crave, the best colleagues, professional development and a smorgasbord of office dogs to pat.

Our customers are global, our industry is exciting and our product is designed to create better human experiences all over the world. This role can be whatever you want to make of it - the potential is huge! Do not delay in getting in touch with a cover letter, C.V and Troy Hammond from Talent Army will be in touch.

name: Senior .Net Developer
description:
You’re a leader by your actions. You have strong technical opinions, based on previous experience, but you hold them loosely and you’re open to change.

This company's culture and vision are central to who they are, pragmatic, curious, and innovative. They give you the room to grow, have an opinion with a mix of autonomy and true collaboration. They celebrate the differences in the team, and resonate strongly with their core value.

An early-stage startup, they are building out a SaaS platform, and have proven that they have a product/market fit. They are well funded, have healthy revenue, and a good sales pipeline to drive growth.

The stack:
The front end is a React app built with TypeScript. We use Apollo to consume our internal API. The back end is a GraphQL API built with .NET core, with a Postgres database.

The whole thing is hosted in containers on AWS, managed with Terraform, deployed with BuildKite and monitored in DataDog.

The team are now looking for a new senior .NET engineer to join an expanding, high performing team. You will need to have relevant engineering experience and bring a diversity of ideas and confidence to demonstrate your ideas and value.

Applications must be received online https://recruitcrm.io/apply/13392928

Application Deadline: 30/09/2020

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $80,000.00 – $125,000.00 per year

Experience:

  • .NET: 4 years (Preferred)

Work Eligibility:

  • No work eligibility and require sponsorship to work (e.g. Work to Residence visa) (Preferred)

name: Product Manager – Job Description
description:
PikPok is looking for a passionate Product Manager to join our world beating
mobile game dev team!

We’re PikPok, New Zealand’s longest standing game developer, and we make great game experiences. We

want to create and entertain, while being successful and enjoying what we do, and we’re looking for people

who want that too. Over the years, we’ve built loads of games for all sorts of platforms, most recently titles

like Rival Stars Horse Racing on Android and iOS as well as A gent Intercept on Apple Arcade. Our teams are
small, and everyone involved can contribute to the decisions that shape the products.

PikPok is looking for a talented, motivated and passionate individual to take on the role of Product Manager

delivering globally successful games on digital platforms like mobile, PC, social or web. You’ll be responsible

for supporting the team as they develop, launch and drive ongoing updates of our games to expand PikPok’s

portfolio of innovative, original IP.

You love games!!! You’ll also have strong organisational & agile project management skills in the software

industry. You’re a great communicator & team player and can grasp new concepts quickly. You are

self-motivated and have confidence in dealing with complex and challenging situations. You care deeply about

our players and can help our teams to deliver beyond their expectations.

We welcome applications from diverse candidates and those with a range of backgrounds, skills, and

experiences.

Skills

  • 2+ years working in the mobile games industry in a leadership role
  • Strong working knowledge of established and trending free to play design strategies.
  • Extensive knowledge of the games market.
  • Direct agile development experience
  • Financial and analytical skills with expertise using common tools and documents (Budgets, P&L,

game/product design documents etc...)

  • Great organisational, motivational, negotiation and delegation skills with the ability to handle multiple
concurrent tasks, people, projects and responsibilities.
  • Strong customer focus and drive to deliver high quality games to end users

Responsibilities

  • Work with a product team consisting of game designers, programmers, artists and analysts to define,
understand and take ownership of driving the success of their title.
  • Act as the Product Owner to organize the product backlog and maximize the value that the team
produces each sprint through well crafted goals.
  • Define the roadmap to meet goals set by upper management, then communicate it to the
development teams and stakeholders.
  • Work with analytics to review and present findings from previous iterations of the products to
stakeholders.
  • Work with your Scrum Master and Leads to create an environment that supports high functioning
teams.

Contact

Please send your application along with a digital copy of your résumé/CV to: careers@pikpok.com. Additional
contact details can be found below and by visiting us online at www.pikpok.com

name: Oracle APEX Developer
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY
Our client is a large government organisation working to make sure New Zealand is a safe and just society.

ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for 2 Oracle APEX Developers to be part of a short contract to upgrade the Apex platform. The existing APEX applications need to be upgraded to the Oracle Apex Universal Theme. There are several applications that will not migrate over in their current form, so they will need upgrading. So in this role you will be following a universal theme template across applications and upgrading the applications so they can be uplifted and moved to a later version.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

  • Have an understanding or experience with Oracle APEX
  • Can work quickly and efficiently
  • Strong communication skills
  • Able to work unsupervised
  • Graduates/Entry level developers welcomed

HOW TO APPLY

Click the APPLY button and include your resume and cover letter or for further information please call Rachna Pillay on 0800 29 89 99.

NOTE to overseas enquiries and non-NZ residents:
Whereas we welcome international enquiries, only applicants that are legally entitled to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in New Zealand will be considered for advertised positions.

Others may not necessarily be responded to.

name: Oracle Apex Developer
description:
Our client in the government sector is seeking an Oracle Apex Developer for a 2 ½ month contract!

This organisation is planning to upgrade their apex platform. Prior to this, the existing APEX applications need to be upgraded to the oracle apex Universal Theme.

This will suit a person whom is looking for a short contract and has the following skills:

Oracle APEX knowledge and/or experience

Ability work quickly, efficiently and with minimal supervision to hit the ground running.

Can begin at short notice (early October)

If this sounds like you, and for more information - hit 'APPLY' now!

REF # 106382

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The Company

Seequent is a world leader in the development of geoscience software. We have employees in 17 locations across 6 continents and we are currently active in four key industries: Environment, Mining, Civil Engineering & Energy.

Our solutions enable people to create rich stories and uncover valuable insights from geological, geophysical and geotechnical data, and ultimately make better decisions about their subsurface challenges.

We’re geologists, geoscientists, software engineers, salespeople and communication specialists. We’re technical experts who are motivated by the challenges our customers face. We use the experience of our people to solve the highly complex problems of today, and work towards the bigger solutions of tomorrow.

We challenge ourselves, creating innovative solutions to dynamic problems, and we work hard to inspire positive change across the globe. We’re interested in changing the way people work, and we’re not scared of big ideas.

The Role

To support the rapid growth of our business, we are seeking a highly motivated Senior Software Engineer to join our Christchurch team. This is a fulltime permanent role based in Christchurch.

Working closely with other developers, Product Owners, DevOps engineers and Cloud Operations staff, you will be a key member of our development team building our world class products. If you are looking for a technical challenging role developing quality software, then Seequent is for you.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Solve technically challenging problems
  • Flex your debugging muscles
  • Experience working with a team of like-minded developers
  • Unleash your design flair
  • Champion the cause of great software

In order to be successful in this role, you will have:

  • An interest in science
  • Excellent collaboration skills
  • Brilliance, motivation, and pragmatism, to work in a highly technical environment
  • A high level of experience in modern coding practices and designs
  • Adaptability – we develop cloud, enterprise and Windows desktop applications using open-source tools; can you keep up

Technology we utilise:

  • Microsoft Azure, Docker, Kubernetes, Datadog, Sentry[JD1]
  • Ansible, Terraform, PowerShell
  • Python, TypeScript, ReactJS, Redux, Qt, C/C++[JD2]
  • SQLite, PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ
  • Windows (Windows Services, IIS), Linux

Tools we prefer:

  • PyCharm, Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio
  • Atlassian Suite (JIRA, Confluence, etc), Github
  • Azure DevOps, TeamCity

Techniques we believe in:

  • Lean/Agile
  • In-team domain experts
  • Continuous Improvement

Why you will enjoy working with us..

Seequent offers a flexible and supportive team environment, including medical insurance, relocation assistance, an on-site gym, flexible hours and a Christchurch office located right next to Hagley Park. We also provide ongoing learning and personal growth opportunities.

Inclusion + Diversity

In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience.
If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs. Please provide details in your cover letter of any accommodations needed.

How to apply

If this sounds like the role for you, apply today with a covering letter and CV.

name: Senior Product Designer
description:
About the role

We're growing and are looking to hire a Senior Product Designer to join our modern offices in Auckland CBD. The Senior Product Designer will take ideas and grow them into fully functional software, informed by a deep knowledge of customer problems and driven by a passion for making beautiful, easy to use and useful products. If you want to work on exciting projects and work alongside a passionate team of designers, developers and product managers in a fast-moving collaborative environment - apply online today!


About Cin7

Cin7 is a fast-growing SaaS company with a global customer base across 25 countries. We’re passionate about making great products available to everyone. Every month, millions of sales orders flow through our platform reducing costs, effort and time for our customers. This means they can quickly and effectively get their products to their customers, and build their brands, all without worrying about their operations.


We’re also passionate about reducing the cost, time and effort of selling products. We know that connecting channels, inventory and accounting dramatically reduces costs and opens up exciting new opportunities for product sellers. Cin7 Inventory Management & Supply Chain software helps businesses manage their stock, purchasing, shipping, and sales, all in one central system.


Our team is friendly, collaborative and inclusive. We focus on bringing our best every day in a fast-paced customer focused environment. Comprehensive health insurance, flexible working and customer volunteer days are just a few of the benefits we provide along with discounted gym membership, birthdays off, and fresh fruit every day. Learn more at https://www.cin7.com/company/careers/.


Responsibilities:

  • Work in collaboration with product and engineering teams to create valuable and delightful products through excellent UX and UI design.
  • Help product teams implement design thinking through the product development lifecycle.
  • Maintain consistency across the platform through design systems.
  • Undertake qualitative and quantitative user experience research.
  • Create workflow diagrams and user journey maps etc. to document findings.
  • Create low-fidelity wireframes to rapidly prototype product ideas.
  • Create high-fidelity mockups as front-end specification for engineers.

Requirements

We are looking for a Product Designer with a broad spectrum of skills, from user research through to high-fidelity wireframing.


You will be a strong design leader, willing to inspire and communicate the value of the design process to the rest of the team.


The ideal candidate will have:

  • 5+ years working as Product Designer, UX Designer or similar for a B2B SaaS software company
  • A strong portfolio of work that shows both the design process and a modern visual aesthetic
  • Knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods and tools (canvases, personas etc), and the ability to engage with customers in person or remotely to gain insight and feedback.
  • Business acumen, with a strong interest in creating products that are valuable to both customers and the business.
  • An excellent communicator, able to articulate ideas and decisions to a variety of stakeholders, and provide constructive critiques.
  • A strong understanding of design across mobile, tablet and desktop.
  • Mastery of design and prototyping tools such as Figma or Sketch and Invision.
  • An understanding of the development process, its limitations and possibilities.
  • Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture.
  • Problem-solving aptitude.
  • Degree in Design, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent relevant experience.
  • Seeks to continually improve in everything they do via development opportunities and sharing of knowledge.
  • Independently able to complete tasks assigned and ask for suggestions when roadblocks occur.

Bonus Points:

  • Knowledge of inventory control, retail systems or other business functions
  • Experience with building design systems and styleguides, using tools like Storybook.
  • Knowledge of or interest in frontend development

Please submit or link to a portfolio of work on application.


Must currently living be in New Zealand and have the right to work in New Zealand.

name: UX/UI Designer - Wellington or Christchurch based opportunit...
description:
Kaihoahoa UX/UI [Wheako kaiwhakamahi/Atanga kaiwhakamahi]
About Us | Mō mātou
At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.

The role | Mō te tūnga

As part of the Customer Experience unit, the UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing UX/UI skills to ensure we understand the customer during the process of product development (e.g. website, data tools). You will be working with Senior UX/UI designers, content designers and a product owner who have a strong focus on making things easier for our customers.
The UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing a solid understanding of the customer through research and testing products. With an increasing demand from our customers to improve the way we deliver our products, the UX/UI Designer will provide key evidence to support decision-making during the product development process. The UX/UI designer will help build relationships across the organisation.
This is a very exciting time to be joining our team and be part of wider changes within the organisation. No two days will be the same in this influential and critical role in better understanding customer needs.
Focusing on development projects and shaping methods that will ensure a better customer experience, the UX/UI Designer will:
  • work closely with Customer Experience teams to support a range of initiatives
  • provide expertise on projects that will improve our products for our customers
  • assist with customer testing and research that will be the source of truth for best practice across the organisation
  • be the voice of external customers and work alongside others within the organisation to create success in what we deliver * engage with customers to understand their needs and requirements

name: Real Estate Sales
description:
RE/Max Partners are currently looking for new and existing Real Estate Salespeople for their South Auckland based Real Estate Company. First launched in 2016, RE/MAX Partners, Flat Bush has quickly grown into a high performing real estate office in the Auckland region. Consistently recognised as one of the top RE/MAX real estate enterprises in New Zealand, the award-winning office is highly experienced in suburban Auckland and beyond. Flat Bush real estate professionals combine their local knowledge and experience with the global reach of RE/MAX branding to produce highly successful results for clients in Flat Bush and beyond.Fast becoming the “go to” Real Estate Company in Auckland, Vendors are increasingly using the services of RE/MAX Partners when they’re looking for RESULTS.

With your great personal promotion and their compelling competitive edge, it’s a great recipe for successWorking for a large Real Estate Company with a Worldwide reach, you will be given all the “tools of the trade”, training and support required to be successful. With distinctive branding, tested systems and powerful resources creating an edge, you will also benefit from the massive networking advantages of truly global brand. In addition to above, you will benefit from existing relationships with established and recognised property developers within Auckland. With these strong relationships in mind, we are also interested in talking to Salespeople with experience in Project Marketing to service a number of projects coming to the market in the very near future.

On offer is generous commissions with no restrictions or boundaries as to where you can list or sell. If you are experienced or looking to take the first steps towards a career in Real Estate, then we are interested in talking to you. If you do not have your current Salesperson Licence (or completed the required training) please make contact and we will advise you of the steps required to gain it. This role is being managed by REAP Recruitment on behalf of RE/MAX Partners.

Please apply on-line below to be considered for this role. All applications will remain confidential to REAP Recruitment and RE/MAX Partners and will only be forwarded on with your consent. More information is available on request.REAP Recruitment specialise in recruitment for the Real Estate and Property (REAP) industries. We are your independent choice whether you're wanting to see if the "grass is greener" or looking for a new role in Real Estate.

If you're thinking about your career in Real Estate, then make REAP Recruitment your first call.

name: Senior Civil Engineer (Water) - Auckland
description:
17740BR

Requisition Number:

17740BR

Description:

Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind .

We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.

About the role

  • We are looking for a driven individual to step into the exciting and challenging role of Senior Waters Engineer in our Auckland (Newmarket) office.
  • You will be part of a dynamic team working closely with our clients throughout the wider Auckland region to deliver projects whilst enjoying the Auckland office culture which has a vibrant social club, exciting projects and great development opportunities.
  • This is an exciting opportunity for a professional engineer with a proven track record of successfully delivering projects to work collaboratively with our clients and colleagues across Asia Pacific. You will have a chance to work on projects from the initial investigation and detailed design right through to completion of construction.
  • You will work with a diverse client set from local government through to private developers.
  • You will join an Auckland team that works on infrastructure projects, not only locally, but across New Zealand and the wider Asia Pacific region.

Title:

Senior Civil Engineer (Water) - Auckland

Qualifications:

What you need to bring

  • Our preferred candidate for this role will have proven technical experience in general Civil Water engineering projects encompassing Waters infrastructure. (You will have the technical support of our extensive design resources based in New Zealand and the wider Asia Pacific area).
  • You will be experienced dealing with a range of clients and stakeholders including local authorities, government bodies and commercial companies.
  • In this exciting position, your own self-management skills will be as important as your technical and project management ones. You will need to be able to prioritise workloads whilst maintaining strong and trusting working relationships with our clients' and colleague's both locally and across the broader Stantec team.
  • You will be able to work with remote teams to deliver projects to local clients.
  • Key requirements are a BE Civil Engineering or equivalent, plus a minimum of 10 years professional experience in the consulting or engineering industry.
  • CPEng or equivalent is preferable.

Job Category:

Civil Engineering

Preferred Specifications:

What we offer

Along with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.

  • Flexible Working Arrangements including purchasing up to 4 weeks additional leave and provision for school term contracts
  • Learning and Talent Development Programs including global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learning
  • Mentoring for your own development
  • Professional Memberships
  • Health Insurance – Income Continuance Insurance (ICI) – Life Insurance
  • Service Recognition Awards
  • Employee Assistance Program

How to apply

Applications close on Friday 16 October 2020.

Please apply directly online.

No Agency CVs will be accepted.

About Stantec:

The Stantec community unites approximately 22,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring water, transport and infrastructure projects to life. Our work from initial project concept and planning through design, construction and commissioning is built on a nearly 200-year history. So, when we take on a project, we see the opportunity to make a lasting connection with the people and places where we live and work.

name: Senior Analyst Developer - Fixed Term
description:
About Us | Mō mātou
At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.

Due to parental leave we have the opportunity for a Senior Analyst Developer to join the Digital Business Solutions team for a 12 month term.

As the Senior Analyst Developer, you will have a passion for craftsmanship and thrive on being in an environment where you can learn and adapt, trying out new technologies and collaborating with others to continually improve our DevOps journey within the organisation.
You will enjoy working in a small team using agile practices and be active in contributing to software design and software practices. You will be innovative and be able to challenge status quo to ensure continual improvement occurs. You will also be involved in:

  • Building and supporting our core API, user interfaces, and backend processing systems. * Integrate our systems with Vendor provided software.

  • Proactive reporting of progress on work assignments (including delays) to appropriate managers
  • Web development using React, ES6 and Typescript * Scripting languages such as PowerShell and Python * Source Code Management tool such at Git and TFS * Test Driven Development and Behaviour Driven Development

Within your application please provide your skills and experience with the following:

  • Agile and SCRUM * Experience working with data lake environment, such as Cloudera or Databricks
  • Knowledge of different database systems, such as RDBS, NoSql
  • Ability to work in Linux and windows operation systems
  • Experience in coding, testing and development of backend systems
  • Knowledge of functional and object-oriented programming
  • Knowledge/familiarity with the DevOps model, in-house standards, and best practice
  • A proven ability to establish collaborative relationships within team and with business
  • Proactive reporting of progress on work assignments (including delays) to appropriate managers
Some experience or skills in the following would be desirable:
  • Web development using React, ES6 and Typescript * Scripting languages such as PowerShell and Python * Source Code Management tool such at Git and TFS * Test Driven Development and Behaviour Driven Development
, What s in it for you? | Ngā hua ka riro ki a koe
You ll be joining an inclusive environment where people, regardless of gender, race, disability, religion or background are supported to be able to do their best work. This includes:

  • Opportunity to develop and grow your career

name: Manawatu/Wanganui Branch & BD Manager
description:
We have a great opportunity for an experienced hands on client relationship developer to lead and grow our Palmerston North and Wanganui branches.

Our regional branches represent a key part of AWF's strategy to maintain its position as NZ's leading provider of labour hire and permanent placement services to key provincial centres throughout the country

This Palmerston North based position revolves around growing business in a competitive environment through development and execution of a sound sales plan, delivering first class service to clients and candidates alike, leading and driving a team and operating within the risk management parameters of the company as a whole.

Ideally we'd like you to have a good understanding of the local economy, the people and the down to earth patriotic nature we have in this part of the world. And some sound exposure to multiple business sectors including manufacturing, logistics, roading/infrastructure and engineering.

The focus is on sales and people - both our clients and candidates and your team

You will:

Lead by example, supporting and motivating your small team

Seek out, win and maximise sales within existing customers, but also through growth of our client base

Exceed financial targets

Promote company driven key initiatives with a local flavour

Ensure Health & Safety compliance is maintained - to both company and client standards

In this role you will be a critical part of driving the success of the Palmerston North and Wanganui branches. We require a self-motivator with focus and drive, who can juggle conflicting priorities, work smart to meet the demand, keep cool under pressure and provide solutions. We are people finding people for people, and everything that can go wrong sometimes does. You'll therefore need to be someone with resilience and a 'never say die' approach, providing exceptional service to both clients and candidates whilst also working within financial guidelines.

Experience running a successful small B2B business or a branch of a national entity will be highly regarded.

Interested in learning more? Please click on the apply now button. Or if you're really serious, pick up the phone and give Fleur Board, General Manager, a call on 0275 773068.

name: Salesforce Pardot Developer
description:
Job Title: Salesforce Pardot Developer
Contract: 3 Months
Location: Auckland

  • Proficient in Salesforce.com configuration, administration, customisation including experience in Data Loader Tools. Should have knowledge of CRM.
  • Must have Lightning Salesforce developer skills and hands-on marketing automation experience using Pardot.

Salesforce Developer Duties and Responsibilities

  • Testing and Implementing Applications
  • Salesforce developers lead the testing and implementation of software development efforts, including coding, configuration, maintenance, installation, testing, and debugging, as well as managing timelines and producing technical documentation.

Creating Customer Workflows

  • Working closely with the business teams, Salesforce developers perform reviews of the data, developing complex CRM solutions to ensure that best practices are followed, and the best data solutions are provided.
  • This may involve discussing trade-offs with other teams, such as the terms of the configuration versus the code in place, or mapping the functional requirements to Salesforce functionality.

Maintaining User Roles and Security

  • Salesforce developers maintain user roles, ensuring there are no security breaches that could place a risk on the company’s data.

Providing Technical Plans to Business Teams

  • Salesforce developers create technical plans and strategies for other departments and the IT team, developing solutions to address any company-wide issues and making their processes more efficient.

Salesforce Developer Skills and Qualifications

  • Salesforce developers have extensive computer and programming knowledge. Typically, employers require a bachelor’s degree in a computer-related discipline, as well as the following abilities:
  • Analytical skills – Salesforce developers need an analytical mindset to identify a user’s needs and to design and produce solutions to issues
  • Communication skills – to communicate complex information effectively to people who don’t have computer knowledge and to answer questions as they arise, giving clear instructions
  • Teamwork – although they are self-motivated and tend to work independently, Salesforce developers also work in teams, maintaining a professional and helpful demeanor toward their colleagues
  • Time management – Salesforce developers work to business timelines and schedules, often working on multiple projects while ensuring the work produced meets best practices
  • Problem-solving abilities – Salesforce developers identify and troubleshoot issues and faults as they arise

Tools of the Trade

  • Salesforce developers use the following tools on a regular basis:
  • Programming languages (JavaScript, HTML5, CSS)
  • Development technologies (APEX, Visualforce, migration tools, SOQL, web services, Lightning Components, Lightning Web Components)
  • Web development tools (Eclipse/IntelliJ/Visual Studio Code or similar, Git, Sublime)

Contract length: 3 months

Expected start date: 05/10/2020

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Experience:

  • Salesforce: 1 year (Required)

Work Eligibility:

  • Permitted to work permanently with no restriction on hours (e.g. citizen, permanent resident) (Required)
