name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in the US thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, collaborative, innovative, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Why Software Engineering at Vacasa

Do you want to be part of an NZ team helping the largest vacation property management company in the US solve problems on a global scale? Are you excited to explore the benefits of scalability and performance by leveraging modern, cloud-based technologies? At Vacasa, we are constantly experimenting and fine-tuning our products. We value stability, security, and scalability.

What we are looking for

Vacasa is looking for passionate Senior Software Engineers for our fast-growing engineering organization. At Vacasa, we value team independence and ownership, rapid delivery and continuous improvement.

In this role, you would be part of a cross-functional team building scalable, cloud-native solutions to high-impact business problems. You'll be working with Node.js for back-end services and with React for front-end applications.

What you'll do with your team

As a Senior Software Engineer, you'll be a key member of your team, solving mission-critical problems and being a hands-on contributor to our ever-evolving systems. We believe to shine in this role, you're good at:

  • Designing, architecting, and building software; applying current technology thinking and patterns to our business problems
  • Guiding developers via code reviews, discussion and modeling of code that is easy to evolve and read
  • Continuously learning new technologies and validating concepts in order to pick the right tool for the job
  • Utilizing DevOps tools and practices for building, deploying, and maintaining software in production environments
  • Participating and building a collaborative, productive culture around product-focused goals
  • Building towards high quality standards and working with your team to create robust testing approaches

Skills you'll need

  • 5+ years of professional experience using two or more languages and working with multiple back-end data storage technologies
  • Ability to write high-quality, well-tested code that places maintainability over cleverness; know when and what to optimize for in a given situation
  • Adept at guiding technical direction within a cross-functional engineering team
  • Experience in cloud platforms with Infrastructure as Code
  • Experience and enthusiasm to mentor junior engineers

Nice to have

  • Completed a B.S./M.S. in Computer Science (or equivalent work experience)
  • Experience with React, Node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript
  • AWS Serverless tech
  • Mobile app development experience
  • Experience in hospitality or travel industry

Working with us has its benefits

  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Flexible work environment
  • A fancy new Macbook Pro
  • Great colleagues and culture

name: Senior Commercial Advisor - Commercial Viability
description:
About us | Mō mātou
The new Ministry of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) is the Government's lead advisor on housing and urban development and will deliver the Government's programme to address homelessness, increase public and private housing supply, make existing homes warmer and healthier, make housing affordable for people to rent and buy, and lead quality urban development strategies to create thriving communities.
The Housing Supply, Response and Partnerships group leads work to address New Zealanders' housing needs both now and in the future. The group includes both policy and delivery-focused functions, providing advice to the Government on preventing and reducing homelessness, and funding the delivery of public housing, transitional housing, and housing related support services to tackle homelessness in New Zealand. The group works closely with other parts of HUD, and with HUD's partners, including Kāinga Ora – Homes and Communities, community and transitional housing providers, developers, social services, councils and other agencies.
About the role | Mō te tūnga
We are looking for a Senior Commercial Advisor will contribute to the provision of an effective delivery function for Public Housing Supply, while recognising other associated specialist services. By using robust and effective partnering principles and commercial models and reinforcing the shift we are making to have a strong value for money ethos. The role will be responsible for working closely with the Business Development Managers and external partners to support the delivery of new public housing supply.
About you | Mōu
You will have a strong commercial background with specialist experience working on residential property developments and initiatives. You will have significant experience in managing a broad range of stakeholder relationships in a fast paced, complex environment.
You will have experience providing commercial and financial advice to public and private sector clients in New Zealand, particularly in connection with social infrastructure projects (housing, education, correctional services), which includes commercial structuring and options appraisals, financial modelling and financial due diligence. We are looking for a professional who has experience in strategy development, financial options analysis and enterprise valuation.

Your experience will include:
  • Must have a strong background in residential property development and/or project management specific to construction/property development
  • Experience negotiating agreements relating to funding and/or leasing multi-unit property developments
  • Previous experience in data management – preferably financial monitoring experience
  • Demonstrated experience and knowledge in sourcing strategies within a large organisations
  • Proven ability in critical thinking, analysis and the development of business processes, operating manuals or policies
  • Preferably an understanding of relevant legislation, government and local government policies and processes relating to procurement and the public sector
  • Comfortable working within a fast moving and at times ambiguous, environment
  • Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, including development/construction plans
  • Understanding, experience or qualifications in urban design principles and building/resource consent processes
  • Understanding and experience of the stages involved in construction and land development
  • Understanding and experience of different building technologies and innovations (components and materials, modular or prefabrication design, building resilience).
How to Apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono
This is an exciting time to join our Ministry with a people focused mandate, and where you will be part of a team making a positive difference in the community.
Please click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to the application page. From here you can upload your CV and cover letter. For tracking and evaluation purposes, all applications must be submitted via our on-line process.
For any confidential enquires please feel free to contact Jo Attewell at jo.attewell@hud.govt.nz.
Applications close Wednesday 30th September 2020.
Please be advised that due to the Covid-19 virus some interviews may be held via Microsoft TeamMeet. HUD is keeping close watch on advice from the Ministry of Health, keeping our staff and candidate's safe is our top priority. Please do not hesitate to get in touch with our Talent Acquisition contact if you have any questions.
Please note, you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand to be eligible for this position.

description:
About the role

We have a lot happening at Invenco, and continue to grow in North America, APAC & Europe. Our Software team are building new applications to support our customer - and it is a great time to join as a developer.


We are currently on the look out for a Node.JS Developer - this role will be responsible to design, build and maintain software solutions with a commitment to delivering quality solutions on time that meet or exceed the needs of our internal and external customers. The Node.JS Developer will be actively involved in:

  • Software development
  • Software documentation
  • Software testing
  • Team mentoring

Skills & Experience
We are looking for a Node.JS Developer who is experienced in working on RESTful APIs in a service architecture, and experienced working in a cloud (ideally AWS) environment. The ideal candidate must understand Promises and Generators in addition to the traditional callback methodology. Experience using the Restify (as opposed to Express) package to facilitate the REST interfaces would be a must have. In addition to this, the right candidate will have:

  • Tertiary qualification in Computer Science or Information Technology, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Advanced knowledge and experience in the following: JavaScript, - Node.js using Restify, - RESTful APIs, - PostgreSQL and Asynchronous programming techniques, Code versioning and revision systems such as GitHub
  • Writing secure code that complies with appropriate standards and regulations
  • Knowledge around PostreSQL for data, or other relational databases
  • Experience working within a Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment environment.
  • AWS, Azure or similar cloud technology experience
  • Code versioning and revision systems such as GitHub
  • If you have some Angular/React experience that will help our website guys, however this is not a primary focus

Please Note:
As part of our recruitment process, a technical online test must be completed.

We will be considering applicants based locally due to the nature and urgency of this hiring. Citizenship, PR, Work visa or a Working Holiday Visa is required to apply.


About Invenco
Invenco uniquely builds highly complex end-to-end payment solutions from hardware through the firmware and middleware stack plus cloud – all under one roof. In revolutionising the global customer payment experience it’s one of New Zealand’s most awarded tech-companies – including being named 2018 NZ Hi-Tech company of the year. We continue to attract world-class talent as Invenco faces exponential growth in APAC, EMEA, the US and Canada. There has never been a better time to join us as we expand our global development and applications team.

Benefits
We’re based on Auckland’s North Shore just minutes from the Northern Motorway.
Our benefits include working with a great team, performance-based pay, training and development opportunities, challenging work, flexible work hours, paid birthday leave, discounted medical insurance, onsite gym and access to EAP services. We have a lot happening at Invenco and it's an exciting time to join as we expand globally.
www.invenco.com

name: Project Manager
description:
A great opportunity for a Civil Project Manager to focus purely on their land development work.

A great opportunity for a Civil Project Manager to focus purely on their land development work.

This acclaimed developer set the standard for residential. With several large developments commencing and Auckland’s housing market continuing to flourish, they’re now in growth mode.

This expansion has created a new opportunity for a Civil & Infrastructure Project Manager to focus purely on the land development phase of their projects.

Detail orientated, you’ll have a strong knowledge of all aspects of land development (for residential subdivisions) from resource consent through the design and construction phases to achievement of 224c.

Reporting to the Development Manager, you’ll be tasked with managing the consultants and contractors to ensure the civil and infrastructure works are successfully handed over to the Residential Project Managers in line with the subdivision’s master programme and budget.

Ideally you’ll be a tertiary qualified Land Surveyor or Civil Engineer who has progressed into Project/ Development Management for a reputable civil contractor, consultancy or developer. To be successful you must have subdivision experience and be intimately familiar with Auckland council regulations for this style of work.

Proficiency in MS Project, budgeting and strong interpersonal skills are key requirements for this rare opportunity.

This role offers variety and growth within a hardworking, professional team; for more information or to apply please contact Tom Askham at Thomas.askham@hays.net.nz #2421833

name: QA Tester
description:
Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The QA Tester is responsible for the functional quality of a developed application. It is their job to identify all application defects prior to release to the client. This requires a true commitment to quality and an attitude of ownership of the Test stage.
What you’ll bring
  • An ability to work closely with multiple stakeholders including Product Manager and Bas
  • Efficiency and high quality outputs with low number of escaped defects
  • Quick and clear understanding of new development, identifying key areas of risk for testing
  • Ability to troubleshoot issues to understand whether they are config, data, or code related
Responsibilities
  • Provide input into the feature design stage, estimation and sprint planning
  • Actively monitor quality of functional testing, providing feedback to developers/dev lead/product manager throughout the development of product features
  • Work with the Business Analyst and/or Client to resolve gaps or ambiguities in the functional design
  • Ensure the Product manager is kept up to date, making them especially aware of any issues causing test delays
  • Develop & execute test plans against developed features and components. Identify and report defects, work with team to resolve
  • Configure, use and manage test data and environments in strict accordance with all internal and customer security standards
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

name: Senior Manager, Data Architect & Technical Manager
description:
The Covid-19 pandemic is creating seismic challenges around the world. Our purpose, to build a better working world, has never been more important. Life at EY has been transformed dramatically but our strong culture of flexible and remote working has helped EY people navigate new ways of working and remain connected with each other and our clients.

A better working world truly starts with the people at EY who are building it every day. Now more than ever we need talented people from diverse backgrounds to help our clients navigate the complexities of this Transformative Age: people with the passion, curiosity and drive to make things better.

The opportunity

We are seeking capable ambitious people to join our Data and Analytics practice to help us fulfil our EY purpose of Building a Better Working World.

EY’s DnA team has demonstrated success in delivering innovative solutions to clients across New Zealand and globally. Our growth in New Zealand is strong and we are continuing our work to build out team in Auckland a team that is bringing the very best of our data and analytics capabilities and offerings to the clients we serve in New Zealand.

Working in Auckland with our high-profile clients across both the public and private sectors, as a Senior Manager – Big Data Architect and Technical Delivery Lead, you’ll will work as part of a broader DnA, Advisory and EY teams develop your skills and to contribute to meaningful change for New Zealand and New Zealanders. We seek hard working, experienced and technically capable data professionals who are team players and who have ambition for themselves and the teams and clients they work with.
We are seeking people with experience of large and complex big data architecture, migrations and a good handle on core analytics and emerging technologies for this domain. Successful candidates will be client and service centric, will be experienced problem solvers and team leaders and ideally will have experience succeeding when facing significant delivery challenges or issues in the past.

We’re play and win as a team and love sharing knowledge and learning from each other every day. We have a strong focus on training including technical workshops, off site vendor training, lunch time knowledge sharing sessions and mentoring opportunities.

Your key responsibilities:
  • Big data platform architect and developer with expertise and experience using Azure Data Lake Store, Data Factory, Data Bricks and DevOps
  • Lead architecture and solutioning efforts to define and develop big data components
  • Analyse data growth and lead capacity/sizing activities to arrive at the most appropriate commercial and technical solution
  • Provide day to day technical leadership, management and mentorship to the junior members of the delivery team
  • Manage day to day interactions with client stakeholders as required to support the effective and efficient delivery of the project/initiative.
  • Assist with the planning, budgeting, and mobilisation of projects.
  • Translate complex technical concepts into simple communications which the business can understand.
  • Work collaboratively with other teams like data science and information architecture to create best fit solution for the clients
  • Previous experience working on large data engineering and migration programmes.
  • Previous experience working with data, data environments, databases, large data sets possibly in a consulting environment
  • Participate and lead the proposal development including the pricing strategy in line with the business’ processes
  • Strong problem solver, someone comfortable to challenge the status quo
  • Exceptional communication, documentation and presentation skills
  • Demonstrated resilience and adaptability
Ideally, you'll also have:
  • Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
  • Experienced in developing solutions focused on Big Data and Advanced analytics across diverse domains
We have a robust career framework within EY and this role will be the start point for many potential paths through a long and valuable career for the successful candidate.
What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your performance. In addition, our comprehensive Total Rewards package can be tailored to your individual needs, to give you the freedom to manage your role in a way that’s right for you. This includes;
  • a variety of flexible working and leave arrangements
  • personalised career development including coaching and support to help you build your career and access to formal learning so you can develop the skills you’ll need to thrive in the future
  • a range of tools and benefits to guide and support your health and wellbeing throughout your entire EY career.
About EY
At EY, we hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected, practices are equitable, and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. Through our inclusive leadership behaviours, a variety of internal networks, flexible working and mentoring programs, you will have the support and flexibility to build an exceptional career.

EY is committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process for people with disability. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 1).

We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process will be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people, clients, guests and the broader public.

The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

Apply now.

#LI-EYNewZealand #LI-ANALYTICS

The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider.

© 2019 Ernst & Young, New Zealand. All Rights Reserved.

name: Senior Designer / Art Director
description:
Hey there! We want to talk to you about the Senior Designer role at Resn Wellington. We think you’ll be perfect. After all, you’re a creative problem solver. You’re able to express your vision with clarity and enthusiasm. You recognise and champion great ideas from your talented colleagues. Everyone who knows you admires your initiative, talent, and leadership. Your years of experience in digital production has given you a deep understanding of the interactive process, and how it can move somebody to tears. You’re ready for this.


As a Senior Designer at Resn, you’ll make valuable contributions to the creative design direction on key projects. You’ll be responsible for the research and design of user-centric, interactive experiences. You’ll work hand in glove with developers, making a deep understanding of the development process invaluable.


You’ll interact with clients, present work and sell Resn’s vision. And, of course, you will constantly push yourself to innovate, to extend the boundaries of digital design, ensuring every project you lay hands on is unique, fresh and of the highest quality.


Skills and Experience


  • 5+ years experience designing / Art directing high end interactive projects.
  • User experience design.
  • Experience leading and / or working with a team
  • Oozes communication abilities, both internal team and external client communication. Strong English skills essential (both written and spoken).
  • Strong planning and time management, including consideration for motion and interaction (animations and transitions).
  • An eye and passion for design detail.


About Resn


Welcome to Resn Wellington. Here you’ll find one of the finest teams of creative digital thinkers and makers, anywhere in the world. In our state-of-the-art workshop, we hand tool the highest quality interactive content for the most discerning clientele. Our master craftspeople are hard at work creating the future, but we’re always on the lookout for the sharpest and most creative minds to join the team. If you think you have what it takes to become part of Resn Wellington, apply today.


Check us out


www.resn.co.nz

name: Senior Security Cloud Consultant
description:
• Can be based in Auckland or Wellington
New Zealand Post, and there's more to us than meets the eye, is part of New Zealand's key infrastructure, around since 1840, we provide physical and electronic networks that allow New Zealanders to send and receive messages, goods and payments. We have multiple revenue earning businesses and an annual turnover of over $1 billion. We are proud of the great future we're creating, making sure we bring the best to our customers and communities and deliver what New Zealanders care about.
About the role
We're excited about the transformative journey we are on and the benefits we'll see in migrating our on-premise applications and data to the public cloud. As a Senior Security Cloud Consultant your key focus will be to secure our cloud environment by working with our delivery teams on the security design and development of solutions to meet business and client needs, ensuring the use of appropriate security tools and frameworks. You'll be an active and influential member of our high performing agile team and you'll provide thought leadership to contribute to the maturity of our DevSecOps functions. Getting involved with early design of applications, you'll use products like Checkpoint, Fortinet, RedShield, Amazon Detective, AWS IAM Access Analyser and Azure Security Centre to create robust solutions that keep our applications and data secure.
About you
Naturally you'll need demonstrated knowledge of the core principles of Enterprise Security techniques and technology, and the ability to work within Agile and DevSecOps environments. Our ideal candidate will be very technical, you will have started as a Developer (preferably within API and microservices) then moved into Engineering roles before following your interest toward security. You will need to bring your learnings and successes of previous cloud migrations from on-prem to cloud and you'll have proven experience with Identity and Access Management Solution, Auth0 or OKTA.
A willingness to pitch in and get in on the action to get the job done is a must, along with your flexible, agile, resilient mindset and the ability to focus on multiple business initiatives at the same time.
Interested?
Can you bring energy and thought leadership to our relentless pursuit for continuous improvement? If you answered yes and have the skills and experience we are looking for, we invite you to apply now. We are only accepting applications via www.jobs.nzpost.co.nz where you will find a JD and can upload your CV and covering letter. For further information contact Nikki Tuhou by email to Nikki.tuhou2@nzpost.co.nz
Applications close 4 October 2020. We will be reviewing applications regularly and may close the advertising period early.
All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security check and may be required to undertake a drug test and credit check.

name: General Manager Operations
description:
General Manager Operations - Moffat

Reference Number: 7060aa

Location: Christchurch

  • Christchurch Based
  • Market Leading Global Group
  • Wide Ranging Senior Leadership Role

THE COMPANY:

The Moffat Group based in Australia is part of the leading global business the Ali Group. The Moffat Group are the Southern Hemisphere’s largest developer, manufacturer and marketer of a comprehensive range of commercial cooking, baking and meal distribution products for the hospitality and food service market worldwide. Moffat Limited (based in NZ) is the market leader in New Zealand, and with an impressive state of the art head office and manufacturing facility in Christchurch (Rolleston), Moffat market their products under their speciality brands, which include Blue Seal, Cobra, Turbofan, Fast Fri and Waldorf amongst others.

THE ROLE:

With the impending retirement of the long-serving incumbent, Moffat seek a new General Manager Operations to lead the Manufacturing, Research & Development, Quality Assurance, Supply Chain and Inventory, Procurement functions. Reporting to the Group Managing Director, this role will provide dedicated and motivational leadership to 5 direct reports and a wider team of approx. 120. The primary focus of this role is to provide strong leadership and direction for all operational activities. With quality control and meeting customer expectations a cornerstone of the role, you will develop and implement a strategic operational plan which also ensures the plant, facilities, equipment and personnel are effectively utilised to maximise efficiencies. The General Manager Operations will also work closely with managers across the business and assist the Group MD with all projects in order to optimise manufacturing and overall business performance.

THE PERSON:

Applicants will possess substantial experience in managing operations at a strategic level, ideally gained within a manufacturing environment, with an engineering related qualification also being highly desirable. Candidates for this role must have strong critical thinking skills coupled with exceptional leadership and people management capabilities. Success in this role will hinge on the ability to establish credibility and take complete ownership of all operational activities and assisting the management team to build on an already successful business.

Based at Moffat’s Rolleston office, this is a great leadership opportunity to work in a supportive and experienced, market-leading global organisation, further developing a committed team and interacting with every part of the business, managing and improving operations as you go.

To apply in strict confidence now, please complete the ‘apply for this job’ application form, attaching your cover letter and CV. Applications close on 18 October 2020. Emails will be electronically acknowledged and further correspondence may be by email.

To view the Candidate Briefing Information please click here.

For more information please phone Mike Stenhouse on +64 274 428 348.

To apply use application form or email cvchc@sheffield.co.nz

name: Junior - Intermediate Java Software Engineer
description:
• Opportunity for a junior - intermediate Java Software Engineer
  • Exceptional work environment, boasting collaboration and innovation
  • Enterprise web/open source technology focus


  • Opportunity for a junior - intermediate Java Software Engineer
  • Exceptional work environment, boasting collaboration and innovation
  • Enterprise web/open source technology focus
What’s in it for me?
With a proud history in the Christchurch market, our client attracts and keeps the very best Software & Test Engineers. Encouraging growth, development, and above all constant questioning and improvement of how and what they develop, you'll be playing a very key role in how their core technologies should evolve.

Working locally as part of a larger international company, our client are looking to expand their team with a junior to intermediate level Java Software Engineer. While working locally, you will form part of a larger international engineering team.

What would I be doing?
As a Junior or Intermediate Java Developer you will be developing using enterprise Java technologies (web) alongside a suite of Open Source technologies to deliver a large and complex web solution teamed with complex analytics. We are seeking an enthusiastic, technically minded Java Developer whose real passion is to get under the hood, and work out how and why things work in the world of web, and how they could be improved.

You will need to be very comfortable working with open source technologies and enjoy getting elbows deep with web technologies, front and backend. You will also be excited by the opportunity for team collaboration and personal development that peer programming brings.

What do I need?
To be successful in this role you will need:
  • At least 1 to 2 years of software development experience in an innovative Java Development setting, ideally with a strong web/open source focus
  • Skills in Java, JavaScript and Python
  • An interest in testing
  • Experience in AWS and SQL would be a bonus
With a proud history in the Christchurch market, our client attracts and keeps the very best Software & Test Engineers. Encouraging growth, development, and above all constant questioning and improvement of how and what they develop, you'll be playing a very key role in how their core technologies should evolve.


What do I do now?
  • Apply using the Apply button on this page
Who are we?
Sourced is a specialist IT Recruitment Agency primarily focused on permanent & contract positions within the Christchurch IT market.

Jobseekers come back to us time after time as we look out for them and provide sound, unbiased guidance throughout their careers. Our clients keep coming back because we do what we say we’ll do, working to genuinely understand their business, their culture and their unique dynamic. Keep up to date with all that is happening in your local IT and Technology market by registering with us now at www.sourced.nz

Overseas and New Zealand bound?
We work with candidates from all over the globe, every day. If you have made your decision to move to New Zealand and your plans are firmly underway, please get in touch by registering with us. We have clients who are sourcing specialised IT disciplines and are ready and willing to talk to you.

name: Change Manager
description:
Become part of an exciting project where you will play a vital role of delivering change across New Zealand


Your new company
A leading agency is looking for a Change Manager to become a part of their Transformation and Change portfolio, who will play a critical part in delivering change across communities’ in New Zealand

Your new role
This role is a hands on, delivery focused role which guides, and influences change through the project delivery life cycle. You will be reporting to the Capability Manager, and ensure business readiness and the successful delivery of the organisations business outcomes.

Your main responsibilities as Change Manager will include:

  • Developing, owning and managing the stakeholder management, engagement and communications plans across the programme / project
  • Developing the change and transition plans and activities that need to take place
  • Identifying, developing and delivering change activities / interventions working with training developers and the business to achieve the change
  • Identifying activities to embed the process and system changes in the business
  • Measuring change effectiveness and identifying learning's across the work stream
  • Proactively addresses issues, looking for shared wins and outcomes

What you'll need to succeed
We are looking for an experienced leader, with considerable previous experience as a Change Manager. As a Change Manager, it is essential you take ownership and responsibility for delivering the Change and stakeholder management responsibilities within a programme or project.

What you'll get in return
You will have the opportunity to work in a rewarding environment, that is committed to your well being and development.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to catherine.vandermerwe@hays.net.nz

If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #2425188

name: General Manager Commercial
description:
THE COMPANY

Our client, Shoof International is a developer, manufacturer, importer, exporter, and marketer of veterinary and animal breeding equipment. Shoof Head Office is in Cambridge, New Zealand, with wholly owned subsidiary companies in Melbourne, Australia, and Osorno, Chile. They have a long and successful history and are proud to be a global innovation-led company.

THE CULTURE

Shoof have an innovative culture; their people and ideas are key to their success. They actively foster a culture where creativity thrives. Contributing to this is a commitment to research and development, a workplace environment that allows their people to imagine innovative ideas to solve customer challenges, and a senior management team that supports turning those ideas into reality.

THE ROLE

Reporting to the CEO, the General Manager – Commercial is their custodian of performance. Shoof operates in a multi-market environment, which means they must be across the numbers, constantly looking forward and reporting to ensure they are continually enhancing the position of the business. Most importantly they need to drive decisions, based on analytics / insights and reviewing ongoing performance, which enables growth. You are not necessarily a CA, however, you need to be across the numbers in detail, understand FX trading and be able to deliver on proactive commercial management to drive results.

Shoof has a firm belief that the quality of their leaders has the biggest impact on their work environment and business outcomes, therefore a focus on strategic leadership of your team and across the business will be a critical focus of the role. Your responsibilities will include commercial management, finance management, IT and support services, new ventures, business intelligence reporting, business risk / recovery management whilst delivering on projects that continually enhance the position of the business.

THE PERSON

To be successful, you will need to:

  • Be an expert in the numbers (P & L, Balance Sheet, FX, Margin / Profit Realisation)
  • Have a background in commercial management / finance
  • Believe in opportunity, accountability and driving change
  • Be approachable and empathetic
  • Have a robust understanding of finance fundamentals and how to translate into proactive commercial management
  • Be highly competent across ERP systems and Microsoft Office suite (particularly Excel)
  • Embrace diversity / change management
  • Work well at all organisational levels

In addition you will possess:

  • 5+ years’ leadership experience as a Senior Commercial Management professional
  • A proven track record in commercial management
  • Experience in SME Business Environment
  • A tertiary qualification in Business, Finance, Accounting, or a related field

In return, you will be part of a collaborative leadership team that drives strategy throughout the business. The role attracts an excellent remuneration package and is an opportunity for an energetic and strategic leader to make a considerable impact on the business.

For a confidential discussion about the role, please contact Sandra Diekerhof, Director, HR Connect Ltd on 027 52 666 99.

You must have the right to live and work in New Zealand to apply for this job.

Find out more about our innovative company at www.shoof.co.nz

name: CMS Developers - Expression of Interest
description:
Datacom is recognised as one of New Zealand's largest suppliers of Information Technology services. As a New Zealand-owned company, we have managed to maintain a small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and that buzz you can feel from the moment you meet with us.
Our mission is to deliver the best business value, without compromising quality, by engaging closely with our clients and fully understanding their requirements. With specialists in digital strategy, user experience and user interface design, analysis, architecture, development, testing and project management we design and build high performing web solutions for our clients.
The Role
You will be part of an award-winning, agile development team, building and maintaining customer web properties using CMS platforms. You will be working across a variety of large-scale projects for some of Australasia’s leading organisations. Our project pipeline is bulging at the seams and you will be amazed at the variety of projects we can offer. If you’re a .Net, Java or PHP Developer seeking variety, interesting projects and the ability to work with a fantastic team in an awesome environment, this is the role for you!
What’s in it for you? An excellent work environment where your ideas and input are welcomed and encouraged, where you have the freedom to get on with the job and have the backing of a highly experienced and knowledgeable team to support you and help you grow.
About You
We are looking for talented full-stack developers, with a strong Front-End focus to join our award-winning Enterprise team.
This is an opportunity to be involved with the development and implementation of new features and new projects. Working with other developers you'll tackle these in agile teams in a fun, relaxed culture with a focus on teamwork, quality, and innovation.

The ideal candidate will have:
Passion for web development.
3 +years of full stack development experience across .NET, Java or PHP
2+ years of experience developing web solutions.
Experience with Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, AEM, Wordpress, Drupal or Silverlight is preferred
Familiarity with DevOps.
The Company
Datacom is New Zealand's largest supplier of Information Technology professional services.
As a New Zealand-owned company, we have managed to maintain a dynamic small-business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.
At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We're growing year on year and can provide stability, career opportunity and a collegial, Agile, flat-structured environment that empowers people and promotes autonomy.
We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as

name: Senior Civil Engineer - Tauranga
description:
• Business is at the front end of some large-scale land development projects
  • Medium sized consultancy, busy post COVID-19 - Interviewing NOW
  • Down to earth team, young, dynamic organisation

A rapidly expanding NZ owned/operated consultancy specialising in Civil Engineering, Planning and Surveying is continuing to grow through excellent client relationships that have yielded some of NZ’s most poignant land development projects.

The business is seeking an experienced land development engineer that is CPEng (close to achieving this) and can offer an array of skills, technically skilled but has the ability to nurture excellent working relationships with a focused on delivery and outcomes. For more experienced engineers there is an opportunity to work in a "2IC capacity to lead, mentor and manage others.

The business is typically involved in large-scale residential land development and medium scale commercial brownfield integrated developments. Currently they are at the front end of 2 particular sizeable projects and as such are interviewing during lockdown for this important vacancy within the team.

Clients include a good mix of Housing NZ, Private developers, and large contractors.

The opportunity that exists is one of autonomy, opportunity to grow a team, overall business growth, and potential shareholding too.

Position Requirements:

  • Ideally 10+ years' consulting experience
  • BEng Civil (or equivalent)
  • CPEng status (or close to attaining)
  • Excellent technical understanding
  • Experience delivering end to end projects (consenting to sign-off)
  • To be an ambitious self-starter with a passion for civil engineering
  • Down to Earth, amiable personality that can add to a great team environment

The business operates as one, there's a group approach with shared staff resources from other regions to call upon. The business celebrates its flat structure, Director involvement, dynamism and client focus. The varied skills within the business are always sharing ideas and create a collaborative and supportive collegial environment. They’re professional but enjoy a bit of banter along the way.

The business is in a good place, the longevity of the projects will easily sustain the team well into the mid-2020’s.

Contact Ben Lapworth for more information (ben@eighty4recruitment.com | 09 280 4233). All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.

name: Software Developer - Local Government
description:
Our purpose
Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in
The Nitty Gritty
We have over 6,200 people across our global offices, and generate an annual revenue of over $1.2 billion, this makes us one of Australasia’s largest professional IT services companies. We have extensive expertise in operating data centres, providing IT services, software engineering and application management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. With this comes a long list of significant clients Datacom is committed to hiring, developing and promoting the best talent from a diverse range of backgrounds. We are local at heart, yet world-class in capability.
About the Role
The Developer role is responsible for the core coded business logic for the developed application or platform. It will be their job to understand the business requirements for a feature or component of the application or platform and deliver the code to fulfil those requirements.
A developer should be intimately familiar with the languages and design patterns used in the application and strive to deliver code that is well structured and maintainable.
They will be responsible for working with the relevant domain team members to ensure that all solutions are developed/coded and configured (including reporting) to ensure that the solution achieves the intended business requirements.
What you’ll bring
  • Strong C#, .Net Core, MS SQL, React, Rest Api’s, MVC skills
  • Devexpress, SpecFlow, xUnit would also be great to have
  • It is of further benefit for those applicants who have previously worked with ERP’s or CRM’s. eg: SAP, Dynamics
  • An ability to quickly and clearly understand new development requirements
  • Strong communication skills are a must as the role will involve dealing with multiple stakeholders
Responsibilities
  • Providing input into the feature design stage, estimation and sprint planning
  • Work with Product Manager, BA, Dev Lead, and domain team to design and deliver customer outcomes
  • Understand the business domain at a high level, and understand the feature & functions you are working on at a detailed level
  • Work with QA to design and run key functional tests as part of development activity
  • Work with the Business Analyst to resolve gaps or ambiguities in the functional design
  • Document the development done, including testing performed and any areas of risk or requiring QA focus
  • Develop code in a clear, maintainable way with a focus on ease of use & performance.
  • Be familiar with development frameworks and platform capabilities and use established, common design patterns. Develop for re-use wherever possible
Why you want to join us
At Datacom we believe that doing good, is good for business. We’ve maintained our local family feel whilst expanding globally, across Australia, ASIA, US and the UK. Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

name: Technology Senior Business Analyst
description:
Requisition Title -
Technology Senior Business Analyst

Job Number: - NEW042209

Description
  • Open Banking is an exciting opportunity to work with a broad range of internal, 3rd party and external stakeholders to create new customer propositions and capabilities
  • Solving new and interesting problems at scale by shaping a high performing culture that will set up the team for success
  • Join this highly customer focused, innovative and collaborative team environment and bring your business analysis expertise and knowledge
About The Role
As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering business analysis across medium to high complexity initiatives that delivers value to our Customers. As part of the Open Banking Programme there is potential to revolutionise the financial sector and be part of a team to drive transformation and innovation.

To achieve this, you will:
  • Apply your business analysis skills and techniques to understand, validate and articulate business problems, opportunities, requirements, options and solutions.
  • Critical thinker with strong conceptual, analytical, financial, and problem solving skills.
  • Share your knowledge to support the growth of those around you.
  • Apply your natural eye on identifying opportunities to deliver customer centric benefits.
  • Help to deliver our roadmap across a range of specialist technology areas with a focus on continuous improvement.
  • Strong communication and influencing skills at all levels.
  • Join a fantastic team that is consistently growing and changing, and who will truly value the role you play.
Role Location: Wellington CBD
Role Type: Permanent, full-time opportunity

About You
To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:
  • A proven track record as a Senior Business Analyst within Technology.
  • Exposure to or experience with complex system environments and interface mapping.
  • Proven experience capturing and managing requirements.
  • Proven experience of operating within Agile practices. You will have an adaptable approach, with a hands on, team focused mind-set.
  • Proven experience in the creation of user stories, acceptance criteria and specification by example.
  • Participator and facilitator of relevant Agile ceremonies and rituals: backlog refinement, daily Stand-up, iteration/release planning, showcases/sprint review, retrospective.
  • Exceptional organisational and analytical skills with the ability to work to tight deadlines.
  • Well-developed relationship building skills and demonstrated ability to build rapport with, and influence key stakeholders.
  • Excellent communication skills, and a ‘team player’ attitude. You will be spending your day working alongside other business analysts, developers, testers and product owners and you will need to be able to communicate complex issues and be good at asking hard questions at the right time.
  • Although not essential, payments system experience and exposure to JIRA and Confluence is advantageous.
Some of our other benefits include:
  • Various leave options, including family Leave, parental Leave (26 weeks fully paid), lifestyle Leave
  • Staff Banking and Insurance benefits
  • Dedicated online learning & development portal to develop your skills and career
  • Southern Cross Health Insurance
To find out more about what it is like to work in ANZ’s Technology team watch this short video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6ccJeITDTc&feature=youtu.be&fbclid=IwAR0laTpfWblMpT3vKZMqMOEleQpRwKOEJZvrS4KnQYou6Y8k_qkdtOZBxms
About ANZ
Our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. That’s why we strive to create a balanced, sustainable economy in which everyone can take part and build a better life. By helping people make the most of what they have, we transform ideas, hard work and ambition into reality.
ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.
The ANZ values are the foundation of how we work and support our customers.
Integrity – We are honest and fair
Collaboration – We work together for the customer
Accountability – We take ownership and get things done
Respect – We care for all those we serve
Excellence – We challenge ourselves to be better
We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you.
ANZ recognises the importance of flexible working, watch our Global Stories to see how ANZ aims to meet the needs of our customers and to attract and retain the best people in a changing world.
To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit http://www.anz.co.nz/careers
You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for the reference number NEW042209.
Applications close 16 October 2020 although we reserve the option to withdraw the ad should sufficient suitable candidates apply prior to closing date.
Please note, because of the urgency of this role and current COVID-19 related NZ Border restrictions, applications will only be considered from those that have a current, indefinite and unrestricted right to work in New Zealand.
** No sponsorship or visa support can be provided at this time. **

name: Senior & Principal Recruiters
description:
At Talent Army we work with tech start-ups, agencies and growing companies that are scaling and help them find awesome people to help them scale.

We've just turned FIVE and since Talent Army was founded the team has been growing VERY fast. We have offices in Wellington and Auckland and work in Australia and the United States.

Crazily, we are yet to make a single sales call at all and every day we get approached by amazing new clients that keep referring new companies to us.

This means we need Senior & Principal recruiters based in Wellington to help 'US' scale too.

A bit about us.

We tend not to take ourselves too seriously and threw out all our suits and business attire and now 'wear whatever we want!' We are proactive in the way we source people (LinkedIn, Github, Meetups, Chrome extensions, and any tool that helps us reach good tech candidates!) If you don't know how to use these we can teach you.

We're informal, honest, and collaborative with clients, candidates, and between our team.

What we care about the most is to provide excellent 'no bullsh*t service to our clients and help lift the profile of the recruitment industry.

We also operate a 4-day work week and you get paid the 5 days.

On top of all the above; we pay well, pay commission, have a conference budget, and do a lot of cool things as a team. For example: At the end of every month we have #TalentArmyAFK (Talent Army Away from Keyboard) where we get out of the office for the day and do something fun. The last two months we did axe throwing and how to make a barista coffee from our machine.

We also have a private island holiday in Fiji booked when Covid allows us.

Our clients trust us as their recruitment team and work exclusively with us. This makes a huge difference and we have clients that give us keys to their office, let us use their email domain and truly treat us as an employee or a partner.

We like sharing what we know, as we like learning new stuff. Be it a new recruitment tool or the last trends in the tech world. We quite like attending tech and recruitment conferences too and can usually be found at most of them.

Last but not least...have a look at Talent Army website to see if you share our vision of how recruitment should be like!

Don't come here if you want a boring easy throw an ad up online and send the 3 best candidates that apply. We tend to operate faster and deal directly with founders and managers.

Do come here if you have the below:

What you will do:
  • Build really good relationships with your clients - you'll be talking directly to start ups founders, and giving them advice as well as candidates! Sometimes we even work onsite to really understand the work they are doing.
  • Source good developers, digital designers, testers, project managers, development managers, product managers, tech leads and all-round great tech people, both in NZ and worldwide.
  • Keep on learning about the IT & Recruitment trends (Meetups and conferences are always welcome).
  • Work collaboratively and dynamically within the team.
  • Be yourself. No need to dress up (unless you want to!). If you don't know something, just ask. If you know a better way to do things, share it with us. If you don't like beer/wine, just ask for your sugar-free almond milk (but if you do like beer/wine, you'll always find some in the fridge!).
  • Share your knowledge - we're all about sharing our strengths, and growing as a team.
What skills & experience are we looking for?
  • Someone who loves getting to know their clients, and is really able to understand their needs.
  • Sound experience across Account Management and sourcing, be as an agency or internal recruiter. What matters here is that you know how things work so you will be able to manage your time strategically.
  • Experience within the tech industry. IT has its own rules and requires us to do our homework to be successful. We're often reading blogs and attending tech conferences.
  • Team player, proactive, passionate.

I love a good cover letter and so tell me what you can achieve here in 4 days and what you will want to do on your paid day off.

name: UX/UI Designer - Wellington or Christchurch based opportunit...
description:
UX/UI Designer - Wellington or Christchurch based opportunity


Kaihoahoa UX/UI [Wheako kaiwhakamahi/Atanga kaiwhakamahi]

About Us | Mō mātou

At Tatauranga Aotearoa, Stats NZ, our vision is to unleash the power of data to change lives. As New Zealand’s official data and statistics agency, we are tasked with leading the way for New Zealand’s data future, enabling data-led innovation across society, the economy, and the environment.

The role | Mō te tūnga

As part of the Customer Experience unit, the UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing UX/UI skills to ensure we understand the customer during the process of product development (e.g. website, data tools). You will be working with Senior UX/UI designers, content designers and a product owner who have a strong focus on making things easier for our customers.

The UX/UI Designer plays a key role in providing a solid understanding of the customer through research and testing products. With an increasing demand from our customers to improve the way we deliver our products, the UX/UI Designer will provide key evidence to support decision-making during the product development process. The UX/UI designer will help build relationships across the organisation.

This is a very exciting time to be joining our team and be part of wider changes within the organisation. No two days will be the same in this influential and critical role in better understanding customer needs.

Focusing on development projects and shaping methods that will ensure a better customer experience, the UX/UI Designer will:

  • work closely with Customer Experience teams to support a range of initiatives
  • provide expertise on projects that will improve our products for our customers
  • assist with customer testing and research that will be the source of truth for best practice across the organisation
  • be the voice of external customers and work alongside others within the organisation to create success in what we deliver
  • engage with customers to understand their needs and requirements
  • embrace opportunities to work with other parts of the organisation, seeking opportunities to embed UX best practice
  • work closely with other relevant UX experts across government to foster collaboration and governance

Starting salary: $63,000 - $71,000 negotiable depending on the skills and experience of the successful applicant.

About you | Mōu

To succeed in this role, you will:

  • be familiar with research methods using a variety of user research and testing methods to reveal customer insights
  • have a good understanding of product development and user testing methodologies
  • have great communication and relationship management skills – with both working with customers and influencing stakeholders
  • be able to maintain a strong customer focus and understanding to inform development
  • share learnings and developing best practice to support the organisation
  • work in an agile development environment with analysts, designers, developers, and software teams to create customer-focused products and services.

Desired skills:

  • Have experience working in service design and/or working in a service design environment
  • Ability to work proactively within a team environment and take on new challenges with ease
  • Ability to help build consensus and facilitate discussions

How to apply | Me pēhea te tuku tono

If the above matches your skills and experience, click apply and upload your CV and cover letter. To view position description, paste this link https://bit.ly/3kxGzfI into your browser.

Any questions that haven’t been answered in this advert or the position description or if you have difficulty with your application please email jobs@stats.govt.nz.

We will be screening applications as we receive them in order to move swiftly to interview shortly after the advert closes on date. Note to Recruitment Agencies: unsolicited CVs will not be accepted.

You must have the right to live and work in Aotearoa New Zealand to apply for this job.

Applications close Thursday 8 October 2020.

name: Commercial Property Lawyer | Senior Solicitor
description:
Our client is an established law firm who are well known for building trusting client relationships while delivering personalised legal advice. They have a solid commercial property team that works with a range of clients such as public sector entities, developers, investors and various businesses in the private sector.

Working with a supportive partner who has extensive experience in this sector, you will gain experience in a range of matters across the commercial property spectrum including acquisitions and disposals of buildings, development projects for master-planned communities, advising on complex commercial leasing arrangements and large property subdivisions. The firm is known to treat its staff well and there is collegiality with other juniors and seniors as part of the team as well.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • 4+ years' experience in the property field.
  • Some experience in commercial property transactional property work and an interest in developing your career in complex and high-end development work as well.
  • A good academic record.

This is a great opportunity to advance your career with a firm that offers an interesting mix of commercial property work while being mentored by the best.

For further information, contact Harrison on 027 2745 926 or email your CV and academic record by clicking 'APPLY' now.

name: Technical Lead Back-End
description:
We’re looking for an experienced senior level technical leader who wants to be part of a growing SaaS company.

This is your chance to get involved from a leadership perspective, maintaining a hands-on element and making key technical decisions.

With an overall team of 18 people, as the lead back end developer you’ll head a team of 5 (with strong potential for growth) working closely with the CTO build technical strategy and enhance the overall capability. You’ll need to have exceptional skills across C#, extending into software architecture, but above all you’ll need to be motivational, inspirational culture is extremely important.

The role will include:
Leading technical development of key back-end (C#) features, including mentoring other team members involved in delivering those features

Experience with containerised and serverless microservices/APIdesign

DevOps experience on AWS or Azure – using CI or CD

.NET Core, async C# code development, WebAPI, SQL Server 2017

Building and meeting expectations for productivity, quality, continuous improvement, and goal accomplishment

Working with the product owner, architect and front-end lead developer in planning and designing new features

Promoting a focus on DevOps during design, development and deployment

So, you’ll not only need to be strong technically, but proven as a leader too. We’ll be looking for recent leadership experience in your background!

This organisation have adapted well over the past 6 months, just gone through one growth spurt and are going through a high performing quarter. As you’ll have significant skills and knowledge, there’s an superb salary of $150-170k available (dependent on experience), a superb culture with flexibility around working from home and great career opportunities. This role is currently based in Lower Hutt with plans to move to Petone in the new year.

If you’re keen and have the skills required; apply as soon as possible. The closing date is when the right person has been offered the role so don’t delay your application. If you’d like further information contact Chris Kent on chris.kent@beyond.co.nz

name: CMS Developers - EOI
description:
Datacom is recognised as one of New Zealand's largest suppliers of Information Technology services. As a New Zealand-owned company, we have managed to maintain a small business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and that buzz you can feel from the moment you meet with us.
Our mission is to deliver the best business value, without compromising quality, by engaging closely with our clients and fully understanding their requirements. With specialists in digital strategy, user experience and user interface design, analysis, architecture, development, testing and project management we design and build high performing web solutions for our clients.
The Role
You will be part of an award-winning, agile development team, building and maintaining customer web properties using CMS platforms. You will be working across a variety of large-scale projects for some of Australasia’s leading organisations. Our project pipeline is bulging at the seams and you will be amazed at the variety of projects we can offer. If you’re a .Net, Java or PHP Developer seeking variety, interesting projects and the ability to work with a fantastic team in an awesome environment, this is the role for you!
What’s in it for you? An excellent work environment where your ideas and input are welcomed and encouraged, where you have the freedom to get on with the job and have the backing of a highly experienced and knowledgeable team to support you and help you grow.
About You
We are looking for talented full-stack developers, with a strong Front-End focus to join our award-winning Enterprise team.
This is an opportunity to be involved with the development and implementation of new features and new projects. Working with other developers you'll tackle these in agile teams in a fun, relaxed culture with a focus on teamwork, quality, and innovation.

The ideal candidate will have:
  • Passion for web development.
  • 3 +years of full stack development experience across .NET, Java or PHP
  • 2+ years of experience developing web solutions.
  • Experience with Kentico, Sitecore, Umbraco, AEM, Wordpress, Drupal or Silverlight is preferred
  • Familiarity with DevOps.
The Company
Datacom is New Zealand's largest supplier of Information Technology professional services.
As a New Zealand-owned company, we have managed to maintain a dynamic small-business feel that is often diluted in larger organisations of our size. It's our people that give Datacom its unique culture and energy that you can feel from the moment you meet with us.
At Datacom you'll be recognised and valued for your contributions. We're growing year on year and can provide stability, career opportunity and a collegial, Agile, flat-structured environment that empowers people and promotes autonomy.
We care about our people and provide a range of perks such as fresh fruit, chill-out spaces, a gaming zone, flexi-hours, professional development courses and health insurance to name a few. We operate at the leading edge of technology to help NZ's largest enterprise organisations, so you will never run out of interesting new challenges and opportunities.
